Description: Richly malty and long on the palate with just enough hop backing to make this beautiful amber colored alt style beer notably well balanced

This malty full bodied double alt is also known as Stickebier German slang for secret brew Long Trail Double Bag was originally offered only in our brewery taproom as special treat to our visitors With an alcohol content of please indulge in moderation The Long Trail Brewing Company is proud to have Double Bag named Malt Advocate Beer of the Year in Malt Advocate is national magazine devoted to expanding the boundaries of fine drinks Their panel of judges likes to keep things simple and therefore of thousands of eligible competitors they award only two categories Imported and Domestic It is great honor to receive this recognition IBU

Long Trail Ale is full bodied amber ale modeled after the Alt biers of Düsseldorf Germany Our top fermenting yeast and cold finishing temperature result in complex yet clean full flavor Originally introduced in November of Long Trail Ale beer quickly became and remains the largest selling craft brew in Vermont It is multiple medal winner at the Great American Beer Festival IBU

Just cause it dark and German doesn mean it an alt Based on the obscure Kottbusser style of beer this surprisingly dry beer retains all the aroma and nuance of honey from bees and molasses not from bees creating perception of sweetness through cool controlled fermentation Because we re sweet enough damn it IBU

Called Dark Double Alt on the label Seize the season with Sleigh Layers of deeply toasted malt are balanced by just enough hop bitterness to make it deceivingly drinkable Paired with dry finish Sleigh is anything but your typical winter brew An Alt ferments with Ale yeast at colder lagering temperatures This effect gives Alts more refined crisp lager like flavor than traditional ales The Alt has been Ninkasified raising the ABV and IBUs Sleigh has deep toasted malt flavor that finishes dry and balanced IBU
Classified as German Altbier by the Widmer Brothers brewed with an ale Alt yeast strain availability early Aug late Oct bitterness IBUoriginal gravity PLATO

OMB flagship Copper is an authentic Düsseldorf style Altbier or Amber Ale There are no crazy flavors or gimmicks with Copper its full flavored start transitions to smooth balanced easy drinking finish It the beer that tastes like beer

Uerige Alt is the most bittered beer in Germany In spite of this or just for that reason this legendary Altbier from Düsseldorf is so full bodied aromatic and wholesome Our top fermented specialty has been brewed since from barley malt caramel malt roasted malt hops water and with our very special Uerige yeast Our Uerige Alt is regularly chosen among the ten best beers in Germany It has an alcohol content of and minimum fresh date of eight weeks Unser Uerige Alt wird regelmäßig unter die zehn besten Biere Deutschlands gewählt Es hat einen Alkoholgehalt von und ein Mindestfrischedatum von acht Wochen

Check out piece of Nashville brewing history Gerst Brewery was the original Nashville brewery but never recovered after prohibition We are excited to partner with the Chandler Family owners of the Gerst Haus Restaurant to bring this beer back right where it belongs Nashville Tennessee This is very clean beer with mostly German malts and hint of flaked maize remaining as true as possible to the original Gerst recipe IBUs

This ale is the first brewed in Kansas since pioneering days The name Ad Astra comes from the Kansas State Motto Ad Astra per Aspera Latin words meaning To the Stars through Difficulties We ve blended Pale Caramel and Munich malts for rich amber beer The hops balance this malty sweetness and we ve chosen Northern brewer and Fuggles hops for their flavor IBU

This fruity estery double altbier is brewed in the traditional ish style of the Doppelsticke which is the widely known secret Germanic esque strong ale Like it California Common counterpart we fermented this ale at lower temperature to pull out the sulphur bite from the yeast then dry hopped it with some dank Sticky hops including some brand spankin new Enigma hops from the great Down Under IBUs

The name isn a coincidence This Düsseldorf style Altbier blends caramelized malted barley with pronounced hop character to create subtle copper hue Copperhead Ale is famous for its signature balanced flavor impeccable smoothness

A Doppelsticke Altbier brewed for Victory Brewing th Anniversary released in Feb and debuting at BeerAdvocate rd Annual Extreme Beer Fest in dark ale with malty depth but with the fragrance and bold brassy tang of European hops According to Victory they believe that this could be the first Doppelsticke brewed in the US

Three Blind Mice is inspired by our favorite qualities from English brown ales German altbiers and Irish reds Mother trio of beer connoisseurs sipped away many night working to find this ideal combination Mother beautiful brown beer is medium bodied with caramel toffee and subtle chocolate malt flavors all balanced by moderate hop notes and clean dry finish Three Blind Mice combines components of several malty beers for the unique brown beer experience you ve been missing After lots of research to find the perfect styles for our base the clear winners were the lighter body and caramel characters of Irish red ales the soft chocolate and toffee flavors from English brown ales and the hop component and balance of German altbiers We used traditional elements from each beer style and added our own touch for one incredible brown beer IBU

Ishmael is our richly flavored American copper ale This American interpretation of the altbiers of Düsseldorf is brewed with continental Munich malt American grown hops and clean fermenting ale yeast to produce slightly sweet and malty beer balanced by firm bitterness

This is traditional style of altbeir from Düsseldorf Germany Alt literally means old in German Staying as true to the recipe as possible the Headwall Alt is brewed using German malts plus German and American hops Like the Pale Ale the Headwall Alt is cold conditioned dry hopped and krausened in the bottle or keg Similar to the Pale Ale the process takes about days

One of Warren favorite pastimes back in the was trip to the city dump to shoot rats so much that it was common date for him and his wife to be Casey The manager of the city dump was John Schmaltz hence the nickname Schmaltz Marti We hope you enjoy our Schmaltz Alt creamy smooth dark alt brewed even better than before

A Brewing TraditionThis German style Altbier is our nod to an old world old school ale The word Alt is German for old and refers to the traditional style of brewing before lager yeast was discovered Balt is dark copper colored brew with creamy head gentle bitterness and clean dry finish Prost Hon BITTERNESS IBU COLOR Copper AmberMALT Pilsner Munich Cara Munich CarafaHOPS Perle TettnangYEAST German Alt

An assertively hoppy top fermented beer polished by the wisdom and patience of lagering Think of it as an octogenarian with punk rock attitude Slightly dry this beer pairs well with hearty cuisine We also suggest sipping it on its own the complexity will keep you entertained and happy IBU

Our German style Alt has brilliant amber hue and silky smooth medium body Its light tan head is thick retaining and laces the glass all the way down Noble hop aroma up front finishes with caramel malt nose Our old world brewing method brings out light toasted bread flavor you ll want to savor again and again It a mouthwatering thirst quenching delight

Zipline Brewing Co Copper Alt is an altbier which is unique German hybrid between an ale and lager This bronzed brew is designed to be extremely drinkable with subtle nuances of chocolate and hazelnut late gift of Sterling hops in this brew leaves little hoppiness for your palate to ponder before the next sip Hops Magnum Hallertau SterlingMalts Pilsner Carahell Special Caramel Carafa ABV IBUGold medal for German Style Altbier at the GABF
Malts Pilsner Pale Caramel Caramel IBU Hops Magnum Brewer HallertauOG ºP FG ºP SRM month aging

Inspired by the original Alt style beer of Dusseldorf Crooked Coast brings together the aromas of German noble hops and Munich malt to produce very refreshing and mellow ale that is the perfect companion on any shape of coast

Altbier is German for Old Beer this refers to the old style of brewing using an ale yeast As opposed to lager yeast fermentation which is relatively new process This beer originated in the Westphalia region of Germany in town named Dusseldorf Due to the cool climate of Dusseldorf Altbiers employee an ale yeast that has evolved over time to ferment at somewhat cooler temperature than that of other ale yeasts This cool fermentation produces subtle yeast derived esters and leaves clean malty beer In addition to this cool clean fermentation altbiers are then lagered at cold temperatures to help smooth and refine the beer The result of this is very clean and hoppy red ale Coming in at ABV and IBUs Little Red Cap is an easy drinking hop forward beer worthy of its heritage We use bit of Cascade hop to give it an American Twist while maintaining its German heritage This beer won Gold Medal at the and GABF and Bronze at the GABF It also won Silver Award at the World beer cup

Festivale is an amber ale with balanced high intensity maltiness and hop presence Caramunich malts give Festivale its colour and rich caramel sweetness Festivale bucks the trend of pale summer beers offering up amber hues and tastiness for unique result that is both quaffable and refreshing IBU

Our goal is to have very drinkable beer with nice smoked quality that will pair well with food and be something little different We blend good amount of German Rauch malt that is smoked with beachwood with US two row malt Crystal Crystal and bit of Pale Chocolate Malt We use enough US Magnum Willamette hops to balance the malty sweetness of the German Alt yeast used to ferment the beer That leaves moderately smokey notes that comes through mostly in the flavor that is balanced with the slight fruity flavor that the Alt yeast will give you very session able smoked ale with enough bitterness to balance the other flavors

Our Alt is much stronger version of the traditional Dusseldorf Altbiers An ancient style from the Rhineland Altbiers are ales that were virtually wiped out by German lagers in the We use plenty of European hops and German pilsner malts to brew remarkably clean beer We then rest it in the cooler for two months to achieve the mellow finish that is the Überalt trademark

With goal of celebrating Creemore th anniversary in big way Creemore Brewmaster Gordon Fuller and head brewer Bryan Egan travelled to Düsseldorf in early to immerse themselves in German brewing culture Learning trade secrets from the brewers at Zum Schlüssel allowed them to create unique and special variety of their own Altbier at home in Canada Follow their journey on our blog IBU
IBUPilsner CaraPils and Vienna MaltsHallertau Mittelfruh HopsAle YeastDeep Well Water
Our altbier is crafted after the authentic or sticke style that originated in Germany It is extremely malty aggressively hoppy and cold conditioned for clean smooth finish

A German style pale ale debatably does not exist in the craft beer industry Until now Nations German Pale Ale GPA is our experiment turned calling card We couldn be more proud of the way this beer enormous citrus passion fruit and lemony like aromas blend with bitterness that gives it recognizable finish Plus the well rounded malt profile balances out the American hops That right we used American hops to brew this cross of German Alt Koelsch It not blasphemy Just revised version of traditional style with little greatness mixed in
This beer has won bronze silver and gold as an Alt at the Great american beer festival and now silver at the world beer cup as an Alt

Bigfoot is beast of beer brimming with bold flavors of bittersweet malt and heaps of aggressive whole cone Pacific Northwest hops First introduced in the winter of Bigfoot is cult classic beer brewed in the barleywine style meaning strong robust bruiser of beer with the refined intensity of wine Bigfoot is prized by beer collectors for its supreme cellarability Under the proper conditions it can age like fine wine developing new flavors and character as it matures in the bottle Each new release or expedition is vintage dated Collect your own and see the flavors develop and progress
From Bell website Third Coast Old Ale is cellerable American style barleywine that has notes of dried fruit and caramel embedded in rich malt background that will grow more complex over time
Bold yet smooth Fermented with dates and figs this bone crushing barleywine has unique flavor IBUABV varies from
Aged for year in used bourbon barrels

Old Ruffian is hefty hop forward barley wine Seemingly mellow at the start with subtle fruit aromas and complex caramel sweetness it quickly becomes aggressive with its bold hop flavors and huge hop bitterness Ultimately the big body succulent sweetness and massive hop character come together to work wonders on your palate

Massive amounts of barley malts combined with fresh harvest American hops make it aromatic and spicy on the nose Floral fruity aromas slide into honeyed malt depth with lingering sensations of candied and citrus fruit Late warming alcohol brings all of these flavors into wonderful harmony to finish Malt Imported row German maltsHops Whole flower American hopsFood Pairings Meat pies and English cheese

This strong alluring ale is two beers in one Cracking open fresh bottle unleashes hops and heat with more than IBUs emanating from three hop varieties and sweet burn of ABV Cellaring the Flying Mouflan in cool dark place at degrees for minimum of four months will mellow out the hops and wash away the heat If you can resist temptation you will be rewarded with two memorable beers in single bottle

Barley Wine made in the West Coast style Big malt and hops make this copper colored ale one of our most popular products Produced in September and October and released in November this Beer will improve for years to come Alcohol by volume IBU
Barleywine style ale brewed with Galaxy Hops starting gravity of Plato Aged eleven months in Cognac barrels

Part of the adventure of aging beer in retired spirits barrels is the synergistic interaction of different malt flavors with the oak and spirit flavors from the barrel Darker beers like stouts and darker barley wines have typically been the favored candidates for barrel aging due to their deeper caramel and roasted flavors Helldorado breaks that mold with deep golden color from being brewed solely with English and American pale malts The bready honeyed flavors of pale malts pull out rich wildflower honey vanilla and coconut notes from the oak creating an overall flavor evocative of bourbon glazed graham crackers that stands as singularly unique in our Vintage lineup
Aged in bourbon barrels IBU

This noble winter beer is brown in colour with flaming red highlights It has complex aroma of fruits alcohol and hops Its taste is delicately sweet and liquor like with hint of burnt caramel It is very bitter beer with aromas and flavours reminiscent of red fruit The aftertaste is accentuated by the wonderful flavour of hops
Rich and complex this all malt barley wine exhibits hints of dried fruits toffee and caramel balanced by an abundance of American hops IBU

This limited small batch release is dark garnet red in color with candied fruit like aroma and flavor At ABV Killer Penguin is big barleywine that comes across very smooth and extremely balanced the perfect beer to share among friends
The base of this beer was available at couple of festivals as barleywine named Good The remainder of the batch spent several months aging in fresh Jack Daniels barrels and became Great

From the aroma and notes of sweet honeysuckle pineapple and grapefruit to richer hints of burnt sugar and toffee this intriguing brew is full of complex flavors The distinct character of toasted oak adds depth and contrasts the light fruit sweetness This unique take on barley wine ale surprises with its smoothness and balance of fruit hop citrus and warmth Hops Nelson Sauvin ZeusMalts Two Row Harrington Metcalfe Copeland Pale Paul CaramaltAged on toasted oak

The Duck Rabbit Barleywine is the hoppiest of all the Duck Rabbit brews This is Farmville style Barleywine crafted the way brewers in Farmville have always done Loads of Amarillo hops give piney citrusy bitterness that supported beautifully by toffee malt backbone
We brewed The Vermonster with pounds of malt per barrel and jacked up the pour into wide mouth thin glass goblet

First brewed in England these potent malty monsters were frequently aged before being put into small bottles and sold as strong beers or even medicinal tonics The American version has been blown up with more alcohol larger bottles and more hops Smuttynose Barleywine straddles these two branches of the barleywine tree When you taste it you ll notice deep rich caramel malt flavors balanced with hop bitterness Fruity hop flavors act as garnish for its amped up but classic flavor For more refined experience tuck few bottles away for year or two The alcohol will mellow and the hop aromas will fade into the background leaving the luscious malt to shine on its own IBU

Did you also at some point in your life get seduced by promising words like probably not the best in the world it doesn really work every time etc This American Barley Wine says it how it is It intense attention seekingly hoppy and definitely your kind of beer beer with big ego drive and huge thirst for recognition

A West Coast style barleywine huge malt profile and very aggressive dose of premium domestic hops give Old Numbskull tantalizing complexity from the aroma to the aftertaste year spent in bourbon barrels adds amazing depth and complexity

Our award winning barleywine will seduce you with its assertive hop bill that changes each year to make each vintage unique citrus flavors and warming ABV Devil Milk is best served in snifter to accommodate its ABV and allow complex flavors to emerge as it warms in your hands

Chicken Killer Barley Wine is the revolutionary beer that will someday define America unique Barley Wine style It is brewed with twice the ingredients of the Santa Fe Brewing Company other beers and only half the usual amount of liquid is extracted from these ingredients This makes one substantial beer At over ten percent alcohol Chicken Killer is actually as substantial as wine but this is not to say that it is difficult to drink On the contrary be careful with this one The flavors of the beer are at first as overwhelming as the intense Santa Fe sun But in the same way our sun gives us the unrivaled brilliant colors of Santa Fe the potency of Chicken Killer gives us the remarkable spectrum of flavors that can be found in no other beer in no other city If you did not have the opportunity to try last year vintage come try this year

This Barrington cold brewed coffee infused blonde barleywine is the luminous counterpart to our dark rich imperial stout In Day Night we envisioned the blonde barleywine style as way to showcase the nuanced floral fruity and spicy characteristics found in medium and lighter roast coffee blends Golden Amber in color Day Night exudes delightful aromas of almond toffee graham crackers fruity coffee lightly acidic berries and vanilla Upfront flavors of creamy coffee honey tinged malt caramel and tart berry blend cleanly with slight coffee derived bitterness MALT Pilsner Abbey Turbinado SugarHOPS Columbus
IBU

We aged limited quantity of our award winning Brewer Association of Maryland Governor Cup gold medal winner in and Barleywine Devil Milk in Kentucky White Oak Bourbon barrels to create uniquely tempting new brew Hell On Wood is medium full bodied and amber in color with thin persistent off white head Its mesmerizing citrus flavors and aromas accented by notes of charred oak vanilla and caramelized sugar give way to palate dominating hop finish balanced by smoky bourbon character and warming alcohol presence alcohol by volume There no escape prepare to fall to the seductive power of Hell On Wood
Our special barley wine is made with English row barley and Vienna malt Its robust malty caramel flavor is balanced by lots and lots of hops giving it great depth of character

Dedicated to CrustaceansThe name sort of says it all John Maier our Brewmaster wanted to create beer that defied traditional style definitions The result was remarkably hoppy yet balanced and malty ale that quickly became cult favorite in our Newport brewpub But what was it It was not quite barley wine and not quite double or imperial IPA Who really cares about putting beers into narrow categories Great beer just drink it and enjoy IBU

Father Christmas Head Beardo St Nicholas Cage man of many names he may be yet he has but one true foe This Holiday Season the Unicorn is back bearing his mantle of rainbowed chaos and this time it seasonal bitches An Imperial Red Ale American Style Barleywine or Red Double IPA call it what you will grab one and get your Jollies while the holiday fight is on

Bronze Medal Winner World Beer Championships Barleywines Old Backus contains just over pounds of malt and pounds of hops The original gravity is which contributes to an alcohol content of by volume This is tremendously complex beer that should be savoured slowly and in moderation It will continue to change with age as it is served unfiltered This barleywine is named after Richard Backus an old friend to the Brewery

Aged in the third use barrels that were once home to Kentucky bourbon and then our renowned Bourbon County Stout this traditional English style barleywine possesses the subtlety of flavor that only comes from barrel that gone through many seasons of ritual care The intricacies of the previous barrel denizens oak charcoal hints of tobacco and vanilla and that signature bourbon heat are all present in this beer Hearty and complex Bourbon County Brand Barleywine is titan and timeline bold flavorful journey through the craft of barrel aging

Insanity ABV is made by aging our Blithering Idiot Barleywine Ale in whiskey barrels The barrel aging imparts an additional level of complexity to an already intense malt profile by adding combination of vanilla oak and whiskey notes

Old Foghorn is brewed based on historic English barleywine methods It is highly hopped fermented with true top fermenting ale yeast carbonated by natural process called bunging to produce champagne like bubbles and dry hopped with additional Cascade hops while it ages in our cellars Made only from first wort the rich first runnings of an all malt mash three mashes are required to produce just one barleywine brew ABV varies slightly over the years

Bottled kegged vintages Released February Released April Released April The Reserve Series romance all began with our first release of this limited edition brew Mirror Mirror born of double batch of Mirror Pond Pale Ale is an inspired barley wine ale layered with intriguing nuances Explore this latest incarnation and enjoy its delicious complexity in every sip IBU

Arctic Devil Barley Wine aptly named after the ferocious wolverine of the north is an English style meaning malt inclined barley wine Though the recipe and process for Arctic Devil have evolved over the years it is brewed once year then aged in oak barrels for several months before the entire batch is blended bottled and released In its youth Arctic Devil gnarls and snarls its way across the palate Containing this beast of beer for long periods in oak barrels some having previously aged port wine or whiskey tames the unleashed malt and fierce hop flavors melding and mellowing this powerful liquid into an incredible elixir worthy of brewer table Each annual batch of Arctic Devil Barley Wine represents the brewers resolve to create an intriguing and sought after barley wine by precisely brewing to well designed specifications carefully selecting the type and combination of barrels to use for aging and meticulously checking the beer as it ages Distinct nuance and complexity are contributed by the wood previous tenants resulting in unique flavor profiles in each batch that continue to change over time We invite you to savor Arctic Devil Barley Wine upon its release then cellar some for future enjoyment IBU
Barrel Aged Institutionalized strong ale to warm your insides in the dead of winter Deep aromas and flavors of dark stone fruits bourbon molasses toasted coconut and vanilla come in waves IBU

Aaron Hill was our great great great grandfather who operated the original tavern in North Greensboro an industrious inventive and indomitable figure in the community The Hill Farmstead Brewery logo is based upin the tavern original sign In his honor we crafted this barleywine at the outest of our venture It has rested unhurriedly and undisturbed for over years in bourbon barrels from some of our favorite distilleries absorbing the essence of its surroundings and history Bottle conditioned for months

Brewed in the tradition of English style barley wines Cereal Killer offers an explosion of full bodied liquid goodness Robust malty flavors converge with caramel toffee molasses and dark fruit notes to produce remarkably complex and palate pleasing beer Its intense malt character is complemented by subtle citrus finish from the crystal hops With cellar aging Cereal Killer flavor evolves further developing sherry like aroma and flavor similar to cask aged port Winner of the Silver Medal for Barley Wine Style Ale at the GABF

Our Oak Aged Barleywine has deep copper color and an intense malt flavor balanced by assertive hops Fermentation with American ale yeast allows the caramel malt to shine We age the beer on new medium toast Missouri Oak to enhance its complexity and to develop its smooth luscious character Barleywine is classic English style hearty ale The term refers to beer with the potency of wine and is often vintage dated This beer will continue to age well in cool dark place for several years but it is ready to enjoy now IBU

An English Barleywine aged in Bourbon barrels Mash is an intense yet balanced beer with notes of burnt caramel toasted bread ripe pear dried figs vanilla toasted coconut and finishes with oak tannin This has become an instant favorite around the brewery due to its balance subtle complexities and overwhelming deliciousness
Church on Hill aged in apple brandy barrels

Malty and complex this big beer has strong caramel backbone supporting oak and whiskey flavors with hints of dark fruits The nose wafts of coconut toffee and smooth hint of alcohol The flavor and aroma meld becoming one after just single sip This beer is ready to drink but also ages with the best of them
An English style classic with rich flavors from time spent aging in Bourbon barrels plus fresh roasted coffee from Portola Coffee Lab
This fully fermented ale can be enjoyed now or laid down like fine wine for enjoyment to come
English style barleywine brewed with Maris Otter pale Aromatic and caramel malts then balanced with English Nugget and Kent Goldings hops Aged in Angel Envy bourbon barrels for nearly months

Robust Dark and Smooth hold on to your hat cause you ll lose your feet on this one Brewed with pale dark crystal Munich flaked barley black and chocolate malts Hops include Cascade Crystal Challenger and Perle
Millennium is brewed in the barley wine style to commemorate our th batch of beer Its generous hopping bottle conditioning allow this beer to be cellared and enjoyed for many years

A long slow fermentation and cold aging makes Irish Walker well rounded complex Barley Wine Ale Released only once year it exhibits malty sweetness fruity esters and hoppy balance This ale will age well for years to come

This is our bourbon barrel aged imperial brown ale Mash stretching to new levels Mash Coconut features nearly lbs of toasted coconut per batch which ratchets up the complex native coconut character and complements the oaky and vanilla notes that are imparted to the beer as part of its extensive maturation in bourbon barrels

A big rich English style Barleywine that as its name suggests has tints of ruby around the edges of its brown body with toffee caramel toasted pecan sweetness that is kept in balance with smooth alcohol warmth and slightly fruity American hop note This will be perfect around the fire with cigar with rich meal or just while cozying up and relaxing with family and friends this season It may be enjoyed right away or allowed to age in the bottle Vertical tastings are encouraged

Formerly known as Bombardier Glorious English Ale Marketed as Bombardier Premium British Ale in the USA ABV bottled ABV on cask ABV ExportBombardier Amber Beer is brewed using the finest British Hops and fresh mineral water from the Eagle Brewery Well fruity aroma and rich malty taste provides crisp mouth watering beer Tangy Fuggles hops and sultana fruit flavour finish off the palate Bombardier is beer for those who embrace their independent spirit and march to their own drum

Inspired by the classic Bitters from Great Britain our Belk ESB is an innovative take on the style With deep golden hue and big malty foundation the spicy herbal hop aromas and crisp bitter bite give West Coast flair to this classic recipe Formerly Boont ESB

A malty amber ale boasting rich toasted and caramel flavors Green Man ESB is one of our award winning signature brews Our blend of authentic British malts and hops creates nutty aroma full body and sweet finish Prepare yourself for truly exceptional interpretation of traditional English style
A malty amber ale over toned with slight caramel flavors and notable pleasant hoppiness throughout An international award winning recipe B s deg Plato B

Our classic English style Bitter returns to pay homage to great man and an integral part of the Tree House team Nate father Dan Dan has been spent his work tirement assisting Tree House on the canning line and in many other ways both physically and spiritually This beer is an homage and thanks to great man and more broadly to fathers everywhere Thanks Da Don be fooled by the name our interpretation of an Extra Special Bitter carries light bitterness and gentle earthy noble hop character from Fuggles hops The hops are balanced by an airy fruitiness and rich base of flavors evoking caramel malts brown sugar and hazelnut It is wonderful and simple beer we find best paired with fish and chips smoked meat roasted chicken or ideally day on the river

Our Winter ESB Extra Special Bitter may have the word bitter in its name but the key to this style is balance The combination of malts and hops creates toasty fruity flavor Our ESB is dry hopped with US grown hop varietal called Williamette which has pronounced spicy lemon flavor In the early brewers in London and the south of England expanded the range of beers available in pubs reacting to the wave of European lagers moving into the British pub scene In addition to the ordinary bitters and pale ales brewers developed recipes for stronger premium ales like ESB special bitter and special pale ale These beers contributed to the English traditional ale revival of the making their way into the beer portfolios of many American craft breweries IBU

Every fall marks the return of our legendary Extra Special Bitter for the season Halloween Ale the beer so good it scary From its humble beginnings in as small batch seasonal in our Portland Brew Pub Halloween Ale has grown to be one of the year most anticipated beer releases This robust brew has deep amber color bold malty palate and well rounded hop finish The perfect beer for crisp autumn day

French Broad Brewery interpretation of the classic UK Extra Special Bitter bright copper color with complex malt palate is complemented by traditional British hops notably East Kent Golding French Broad has made this classic public house session beer cult classic with its skull and crossbones artwork

Inspired by our rock roll city Moondog smooth body and undomesticated hop bite set the stage for late night howling Wild floral hop scents shred their way through tail waggin toe tappin blend of crisp sweet malts IBU
An ESB squared It big It bitter and it balanced Heck we even dry hopped it with Tettnang hops but ll admit the Tomahawk chewed up the dry hop and didn spit it out

Exquisitely balanced Tasting Pours reddish copper with thin creamy beige head Subtle smells of caramel honey citrus and grassy floral hops entice while the taste delivers pleasantly bold hop flavor against very strong malt backbone Well balanced and delicious Malts Pale Munich C CaraHell and Belgian Special Hops Bittered with Chinook finished with Cascade and Centennial Body Medium IBU
Amber in color with slight caramel sweetness Medium hop bitterness Malty up front with nice hop malt balance IBU

If it looks like Ed just got merrier you re right Every November heralds the return of our holiday seasonal Christmas Ale available on draft and in six packs Our Christmas Ale is robust S Extra Special Bitter full of holiday cheer Christmas Ale has lovely dark red amber color and rich full bodied malty taste with slightly roasted undertone We brew our Christmas Ale to an original gravity of about alcohol by volume using only the finest English Pale and Crystal Malts with touch of Roasted Barley as well blend of Clusters Styrian Goldings Saaz and Yakima Goldings leaf hops round out this hearty brew Gritty Christmas Ale has no additives fruits or spices It just good honest ale perfect for the season And to top it all off it already gift wrapped Happy Holidays IBU
Alc by Vol IBUs calories per oz serving

Opened in across the Hillsborough River from downtown Tampa the Tampa Bay Hotel with its resplendent Moorish Revival design and crescent moon topped minarets quickly became one of the most recognizable and iconic features of Tampa nascent skyline Henry Plant grandiose hotel boasted Florida first elevator and is now the home to the University of Tampa and the Henry Plant Museum Cigar City Brewing celebrates Henry Plant and his historic hotel with Minaret English style Pub Ale malt forward yet easy drinking ale that brings to mind the nuanced and quaffable beers of the UK Brewed with Maris Otter malt and traditional English hops Minaret English style Pub Ale boasts complex malt flavors woody hop notes and perfect balance between these two qualities Nitro dispense rounds out the beer and emulates traditional cask conditioning making it beer to revisit again and again while contemplating the man and the hotel that made Tampa famous IBU
Formerly known as Bott Brothers ESB the original occupants this alehouse favorite is complex medley of malt and hops

A multi award winning ale that pays tribute to the Avro Lancaster and is quite simply the Best of British beer classic English ale chestnut in colour with lovely full bodied flavour enriched with wonderful late hop character two time gold medal winner in the European Beer Star Awards and As well as two silver medals at the International Beer Challenge and the World Beer Awards in

Bitter was originally draught ale served very fresh under no pressure gravity or hand pump dispensing only at cellar temperatures Lucky for you today its available everywhere Our ESB is rich full bodied English style bitter brewed with carefully selected malts and hops This copper coloured English styled ale is our best seller Smooth Full bodied and All Natural like all our beers Our most popular brew is not really bitter beer it a better Bitter IBU
A Coniferous Concoction Pine for this Extra Special Bitter whose medium body and spicy hoppiness harmonize with flavorful aromatic spruce tips IBU

Formerly Red Racer ESB Extra Special Bitter The use of crystal malt lends to this beer flavour and colour profile Packed with hops from the North West and United Kingdom this is our original take on the classic English bitter

Bitch Creek ESB was first brewed in and perfectly balances big malt sweetness and robust hop flavor for full bodied mahogany ale It has quickly become our best selling beer as well as our most critically acclaimed having won medals including two golds at four out of the past five Great American Beer Festivals XX Bitch Creek Double ESB is all that and more We took the Bitch Creek recipe and doubled everything double the malt double the hops twice the flavor

Brewed to honor Hildegard Von Bingen th century Benedictine nun who allegedly was the first to record the use of hops as an ingredient in beer While this is open to debate we like Hildegard style and we can imagine beer without hops This extra special bitter has lots of hops Hildegard would be proud We are Cheers Hildy
Golden sunset color fruity hop aroma biscuity malt flavor soft body

Not just the iconic ale of the capital London Pride is an all British affair that unites nation of beer drinkers It brewed with entirely home grown hop varieties Target for bittering and Northdown Challenger and Goldings for aroma but the soul of the beer is unquestionably in the malt Crystal malts combine with spring harvested Pale Ale varieties Concerto and Propino to give Pride its inimitable depth and balance This tawny coloured premium ale borrows sweet raisin biscuit and dried fruit notes from the Crystal malt while fresh piney herbs emanate from the hops Rich smooth and elegant on the palate it draws to clean satisfying finish with beautifully balanced bitterness ABV on cask ABV for bottles cans and kegs

Bluebird is fine session ale with light golden colour The intense resinous and spicy hop character which is the beer hallmark is derived from the use of unusual quantities of English Challenger hops each bale being individually and personally selected by the brewer The malt is of course Maris Otter fermented slightly warm to give soft fruitiness with faint hint of scented geranium

This Kentish ale bottle was first brewed in to celebrate the Battle of Britain which was fought in the skies above Kent years earlier The beer is named after the legendary Spitfire aeroplane designed by RJ Mitchell The versatility of the aircraft and the courage of its pilots were essential to victory and were key symbol of the spirit of that time
a Scottish Sparkling Ale

The Naughty Nurse has become quite the popular lady in the Nutmeg State With her classy and sensual elegance combined with just the right amount of ahem bite she has made many friend both inside and outside of our brewpub Don let that come hither look fool you though she is all business when it comes to performance In fact she is our best seller If the Nurse needs match it can be nice beefy burger or almost anything else on pub style menu And with her moderate alcohol content she can stand alone and make your next Session last long long time This fine ale is brewed for spicy slightly bittersweet finish using traditional English malt hops yeast and manners Available short or tall of course

Doom Bar is inspired by its namesake the treacherous sandbank at the mouth of the Camel Estuary near Sharps home at Rock Accomplished and precise Doom Bar is the epitomy of consistency balance and moreish appeal and is now the UK no selling cask beer An enticing aroma of resinous hop sweet malt and delicate roasted notes The mouth feel is balanced complex blend of succulent dried fruit lightly roasted malt and subtle yet assertive bitterness The finish is dry and refreshing ABV cask bottle
Ale aged minimum of weeks in French Oak Foudres

Best Bitter was the first beer we ever brewed way back in at our Portland Brew Pub This true English classic has been the anchor of our draft selection ever since Best Bitter is copper hued and well balanced ale with real old world integrity We use fine Yakima Golding hop flowers in the brewing of this beer for fine dry finish that compliments the malty palate The taste captures the freshness of hand drawn ale that goes right from the conditioning tank to your glass IBU

The pint of pints Belhaven Best is the main man of draught ales Best colour best flavour best balance the pint for all occasions We Scots are often not known for blowing our own trumpets modest souls that we are but we ve named this Best for reason We re sure you ll agree

Geary new Winter Ale is well balanced and more aggressive bitter both in alcohol and hop character without being overpowering It is dark gold and coppery in color with moderate carbonation Malt flavors are toasty and fruity resulting in tasty blend with firm body balanced by English hops

Inspired by the house ales found in the pubs of Great Britain and Ireland McNellie Pub Ale is traditional ale brewed in the style of Best Bitter Various maltings of two row barley are joined with American Glacier hops to give this beer its color complexity and bit of New World twist The Old World character present in this ale is largely influenced by its yeast which originates in the port city of Hull East Yorkshire England
A rich red ale with subtle malt undertones and distinctive spicy hop aroma from Styrian Goldings Brewed with skill and patience in one of Britain finest small breweries
Originally served as real ale Arkell Best Bitter has loyal following This delicate and well balanced bitter is Wellington session beer

This traditional British Ale is authentic cask conditioned beer with smooth malt profile balance by subtle hop presence Dry hopping in the cask produces an enticing hop aroma in this quaffable session ale
ABV IBU

An enticing amber colour with hoppy and slightly fruity aroma We use the finest English malt carefully balanced with local Fuggles hops This is gently fermented to leave some of the natural malt sugars to give full and satisfying flavour with long dry finish

The name comes from the Pitchfork rebellion of the last battle to be fought on English soil of the Civil War golden bitter with floral citric hop aroma It has hoppy predominate taste which is slightly sweet and fruity and leaves you wanting more

An extremely clean drinking pale golden ale with strong floral aroma and elderflower notes from the Cascade hops This beer is full bodied and full flavoured yet gentle enough to make it favourite session beer IBU
An experimental beer moderately hopped and low alcohol First made from second runnings of Doggie Claws subsequent releases of Fred or Adam second runnings

A traditional best bitter ale brewed wth Pale and Crystal malts and Goldings aroma hops The result is full bodied ale with distinctive fruity caramel notes Brewed with skill and patience in one of Britain finest small breweries

British style pale ale featuring the the rich character of UK Golden Promise malt with distinct finish from the use of British Fuggles and Golding hops

This extraordinary and sparkling DeUs Brut des Flandres brewed with barley is fermented and matured in Belgium refermented in the bottle followed but the traditional remuarge and dégorgement in France Serve chilled º and pour gently into chilled flute or chalice glass
Aged in white wine barrels

Blanc de Blancs started as Biere de Champagne malt bill that was fermented in Chardonnay barrels with Missouri grown Chardonnel grapes The native Missouri microflora that was present on the grapes provide the sour depth and funky complexity of this wild ale

Two Lights is an ode to two of the more refreshing drinks of summer cold beer and sparkling wine While brewing this beer we add Sauvignon Blanc must the freshly pressed juice of the grapes Then we ferment it with both lager and champagne yeast to create tart crisp and dry profile The finished beer aromas of pear grape and light hops pair with flavor profile that a mix of tropical fruit and the snappy spritz of freshly picked grape We suggest sipping Two Lights by water source too large to see across

TWith addition of champagne style yeast this beer ferments and ages for several weeks in bottles It is an excellent welcome drink aperitif and or beverage accompanying dessert It has been produced in cooperation with the brewery in the city of Strakonice South Bohemia

The perfect drink for fans of wine as well as beer We have brewed dry base beer with Pilsen malt then blended that with sauvignon blanc grape must and peach puree and fermented the whole concoction with champagne yeast The result is dry delicate blend of two worlds coming together as one It just good

Buzzerkeley Red Label is the sociability of beer and the sophistication of wine Fresh pressed Napa and Sonoma red wine pomace give depth to the effervescence of Sparkling Ale k beer fermented with wine yeast Boysenberry dark cocoa and rye spice shine through layered tannin structure Fruit forward and dry this ale blurs the line between beer and wine

Brewed around our first anniversary this joyful and festive biere de champagne has been bottle conditioning for nearly eight months Blended with our house sour culture it has big joyful bubbles and mischievous spirit Hushed tones of peach pear and citrus lend harmony and symmetry to its ultra dry finish We have waited so long to share this beer with you what wonderful gift that it is finally ready at just the right time of year We hope these special bottles help you celebrate all the season has to offer

Collaboration with Blackberry Farm BreweryThis Grisette style beer was crafted with foraged sumac and mixed cultures from both breweries After primary fermentation it was moved over to one of our horizontal tanks to age The result is complex blend of sour earthy and acidic Created in partnership with Blackberry Farm Brewery Walland TN as part of our Friendship Brew project

CompositionMalt imported row German maltsHops whole flower Tettnang Tettnang Simcoe and Citra hopsABV FlavorWith the sublime earthy familiarity of noble European hops backed up by fresh clean German malts Summer Love Ale ends with surprising burst of lemony refreshment from fistfuls of American whole flower hops Love Summer now

Ever heard of Sweet Action the magazine That short lived sensation sparked one of our first collaborations the beer you hold in your hand Our quest to classify SWEET ACTION has ended it a beer your brain can categorize but instead speaks directly to your palate Our senses and intuition sometimes conquer rational thought It Mad Science

Big Wave is light golden ale with subtle fruitiness and delicate hop aroma smooth easy drinking refreshing ale The lightly roasted honey malt contributes to the golden hue of this beer and also gives slight sweetness that is balanced out by our special blend of hops IBU

Summer has its own rules As luck would have it it also has it own beer This clever golden hued ale pours remarkably crisp and clean distinctive malt body complements refreshing hop profile led by heady dose of bold Amarillo hops Enjoy Malt Pale Carapils Crystal MunichHops Sterling Celeia Cascade Tettnang IBU

A light refreshing blonde ale created for the laid back California lifestyle Subtle malt sweetness is balanced by touch of hops creating versatile beer with clean finish ABV and available wherever beer is sold if they don have it demand it

Our Jam Eureka Citra explodes with citrus fruit on the nose and the palate and finishes cleanly with light bits of cracker malt Someone forgot to tell it that it only alcohol beautiful and pungent yet delicate and highly drinkable beer

Horchata is traditional sweet milky drink originating in Spain and Latin America that has become quite popular in Southern California particularly with Mexican cuisine Our take on the traditionally non alcoholic drink is blonde ale brewed with heavy dosing of rice cinnamon and fresh vanilla beans along with lactose for little extra creamy character If you didn know better you think it was carbonated horchata The flavor is hard to describe but for those who know it you know you love it

Samurai is the perfect beer for your zen garden after battle or your patio after long day of work The addition of rice gives slightly fruity crisp refreshing element to this hazy unfiltered ale creating light easy going beer suitable for the peaceful warrior This may be your first Samurai but it certainly won be your last

A rich creamy golden colored ale fermented at cool temperature to give clean finish Hints of yeasty bread and touch of hops combine to make beer that is truly more than the sum of its parts IBUMalt Rahr Special Pale Wyermann ViennaHops Saphir SterlingYeast California Ale

A tribute to the highly drinkable every day beers from French speaking Belgium Contains Belgian two row pale malt and wheat This beer is lightly filtered with an earthy spicy hop character from imported Styrian Goldings hops and beautiful rich creamy head from the wheat

Single Chair celebrates the uniqueness of the Mad River Glen Cooperative Ski Area in Vermont Medium bodied and ideally balanced for all tastes Single Chair tempting light golden color heady aroma and smooth liquid go down effortlessly and often IBU

A Smooth and Sexy Brew Like golden waves of yeast crashing on golden beach of golden sand with golden taps spewing golden beer that smooth as gold Crisp Blonde Ale Golden in color medium in body she brewed with the help and the honey of Durango Honeyville bees SOUL MATESLight enough not to overwhelm tasty greens regardless of dressing Works well with delicate fish Pleasant accompaniment to lobster clams shrimp and crab great lobster bisque Thirst quencher works well with spicy hot foods The taste is mildly sweet from the use of local honey followed by bready malts touch of tangy wheat pleasantly mild bitterness and citrus hop flavors in the end

The delicious refreshing taste of Summer Ale comes from substantial portion of wheat malt added to traditional barley malt mix which gives this delicious brew unique tartness not found in many light ales these days No surprise this light thirst quenching brew is best enjoyed on hot summer days

Crisp golden ale with delicate hop finish This is our lightest ale and it is brewed with bit wheat malt for body and Munich and Aromatic malts for and undertone of honey like sweetness Lightly dry hopped with Cascade hops for that classic American golden ale aroma IBU
Citrusy and thirst quenching this refreshing golden ale is highlighted by the use of unique hops IBU

An elegant showcase for Australian Galaxy hops this riff on our favorite blonde ale has just the pale malt bill in common with her sister beer Eureka Delicate and pleasantly hoppy with aromatic and flavorful notes of pineapple passionfruit and citrus you ll have hard time believing this one is so sessionable Refined and bright this is the perfect beer for any occasion We absolutely adore it

Goose Island is proud to introduce Fulton St Blend coffee ale aged with House Blend beans from our neighbors at Intelligentsia Named for the street in Chicago that we both call home Fulton St Blend is golden ale infused with rich coffee flavor and aroma

When the days get longer and the air gets warmer we get outside quite bit And we build big thirst Summer Honey helps us shake off the winter and slakes our thirst for refreshing brew Summer Honey is full flavored summer seasonal ale Brewed with unique balanced blend of spices Northwest Hops and Montana honey Summer Honey is brewed during the early days of spring and released around the first of May each year Light colored light bodied and very drinkable Summer Honey sacrifices nothing to create flavorful beer that can be enjoyed during the height of the Summer

A delicate yet pungent showcase for Mosaic hops this riff on our favorite blonde ale has just the pale malt bill in common with her sister beer Eureka Delicate and pleasantly hoppy with aromatic and flavorful notes of fleshy papaya orange juice and mango you ll have hard time believing this one is so sessionable Refined and bright this is the perfect beer for any occasion We are absolutely in love with the Mosaic edition

Redhook Blonde combines the best attributes of flavorful golden ale with the refreshing qualities of lager The ale is brewed with three different malts and two hop varietals Lightly roasted barley and touch of wheat combined with an ample portion of hops creates truly crowd pleasing beer IBU

With over years of brewing tradition behind it Molson Export continues to grow in lore Its history however could never be as rich without the original high quality ingredients that have come to distinguish it from other brands We brew Molson Export with two row barley an exclusive strain of ale yeast that goes back to the origins of Molson Breweries hand selected Golding and Oregon hops and water

The Lonely Blonde wears delicate fragrance of German noble hops and slips touch of white wheat between American pale and crystal malts for smooth sensuous body fair complexion and pleasantly lacy white head Crisp carbonation slinks the Lonely Blonde quickly away and you re left with nothing but slight lingering sweetness as you contemplate how The Lonely Blonde can be so beautiful on so many levels

A new series showcasing collaborations at Hill Farmstead with friends this one brewed with Ryan Witter Merithew of Siren Brewing Low abv hoppy blonde ale with Earl Grey tea dry hopped with Amarillo Citra and Centennial

There are days when you want beer just beer that hits all the right spots Well this is it No snifters required no special occasions just an unfussy uncomplicated hoppy golden ale brewed to fit in no matter where it goes Thisisn beer for collecting this is beer for drinking

A Blonde Ale brewed entirely with Nelson Sauvin hops New Zealand varietal that melds beautifully with simple bill of pale malts This is true session beer and one that does not make any compromises It has delicate bouquet of passionfruit and slight lemon flavor that will surely quench your thirst
A light refreshing Ale that is easy to drink yet complex Perfect for the warmer months

Introducing our newly re imagined seasonal selection inspired by Electric Boogaloo small batch brewery only release developed on our pilot system This brand new Summer Ale recipe is palate pleasing hazy golden ale featuring waves of juicy fruit filled hop flavors from Cashmere Mandarina Bavaria and Amarillo
Our blonde ale packs zippy punch of hop aroma This brew features flavorful blend of North American malts and is fully loaded with Cascade and Centennial hops
Smooth flavor with subtle malt sweetness accented with the delicate aroma of Czech hops This brilliant gold ale is mellow but flavorful microbrew IBU

A great introductory craft beer NOLA Blonde is medium bodied traditional American blonde ale golden in color with floral and citrus hop aromas

This bright blonde ale shines brilliant malt character Born of breezes captured sunlight and whifle this beer is balanced yet dry siren whose first sip calls for the third Hopped with arguable restraint with Crystal and Bravo hops Cougar stays fierce enough to raise eyebrows yet is tame enough to be called sessionable

Affligem beers originate from the Belgian abbey founded in The citrus and tropical fruit notes followed by malty softness and hoppy character combine to make Affligem Blonde beautifully smooth beer with lightly bitter finish
Green Cap

Belgian Style dry hopped Blonde Ale It an unassuming road leading to the priory Here off the corner of two intersecting roads dedicated monks have been making beer for over years It always been simple life the kind that requires they brew only enough to sustain the activities of their monastery In the silence of passing seasons they pray they brew and retire in solitary existence behind the sheltering walls They live most interesting life Most likely one we couldn sustain Nearby each summer the trellised fields spring to life as rows of resinous green cones are trained toward the heavens Rumor is some monks love these hops and being surrounded by budding yellow aromas and the leafy pungent fields inspired them Since we aren sensible enough to locate our brewery near hop fields we can only offer this blond ale in celebration of our Abbey brethren and their steadfast Devotion

The high quality raw materials make up the richness of this top fermented beer which is characterized by its ocher blonde color Grimbergen Blonde is light fruity and balanced sweet bitter Due to its rounded flavor this beer is highly appreciated

Nearly years of brewing experience tradition and innovation come together to create this exceptional golden ale Brewed in Belgium with two row summer malts and noble hops then dry hopped with Citra Duvel Single Fermented is crisp beautifully balanced and remarkably refreshing

This scintillating golden ale boasts rich fruity and fresh aroma And light malty and sweet taste It has soft bitterness with friendly aftertaste well balanced blend of complexity and simplicity La Trappe Blond continues to ferment in the bottle
The War Bird the trusty side kick of the ninjas has been deployed This delicious session ale is reliable and remarkably complex Always there when ya call the bird is the word

This ale is made with Belgian noble hops and our Belgian yeast This combination imparts wonderfully complex spicy clove aroma and subtle dried apricot and biscuit like flavor This golden ale is wonderful entry level Belgian beer for anyone unsure of Belgian styles Some believe it moonstruck madness to craft Old World ales for modern palettes constantly clamoring for the extremes of Hoppy or Sour While our love for those extremitites is strong we believe that subtlety balance and simplicity in beer are sacred necessities It is precisely this kind of lunacy that keeps the craft world sane It takes all kinds to make world

An unfiltered Belgian style Blonde Ale with wheat and lot of honey in every pour We have also added special spice blend to give it an added kick Smooth and refreshing this beer is straw Yellow in color with slight sweetness in the middle and an estery finish characteristic of the best Belgian beers If the yeast has settled swirl before you pour
Formerly known as Tongerlo Dubbel Blond

Born into family of mystical monkeys this light hearted sibling brings twisted spin to the bunch Hearing about the flavorful excitement that the overgrown jungle had to offer he set out to explore It was sensory overload and he had to try it all His favorite the mango Introducing hints of his favorite fruit to the same imported malts and Belgian yeast favored by the family this magical ale results in big flavor refreshment that only the Monkey can deliver

Catholic monasteries were historically major centers of brewing and learning and their educational model eveolved into the modern university Two Roads brewers and some beer loving professors in Sacred Heart University biology department collaborated to brew this beer in celebration of that history It is fermented with yeast strain from centuries old monastic brewery currently operating in Belgium This Abbey Single is brewed to be distinctive in flavor yet approachable and refreshing

Southside Blonde is sessionable Belgian Style Blonde Ale that is light bodied and dry with hint of fruitiness from the yeast Southside is friendly pairing with variety of foods and an approachable choice for all types of beer drinkers

A Belgium style Blonde Ale perfect for an adventure amidst the lakes and trails of the backcountry This Blonde balances hints of citrus and Belgium yeast much like you balance canoe on your shoulders Effortlessly

Another idea from the abbey Brewed in the tradition of the monks of Wissembourg who had their beer made on the current site of the brewery Wendelinus is the result of centuries old know how Beneath its amber colour and creamy head is an abbey beer with range of flavours that mature on the palate with every mouthful Strong with pleasant touch of bitterness this is beer to be savoured for its persistent mellowness and caramelized fruity flavours Take your time with it
Also known as Bryan Ave Belgian Style Blonde
IBU

Belgian Style Ale brewed with White Wine Yeast Inspired by the classic Belgian style ales which drew us into brewing in the first place We add twist on the spirit of Belgian mixed fermentation by utilizing non traditional wine yeast Torulaspora delbrueckii Torulaspora enhances fruitiness while classic Belgian ale yeast imparts Belgian spice character Golden multifaceted Belgian style ale with subtle fruity notes of apricot lychee currant and honey layered with noble hop spice and peppercorn phenol notes

A beer that has dominant malty taste This beer origins in monk recipe are reflected in its heartiness The Pope of Beers Conrad Seidl describes it as Almost black with very slight red tone sensational festive foam and truly extraordinary fragrance that at first summons up visions of greaves lard The first taste is of mild fullness with an accompanying coffee tone which becomes more dominant with the aftertaste There is very little of the sweetness that is frequently to be tasted with doppelbock beer The Ayinger Celebrator has been ranked among the best beers of the world by the Chicago Testing Institute several times and has won numerous medals

Monks had fasting figured out No food No problem Just drink Double Bock Thick and chewy with intense notes of caramel chocolate and dried stone fruit Nator as we call him serves as tribute to this liquid bread style

This unfiltered bottom fermented double bock beer has been brewed for over years always adhering to the original recipe The taste is unmistakable with its smooth chocolate flavor robust dark caramel maltiness and light note of hops providing nice intensity on the palate

Our Korbinian the full bodied dark Doppelbock with light brown foam wins beer lovers over with balance of fruity hints of plums and figs dark malt aroma reminiscent of toffee nuts and chocolate Its roasted flavour goes well with smoked meat and fish as well as venison and poultry Brewed according to our centuries old brewing tradition on the Weihenstephan hill

The once strongest beer in the world is back Brewed only once year on December Samichlaus is aged for months before bottling This beer is perhaps the rarest in the world Samichlaus may be aged for many years to come Older vintages become more complex with creamy warming finish Serve with hardy robust dishes and desserts particulary with chocolates or as an after dinner drink by itself Brewed under the exclusive licence of Feldschlösschen Hürlimann Holding Switzerland
A traditional doppelbock fermented with an old world lager yeast Reddish brown in color with mild hop profile Consecrator is well balanced full bodied beer with smooth malty finish

This world famous bock from Bavaria Holy Mountain is not meant to be rushed but savoured slowly As solid as rock Andechser Doppelbock Dunkel presides over the evening meal with colour reminiscent of dark copper with nuances of fiery red Its clear gleaming look harmonises with its firm fine pored head Also the aroma delights the connoisseur soft roasted accents and nuance of dried fruit carrying vein of caramel This Doppelbock Dunkel from Bavaria Holy Mountain presents pleasant effervescence And then there the unmistakable flavour mouthcoating and velvety strong and yet pleasantly malty powerful robust body At the same time it develops an easily recognisable sweetness embraced in roasted cocoa and light bitter hoppiness Concluding with powerful punch this Doppelbock departs with lingering aftertaste of quality plain chocolate strong Doppelbock that embodies the centuries old Benedictine brewing tradition sip by delicious sip
Formerly Moretti La Rossa Birra Doppio Malto
A super strong Bock but not an Eisbock

Hopped with German and Czech hops and fermented with Bavarian lager yeast this traditional doppelbock blends an extensive amount of select dark malts to achieve its rich and creamy character Rich and filling this brew is malt lovers dream IBU

Formerly Smuttynose muttonator Big Beer Series Muttonator Double Bock displays the characteristically full malt flavor that can only come from using the best German specialty malts and traditional decoction mashing technique The extra effort also adds lot of extra time to each batch but that the only way to get the nuttiness toffee notes and smooth character beer drinkers expect from double bock

With deep copper hue and rich malty flavor this renowned doppelbock warms like burning embers of mid autumn fire as the nights grow cooler You may be tempted to share but keep this Fire for yourself It that good

The Weltenburger Asam Bock owes its name to the ingenious baroque painter and master builder Cosmas Damian Asam The malt stressed goat exudes light roasted aromas that give hint of coffee Friends and connoisseurs appreciate it especially for its strong sweet very aromatic and persistent taste until the finish With its alcohol content it is the strongest beer from the Weltenburger family
If you re going to sin sin big With alc vol and creamy richness this brew has developed serious cult following Imagine that cult following in Utah
Limited seasonal draft only release Doppelbock brewed smoked row German malt from Bamberg

A dark strong interpretation of double bock Full bodied with raisiny dark fruit slightly roasted and chewy malt character Lagered for two months smooth malt character balances the high ABV of this strong beer IBU
Also known as Josephs Brau Winterfest
The Duck Rabbator Dopplebock is powerfully malty German style lager The malty grainy flavors so dominate this beer it like whole loaf of bread in every glass Is it beverage or is it meal It both

The Troegenator has awoken After hibernating for six months in bourbon barrels we re excited to report that Bourbon Barrel Aged Troegenator is ready for release today at am The barrel aging process has transformed Troegenator into lush Double Bock with undertones of vanilla oak and toasted coconut amid warm blanket of tangy bourbon notes

This Triple Bock is dark brown with ruby highlights It is extremely rich and complex with flavors of raisin plum There is slight heat from alcohol and has low carbonation It is full bodied malty and sweet you big beer lovers should try this beer
In the th century Belgian monks sustained themselves during winter fasts with beers made from strong dark flavored malts These creamy books ensured that the monks would fast frequently
IBU

Full bodied Bavarian style lager with complex malt character suggesting flavors of fresh baked bread molasses chocolate plums and oranges This style was originally created by monks for Lenten fasting and called liquid bread

This is classic German Dopple Bock Like all of our beers it is made in strict accordance to the German Reinheitsgebot Purity Law of Brewing which is water malt hops and yeast only Lobotomy Bock is made from five types of specialty malted barley including Munich black patent and other premium malts And finished with two types of hops Sterling and Perle added at the boil and again at the finish for the perfect flavor balance Lobotomy Bock is brewed with pure artesian spring water from the historic Indian Wells Spring Lobotomy Bock is lagered for several weeks then finished to exacting standards

The version of this limited edition seasonal is only available through the holiday season but this winter celebration brew is worth the wait Malted barley and chocolate tones define the traditional style while the robust aroma and long mellow finish make this the perfect companion for holiday adventures Get it while you can Munich malt pilsner malt crystal malt chocolate malt bavarian hops
Originally brewed as liquid bread by fasting monks this Doppelbock is rich and filling Crisp and delicious for the winter months

Christian Moerlein Doppelbock is brewed in accordance with Germany Reinheitsgebot Purity Law of What makes Doppelbock most enjoyable is its rich full body which is superbly balanced for smoothness It will be appreciated for its robust malt and carmel characteristics Enjoy its smooth velvety taste and you will agree that it is Quite Simply Better Doppelbock

When it cool outside it time for the dark Einbecker Winter Bock inside Selected malts the finest hops and special beer yeast provide true winter treat With Einbecker Winter Bock has the highest original wort of all Einbecker beers

Our Double Vision Doppelbock is brewed with Idaho Row Pale and German Munich CaraAroma CaraMunich and de husked Carafa malts to an original gravity of Plato SG The malts provide dark leather color with ruby notes luxurious tan head and bready aroma with hint of smoke It is lightly spiced with Liberty hops an American version of the noble German Hallertau Mittelfruh and fermented with lager yeast from monastery brewery near Munich In the traditional manner Double Vision is fermented cold and lagered full weeks for smoothness At over alcohol by volume it is deceptively drinkable springtime warmer
Imperial dark lager aged in bourbon barrels

Aventinus has been known to be the most intense and complex Wheat Doppelbock in the world This was the case in the past but not anymore Recently Hans Peter Drexler Brewmaster at Schneider Sohn heard some stories about some extra special Aventinus resulting from some partial freezing during cold winter transport in the He decided to recreate this classic mistake to further concentrate Aventinus in modern controlled facility Thus the Aventinus Eisbock was reborn Prost Georg Schneider VI th Generation Brewer

Formerly called Kulmbacher Reichelbrau EisbockEisbock was inadvertently invented in Kulmbach one bitter winter day when an apprentice brewer accidentally left wooden barrels of bockbier in the brewery yard causing them to burst When the ice was chipped away richer more concentrated dark lager remained inside the barrels

Brewed in limited batches each year Hermannator Ice Bock was first introduced by Hermann one of our original Brewmasters during the holiday as unique gift to his closest friends and customers Crafted at abv using signature blend of chocolate and caramel malts this German Eisbock is slowly cold aged in our cellar for over months

Schneider Aventinus Eisbock matured for months in Pinot Noir Barrels In Hans Peter Drexler started new project maturing some of his finest beers in wine barrels He enjoyed the expertise of brewmaster Jérôme de Rebetez from Brasserie des Franches Montagnes in Switzerland who grew up in wine producing family Thus they created delicious new beer aromes Mein Eisbock Barrique welcomes you with an intense raspberry cherry and vanilla aroma very rich and harmonious taste of chocolate vanilla and berries will explode in your mouth leaving lasting and pleasant after taste reminding you of good red wine This beer is recommended with chocolate and red fruit dessert or blue cheese however as it is so powerful that it can easily be enjoyed by its own vintages Please review separately

Southampton Double Ice Bock is based off of traditional German style Bock beer This German lager beer is rich and malty and brewed to an alcohol strength of Ice Bock is produced when Bock beer is partially frozen in order to increase it alcohol content In this process some of the water content turns to ice effectively strengthening the flavor and alcohol of the beer We take this process one step further After the initial freezing the beer is decanted off the ice and frozen second time The resulting beer is deceptively smooth and amazingly strong lager

The strongest beer that we ve ever created Schnee Boot is dark malty and roasty with hints of cocoa vanilla and dark fruits This beast of lager gets additional complexity from bourbon barrel aging Inspired by Antarctic exploration Schnee Boot Snow Boat is the vessel to transport you to far away tundra

Why do supervillains love Freeze Rays Easy to trap their arch nemesis in solid block of ice and monologue away for hours while their foe slowly dies of hypothermia and or boredom Sure freezing things with laser may sound weirdly impractical but that is before you knew it could be used on Strangeways newest concoction Freeze Ray Eisbock After benumbing thick and malty doppelbock for days we mined the resulting colossal chunks of ice from the vat to extract the pesky water obstructing the full potential of this deliciously decadent libation Its thick and creamy mouthfeel is interlaced with prevalent chocolaty richness that seductively satiates Nevermind where we hide the abv as the Freeze Ray disintegrates any booziness with mere controlled pull of the trigger

This beer is big malty slightly fruity and high in alcohol The higher alcohol is result of the icing process where portion of the water is frozen and removed from the beer Brilliant dark ruby red in color Served in snifter
Barrel aged for months

Beginning as traditional German Dopplebock time and temperature have transformed this beer into tantalizingly smooth Eisbock velvety malt backbone with notes of rich caramel and dark fruit bebops while being serenaded by slow warming alcohol But this Jazz ain free Eisbock is created by freeze distilling dopplebock We freeze our dopplebock and remove certain percentage of water concentrating the beer and lagering it Gold Great American Beer FestivalGold World Beer CupGold US Open Beer ChampionshipGold LA International Beer Competition

Hopless Eised Dopplebock Aged Bourbon Barrels GRIST Munich Vienna Wheat Malt CrystalKETTLE ADDITIONS Green coffee beans added early in boilMedium roast beans added at whirlpoolDRY HOP Bali Cold brewTREATMENTS Traditional bock methodAged over lent in bourbon barrels

An ale inspired by the style of German Maibock brewed using our proprietary Pacman yeast Dead Guy Ale is deep honey in color with malty aroma rich hearty flavor and well balanced finish Ingredients Row C Munich Rogue Farms Dare Risk Malts Rogue Farms Revolution Independent Hops Free Range Coastal Water Pacman Yeast

Andygator creature of the swamp is unique high gravity brew made with pale malt German lager yeast and German Perle hops Unlike other high gravity brews Andygator is fermented to dry finish with slightly sweet flavor and subtle fruit aroma Reaching an alcohol strength of by volume it is Helles Dopplebock IBU

Abita Bock is brewed with pale pilsner and caramel malts and German Perle hops Our bock is similar to German maibocks with its rich malt flavor and full body perfect choice during Carnival season in New Orleans IBU

Emerging from springtime fertile ground Cultivator celebrates the start of hop growing season as sprawling fields of hop rhizomes climb and tether to hop bines This spring bock delivers hints of toasted grains fresh baked bread and delicate floral hops of in our Hop Cycle seasonal series

Cool days draw us close to the warmth of home fires This is the season to sip away the chill and embrace quiet evenings with friends and family You hold Wisconsin Style Honey Bock easy going and more approachable than its traditional dark German cousin Bock beers have existed in Wisconsin for over years This pale bock is brewed with an exclusive blend of Wisconsin two row barley that balances seamlessly with our special European hops Naturally sweet Clover Honey was added in the kettle accenting warm flavor notes on your tongue Whether you reminisce the passing summer sun or thrill to squeaky steps through drifting snow one thing is certain about winter in Wisconsin this too shall pass

Dead Guy Ale aged in Dead Guy Whiskey Barrels Malts Carastan Rogue Micro Barley Farm Dare Risk malts Hops Saaz Willamette Rogue Micro Farm Hop Yard Revolution hops Yeast Water Pacman Yeast Free Range Coastal Water º PLATO IBU AAº Lovibond

This traditional German style earned the nickname liquid bread because it was brewed by Paulaner monks in Bavaria to help them get through Lenten fasting Moravian malts and Czech Saaz hops give it toasted sweetness with little spice in the finish Available in oz cans and bottles in the Spring
Ready for May In spring the Einbecker brew masters brew particular special beer the Einbecker Mai Ur Bock This pleasantly bitter refreshment is only available in the spring as long as supplies last

A traditional Helles or pale bock beer Blonde Bock is medium hopped beer with rich malty flavor Made popular in the early s bock beers were originally brewed by monks to minimize hunger pangs during fasting periods Most bock beers are dark in color Our Gordon Biersch Blonde Bock is golden with creamy head IBU

Boss Tom Golden Bock is our seasonal offering for late spring The smooth soft maltiness of this traditional lager is complemented by noticeable but restrained hop presence The beer finishes with lingering dryness and just hint of caramel The word bock also means billy goat and images of goats are often used as symbol of the style IBU

Our spring seasonal is deep golden lager with flavorful but smooth presence When you see our Maibock hit the shelves you know things are about to get better including the weather HOPS Liberty HallertauMALTS Brewers Honey

True Story Running brewery can be bock breaking It all worthwhile when you have the opportunity to share beer like this Our Maibock Helles Bock is deep golden in color with an intense malty almost grape like aroma and flavor light noble hop character balances the smooth sweet finish long lagering time makes this beer exceptionally drinkable for its strength Don be fooled by its light color IBU

Brewed with Light and Dark Munich malts Pilsner Malt and Malted Wheat It is hopped with Northern Brewers and Hallertau hops Northern Brewers is clean bittering hop and Hallertau is classic German aroma hop associated with Bavarian style lager beers IBU

What do you get when you brew an elegant limited edition lager with one select barley LTD the single malt of beers This brand new edition to our LTD Series is finely balanced single malt single hop beer that is pale golden in color and brewed with just pale malt and pleasantly hopped with just Willamette hops ABV IBU
and Bronze Medal Winner in the Bock category at the Great American Beer Festival GABF

Abita Strawgator is the fusion of Strawberry Harvest Lager sweetness with the bite of Andygator This golden lager is made with malted barley and wheat It is hopped with German Perle hops for delicate hop flavor After filtration generous amounts of fresh Louisiana strawberry juice are added giving the beer pleasant sweet taste and aroma as well as rich golden color and slight cloudiness Strawgator is great dessert beer It pairs well with fruit dessert or sorberts It is also excellent with chocolate dishes and cheeses such as St Andre Mascarpone and Brie

The second recipe in our LTD series LTD is light bodied nonetheless hella good limited edition lager that is golden colored with soft malt undertones and is nicely balanced with crisp clean finish It a goldmedal winner at the North American Beer Awards and three time gold medal winner at the World Beer Championships ABV IBU

Aged in Dead Guy Whiskey Barrels Dead Dead is the evolution of Dead Guy Ale The barrels enhance the robust malt and hop profiles of original Dead Guy Ale The ale soaks in hints of oak and whiskey while maturing over several months at the Rogue ocean aging room
