This fuller body American cream ale is brewed with an addition of hot peppers added to the boil as well as the conditioning tank Silver medal winner in the World Beer Cup

This is the chili heads favorite brew mild base beer is spiced up with Anaheim and Serrano peppers This beer has wonderful green chili aroma and touch of heat in the finish Have it with tomato juice as liquid enchilada

Southern Ambrosia is destination completely unto itself This cocktail inspired ale encompasses the opulence of the Gilded Age the reckless abandon of the Roaring and the iconic elegance of the Carolina Low Country all rolled into one enrapturing dram Here tart cherries decadent blackberries zesty Serrano peppers and smooth molasses age gracefully in red wine barrels to create uniquely Southern libation Let go of preconceptions and succumb to the sweet seduction of Southern Ambrosia
Our second summer beer is witbier brewed with jalapenos habaneros lemon and lime The heat is mild and the citrus delicate Light and refreshing
Some of the things David loves include peppers and his Big Green Egg Dryhopped with home smoked jalapenos and habaneros Brewed with brown sugar with nice light body

Cask conditioned ale has been the popular choice among brews since long before prohibition We continue this pioneer spirit with our Wisconsin farmhouse ale Brewed with flaked barley and the finest Wisconsin malts We even give nod to our farmers Naturally cloudy we allow the yeast to remain in the bottle to enhance fullness of flavors which cannot be duplicated otherwise Expect this ale to be fun fruity and satisfying You know you re in Wisconsin when you see the Spotted Cow

Also known as Summer Solstice Cerveza CremaOur Summer Solstice Seasonal Ale is slightly sweet malty session beer with creamy mouth feel and clean finish With hints of caramel in the nose and touch of spice it become affectionately known as cream soda for adults The unique flavors and superior drinkability make for the ultimate refreshment on hot summer day

Genny Cream Ale Smooth like lager Crisp like an ale Cream ale was one of the first beer styles created in america and ours has been the style standard since Our cream ale has won numerous awards throughout the years and remains just as smooth and flavorful as it always been Cream ale true American original

Calm Before the Storm came from quest for warm weather alternative to our Victory at Sea Imperial Porter Like its more robust cousin we infuse punch of flavor using cold brewed Caffé Calabria coffee and hint of vanilla But this time we added it to lighter bodied golden cream ale The end result is surprisingly bright coffee forward beer that perfectly refreshing IBUs
Based on traditional Irish recipe from County Wexford that dates back to we use only the best ingredients to ensure that our Wexford Ale has smooth mellow creaminess we believe you will enjoy

A Classic Jersey ism is regular coffee Here when you oder regular coffee at any place you trust to make pork roll and cheese you get paper cup of coffee with milk and sugars rather than black coffee that hasn had the caffeine removed Acidic bitter coffee flattened by milk and sweetened the perfect foil for the salty unctuous savor of breakfast on roll For our homage to Jersey breakfast beverage we teamed up with our neighbors at Fair Mountain Coffee Roasters looking for an elevated version of classic crappy coffee We chose Mexican Chiapas for its bitterness akin to artichoke roasting it little darker than usual along with Ethiopian Sidamo for its pleasant lemon like acidity which we pushed up through fermentation We added this coffee blend to high gravity golden cream ale contributing our milk and sugars Drink Regular Coffee because running over black beer with coffee is no way to get to work https www youtube com watch AtZGKBsd list UUnNILcyxWbvjLRKg

Our flagship offering is golden to pale in color with low bitterness medium body and white head Our Cream Ale has redefined the category and made classic style cool again We use bit of Madagascar Vanilla Bean to give it that Cream Soda kick This beer finishes dry despite subtle perceived sweetness from the Vanilla Great any time of year

Formerly Terrapin Cream Ale Available in Georgia only Terrapin Beer Company was started by two guys who love big bold beers We are known for using ton of flavorful ingredients and for pushing the envelope with the brews we create We have also been known to take pleasure in hiking biking kayaking and just plain having fun in the great outdoors When we get hot and sweaty even hopheads like us want nothing more than to enjoy beer that is crisp and refreshing Which is why we created the perfect session beer the Terrapin Golden Ale

A deliciously refreshing golden ale at ABV brewed with the finest malts and hops giving sweet crisp citrus finish with just hint of honey Available in oz and oz cans Winner of the silver medal in the American Style Cream Ale category at the Great American Beer Festival

Kiwanda Cream Ale celebrates Cape Kiwanda the starting point of the stunning Three Capes Scenic Route and the birthplace of Pelican Brewing Company Inspired by one of America traditional th century beer styles Kiwanda has golden color floral aroma refreshing body and clean snappy finish Whether enjoyed with your toes in the sand at our oceanfront brewpub or in your own backyard Kiwanda Cream Ale is proof that light colored beer can be both refreshing and inspiring degrees PlatoBitterness IBUColor lovibond

First brewed in our flagship Muskoka Cream Ale has since become signature beer of the Muskoka region Unmistakable with its rich amber colour and inviting floral tones this laid back English pub style ale is smooth and easy going With Cascade hoppiness and fuller body of flavour this gold medal winning Canadian Cream Ale is the quintessential taste of cottage country Raise glass IBU

Café Churro is continuation of the Regular Coffee game Our golden imperial coffee cream ale has been finished with vanilla and cinnamon Much like Regular Coffee looks to evoke an amusing version of the acidic bitter coffee curbed by milk and sugar that starts day in paper cup at home Café Churro addresses post siesta cup of bitter coffee and scalded milk lazily stirred with churro to restart momentum on vacation Drink Café Churro and mull the next activity https www youtube com watch lWYlCFgdg

Kentucky Vanillla Barrel Cream Ale is our take on classic American style of beer We took cold conditioned cream ale brewed with hint of flaked corn and bourbon vanilla beans and aged it in freshly decanted Kentucky bourbon barrels for minimum of two months perfect blend of vanilla and bourbon notes make this cream ale irresistible The medium body and ABV make Kentucky Vanilla Barrel Cream Ale the perfect complement to any dessert or all day event

Gansett Cream is made with quality ingredients like row pale Munich Vienna and Cara malt for creamy head We used Columbus hops for bittering and touch of Willamette hops for slight hop aroma Bright gold in color and brilliant in clarity this session ale delivers an extra pop of hop bitterness found only in cream ales of the early IBU

In Richmond Virginia made beer history as the first place ever to sell canned beer cream ale from Krueger Brewing Company tribute to the original canned beer Hardywood Cream Ale is an unfiltered example of the style that embraces its east coast roots with an unbelievably smooth body and refreshingly clean finish from extended cold conditioning in our lagering tanks Raise can to RVA where the canned beer revolution began
Created by George Sleeman in the late s Sleeman Cream Ale was the first brand produced by the two Guelph breweries and still remains our most recognized brand

Our golden colored cream ale brewed in similar manner to the crisp lagers of continental Europe offers great balance between malty sweetness and noble hop bitterness This gold medal winning cream ale is the perfect session beer for any occasion

Double Cream Ale with cumin and lime peel added aged in tequila barrels

Often called your typical American lawnmower beer cream ales are not unlike their American light lager cousin Brewed with American Row Barley Flaked Maize touch of Munich malt and of course sugar Croydon Cream Ale is light refreshing and easy to drink We also use American Cluster and Czech Saaz hops that give it touch of hop bitterness and hint of floral aromatics

Our interpretation of New York original Originally brewed by ale breweries to compete with the surging popularity of lager beer it remains regional specialty in the Northeast United States Our version is light bodied and pale straw color but uses no corn or rice as many of the original versions did The result is supremely malty and refreshing version of style dear to our hearts

Brewing with Barrier is almost as cool as drinking with Barrier Every time we get together Boat and Money are passed back and forth We drink merrily while lamenting not having tank to play in together For this ensemble effort we took the things that make us happy together and put them together Barrier and Carton took classic cream ale version of the Need Bigger Boat recipe to Smutt Labs We swapped American row in for the base malt fermented cold with both beer common Kolsch yeast held it cold for while then dry hopped it within an inch of its life with Money hops Drink R A because colabs rule everything around me

Sitting around the kitchen table during our start up days the need for sessionable beer became clear Our first intern actually came up with the idea to brew cream ale so we started designing the recipe As with all Castle Danger beers we start with flavor profile then expand upon it to create something unique Castle Cream is our version of cream ale Deep gold in color it has soft malty aroma slightly sweet creamy texture with balanced bitterness while finishing smooth and clean

Things are suddenly getting real comfy around these parts with our latest off centered creation Suddenly Comfy Brewed with fresh apple cider Saigon cinnamon and Madagascar vanilla beans this Imperial Cream Ale is made with all the fixings of great apple pie just like grandma used to make Inhale and you ll be greeted with aromas of pie crust and brûléed sugar Sip and you ll find notes of fruity sweetness Savor and you ll venture on fragrant flashback that has you longing for the past IBU

A tip of our hat to the foamy suds once served at the Astrodome this Houston classic Cream Ale is pre Prohibition style brew that is light crisp and easy drinking Whether it the big game or the big chill Dome Faux is your personal championship beer

The Lawn Ranger leaps triumphantly from yard to yard knoll to brook fighting overgrown weeds ungodly insects and gnomes every step of the way Cream ale in hand he fights with brazen display of malted expertly fermented showmanship He leaves trail of hearty good times and happy hours in his wake We ll follow you anywhere Lawn Ranger
Kick back with our spin on classic American recipe It crisp easy drinking and brewed with specialty wheat malts for finish as smooth as the Lavaca County horizon Here to new Texas tradition

Cameron Cream Ale is the beer that started our company Hailed by Toronto Life in as best new beer of the year This elegant golden ale is crisp refreshing and balanced with fruity backbone Brewed with row malted barley and specialty hops from the UK Cameron Cream Ale is dimensional beer that is refreshing in the summer and comforting in the colder seasons
A light bodied ale with malty dominated flavor Very low hop bitterness flavor and aroma
Empire Cream Ale is carbonated with nitrogen so it cascades as it pours This golden pub style ale has an extremely smooth mouthfeel and crisp hop flavor

Brewed using hint of pure Canadian maple syrup Kitsilano Maple Cream Ale is smooth reminder of Vancouver laid back lifestyle Enjoy the bold taste of this bronze coloured ale and toast all that Vancouver has to offer

This copper colored ale boasts flavors of apricots brown sugar and nutmeg Brewed since Chimay Première is the first beer ever produced by the Trappist monks of Notre Dame de Scourmont Abbey in Belgium

Without doubt Unibroue best known beer La Maudite is inspired by abbey beers and Belgian double style ales It first hit the shelves in and took the province by storm with its alcohol content making it the first strong beer available in grocery stores That where the idea came to tie its name and branding to pact signed with the devil The illustration of the chasse galerie or flying canoe from beloved Quebec legend captures the spirit of the beer

Abbey was Ommegang first beer and was styled after Dubbels produced by Belgian Trappist monks deep rich and malty ale Abbey uses several Belgian specialty malts and spices resulting in very aromatic flavorful beer Deep burgundy in color topped by dense tan head Abbey Ale is rich on the palate but with dry finish Suitable for cellaring Abbey develops wonderful caramel fig and currant notes with age

Westmalle Dubbel is dark red brown beer with rich complex taste thanks to re fermentation in the bottle You pick up touches of caramel malt and fruity esters reminiscent of ripe banana The beer pearls beneath covering of dense cream coloured froth lovely lace pattern forms on the inside of the glass once emptied The long dry finish of this balanced mild Trappist beer will stay with you Trappist or Dubbel In the monks of Westmalle started brewing dark Trappist beer in addition to their table beer They adjusted the recipe in doubling the amounts of raw ingredients to produce new stronger beer Dubbel is logical name for this doubled beer though it is more often simply called Trappist To this day the recipe is the basis for Westmalle Dubbel Westmalle Dubbel bottle and tapWe are all familiar with Westmalle Dubbel in cl bottles But around carefully selected Belgian cafés and restaurants serve this beer on tap from barrels containing and litres In the barrel this living beer evolves differently to emerge with slightly sweeter taste Westmalle Dubbel can also be purchased in cl bottles The beer matures in different way in larger bottle to produce noticeably milder finish
Our award winning Abbey stays true to tradition with an authentic Belgian yeast six malts and guarded recipe

Warm molasses color dark fruit aroma rich caramel flavor rich soft body IBU
Allagash Dubbel boasts deep red color and complex malty taste The finish is dry with subtle hints of chocolate and nuts The yeast asserts itself by lending classic Belgian fruitiness

Originally conceived along the lines of Belgian Dubbel Hell Hath No Fury Ale morphed during development into something entirely different Blending pair of Belgian abbey style yeasts into recipe more akin to roasty stout Hell Hath No Fury Ale offers up warm roasted notes of coffee dark chocolate together with the fruity clove like aromas

Formerly Smuttynose Winter AleSmuttynose Winter Ale is full bodied amber beer brewed with special Trappist ale yeast Stylistically reminiscent of Belgian Abbey Double it features fruity aromas and flavor balanced by soft Crystal hops Warming mellow pleasantly complex Smuttynose Winter Ale is your perfect cold weather companion IBU

La Trappe Dubbel has deep brown colour and attractive beige froth The use of caramel malt gives it gentle aromatic caramelised quality It has rich malty flavour with touch of sweetness Post fermenting La Trappe Dubbel is smooth drink and yet has some real body and intense flavour to it

Modeled after the great Trappist and Monastic beers that inspired the founding of our brewery richly deep garnet colored ale created from blend of Domestic and imported malts As part of our commitment to interesting brewing endeavors Chef Vince created special raisin puree for this beer Malts raisins and fantastic yeast strain working in harmony produce beer of amazing complexity and depth

Abbey Ale honors the ancient tradition of monks who perfected the art of brewing beer to support the monastery and their liquid bread We offer up our support and thank them with donation to St Joseph Abbey with every bottle sold of this heavenly brew Dark amber in color the aroma of caramel fruits and cloves invites you to contemplate the creamy head of this Dubbel or double ale Abita Abbey Ale is malty brew top fermented and bottle aged to rapturous perfection IBU

During the fermentation of the first batch of this Abbey style dubbel the yeast died and was resurrected by brewer Chris Cashell Made with five types of barley malt and lots of sugar this beer is quite strong and flavorful without being too sweet abv

Inspired by the classic Dubbels of Belgium our Brother David Double has dark brown body and aromas of warm cocoa banana and cloves Specialty malts impart toasted nutty character and flavors of chocolate covered cherries and candied fruits while the subdued hop profile and Abbey yeast create spicy herbal notes to compliment the warm slightly sweet finish Winner of Gold Medal in the Great American Beer Festival Brother David Double is truly complex and potent ale meant to be savored or shared with friends
Benno as of is Authentic Trappist ale

Brimming with optimism Jovial reveals its enduring charm and infinite merriment with each passing sip This enticing Belgian style Dubbel ale features hints of raisin fig date and prune As the flavor develops traces of toffee chocolate and subtle spices emerge

This brown ale has marked ruby brown colour with generous and lasting head It has distinctive aroma reflecting the wide range of ingredients used in its production The fruitiness resulting from its fermentation blends harmoniously with dominant liquorice and caramel flavour The body is decidedly malty The bitterness is the result of complex alchemy between the fine hops and special malts used These give St Feuillien Brune typical dark chocolate appearance This beer creates an endless variety of sensations with lingering taste and powerful aroma
Brown in color Benediction has notes aromas and flavors of chocolate tobacco and spice The finish is mildly malty with just enough bitterness from the hops Original Gravity

This Abbey Dubbel was aged in blend of red wine and bourbon barrels to add new level of complexity to an already beguiling brew Rich malt flavors of burnt sugar and caramel blend seamlessly with bright fruit notes from the wine barrels while the bourbon oak lends mellow hint of vanilla

Great lengths were taken to ensure its authentic characteristics German and Belgian malts noble hops and unique yeast strain are all necessary to produce this unique ale It is aged for one month beer that tends to please red wine drinkers and is definitely not for the novice beer drinker IBU

Maimed in an accident that left him with hunched back Brother Joseph Zoettl worked in the St Bernard Abbey power plant shoveling coal In his spare time Brother Joseph used found objects such as marbles and chunks of concrete and tile to build miniature shrines and buildings on the Abbey grounds Over years he created different models and replicas Today the Ave Maria Grotto covers three acres and is world renowned as both fun roadside attraction and an awe inspiring collection of folk art We have named our Belgian dubbel after Brother Joseph as testament to his perseverance his hard work and his indomitable spirit full flavored abbey style ale with complex taste and aroma Brother Joseph Dubbel is filled with specialty malt and dark fruit character
Dark coloured ale with the bittersweet flavours of caramel and dried plums made from double fermented hops and malts

Meet Abby Azrael darker twin This Belgian beauty is mysteriously alluring with sultry flavor combination of brown sugar plum and spices in dark burgundy hue Abby has deep rich flavor and serious strength but like her sister hides behind deceptively light fruity finish On the surface she the sweetest girl you ll ever meet but one taste you ll be trapped in her darkly alluring web DARK ABBY FACTS Alcohol by Volume Hop Bitterness IBUs Malts Pilsner Dark Munich Honey Dark CrystalHops SaazSugar Spice Turbinado Sugar Sorghum Syrup Secret Spice Mix
