After the Zatte this is the oldest beer from Brouwerij IJ Natte is classed as dubbel Belgian category of smooth dark beers Because we partly use dark malt Natte has reddish brown colour and smooth roasted flavour with earthy tones of brown sugar nuts and plums Completed with slightly bitter hops this is nicely balanced beer and one of the brewery classics

One of the most award winning craft beers period Domaine DuPage is French Country Ale that offers toasty caramel sweetness with just enough hops to cleanse the palate true original both in style and taste this decorated ale continues to shine as the flagship beer of Two Brothers
The Abbey of Saint Bon Chien winey tart and complex matured slowly in oak barrels The beer that forged the legend of the BFM across the Atlantic

It seems that everyone knows the story of the Three Kings Sent to follow the star in the sky each brought gift for the baby they sought One King brought Gold the other Frankincense and the other Myrrh Many breweries produce Christmas Seasonal beer and this is our beer to celebrate the holiday season

At the Lost Abbey we pride ourselves on producing beers of the highest quality and distinction Avant Garde is our commitment to brewing beers to no particular style Some might want to label this as beer brewed in the Biere de Garde tradition of Northern France We would prefer to say it was brewed in the Avant Garde style of beers that will reward all those who seek the not so ordinary Deep gold in color with hints of biscuits caramel and fresh baked bread this beer is sure to delight the senses and palates of consumers everywhere

To catch bit of soft radiance in each bottle we wait for fall colors to begin their bright and fleeting glow before brewing this wonderful ale under their autumn fire Gentle amber malt blend smooth caramel notes gently lapping against shore of distant forgotten spice beer to sip contemplate and enjoy
A sustaining beer that is brewed to comfort in the gusty ides of March and welcome in wealth of warmer weather

Brewed on the day of my grandmother passing Norma this is an inspired Biere de Mars fermented entirely in oak and soured with our house spontaneous culture Norma was my maternal grandmother my Guardian Angel and the woman that nourished the laughter and innocence of my youth In her honor we craft this Bière de Mars each February and condition it in oak barrels with our resident microflora allowing it to develop indefinitely until it is ready for release We realize the influence of those closest to us only after having left their presence At Hill Farmstead our spirit is forever defined by Norma and the memory of our loved ones

A refreshing French Farmhouse Golden Ale Bière Blonde de Flandre with strong character its fruity taste comes from barley grown in the Nord department of France and its highly aromatic yeast its bitterness from specific variety of hops

Ommegang Biere de Mars is Belgian style dry hopped amber ale with bit of magical space dust woven in Brettanomyces bruxellensis wild yeast used in the secondary fermentation The Brett imparts added tartness bit of zing and some farmhouse funkiness Biere de Mars reveals copper amber body and frothy white head that builds clings and stays Aromas are of malt and grain clove fruit and bit of funk Flavors are full bodied with delicate malty sweetness followed by spicy peppery yeastiness and Brett induced funk Hopping is subtly bitter and aromatic bumped up bit by dry hopping The finish is dry and gently lingering At ABV it also pairs nicely with spicy foods such as barbecue
Its light taste of special malts flavored with Flanders hops and its aromas of high fermentation gives La Goudale all its character and balance

The inspiration for Reposé came from dusty hay filled barns like the one near Jester King where we store our aged hops We attempted to capture some of our sensory experience of the barn by adding ingredients found in the attic to the beer We added bales of hay to the mash and old hops that had spent many months in burlap bags to the boil Further providing inspiration for Reposé was Bière de Garde traditional French farmhouse beer that likely originated out of the stone walled barns that dot the landscape of northern France Bière de Garde was historically brewed in fall and winter to take advantage of cooler fermentation temperatures and aged for months before drinking Similarly Reposé was brewed during February of and slowly fermented for months prior to being blended and packaged in January of The wort for Reposé was brewed with Texas Hill Country water from our well malted barley hay aged hops and fresh hops It was then pitched with Jester King unique mixed culture of brewer yeast and native yeast and bacteria harvested from the air and wildflowers around our brewery After an initial fermentation in stainless steel Reposé was then slowly fermented for months in Brandy barrels we received from France It is alcohol by volume IBU has finishing gravity of and was pH at the time of bottling The label art is by Jester King Josh Cockrell

Our Bière de Garde invokes the tradition of the farmhouse ales of Northern France renowned for their subtle aromas of apricot and allspice Four different types of malt create toffee sweetness while French Strisselspalt hops add subtle spice flavor The beer is fermented with distinct French farmhouse ale strain then bottle conditioned with extra sugar and yeast for at least two weeks Bière de Garde translates to beer which has been kept or stored This traditional artisan farmhouse ale from Northern France was brewed in early spring and stored in cold cellars for consumption in warmer months While related to its spicier tarter Belgian cousin Saison Bière de Garde is richer sweeter beer IBU
Brewed with barley wheat oats and rye This seasonal release celebrates the richness of the grain harvest

Two Roads Holiday Ale is inspired by the little known Biere de Noel style on subset of Biere de Garde both of which originated on small farmhouse breweries in the north of France Biere de Noel which translates as Christmas Beer tends to exhibit more malty profile than typical Biere de Garde In its native France this special type of ale is brewed by just handful of small breweries and is only available for the few weeks leading up to Christmas

This Golden Ale is Inspired by Franco Belgain bière de gardes but not exactly fitting the profile of its European counterparts this beer is best described as Michigan Bière de Garde Hand crafted by Ron Jeffries at his Jolly Pumpkin Brewery in Dexter which is consistantly rated as one of one of the best in the world all of the Leelanau Brewing Company beers are distingushed by their time spent in large French oak barrique prior to bottling and re fermentation The wild yeasts inhabiting the brewery give all the beers made there common thread creating family of beverages with rare harmony despite their diverse styles Decidedly refreshing despite the abv this style of beer was originally brewed in the slow winter season as payment for farmhands in the summer We certainly don mind sitting down after long day of work and breathing deep the symphony aromas wafting from the lofty lacey head burgeoning from our tulip glass Subtle notes of peaches apricots canned pineapple bitters and faint herbaceousness belie the smooth and delicate taste The slightly malty fruity body quickly transitions effortlessly to crisp dry and somewhat tart finish Signature hints of French oak and the complex yeast character place this all natural beer among the best saisons stock ales and farmhouse styles of Michigan France Belgium
Inspired by our brewery puppy Hops Biere de Guard Dog seems sweet enough will strong malt presence lead by Munich and Vienna malts But at ABV it packs bite Just ask our delivery guy
Complex toasty malts and European hop varieties combine with brettanomyces fermentation in oak foeders to create complex beer with fruity and toasty notes and slightly tart finish
IBU Plato Lovibond
A crushable country ale brewed for our hardworking locals
A festive take on Bière de Garde more robust variant of the farmhouse ale family tree brewed with sweet cherries black currants and plums then aged on lightly toasted American oak
A farmhouse festbier featuring malt body that is both dry and creamy with hints of smoke

After brewing and fermentation CH TI beers is kept for long weeks in storage tanks In the calm and cool environment the beer matures develops finer taste perfects its aroma and acquires its natural and characteristic sparkles It is here also that the beer obtains its balance finesse and gleam

Delicate pale malts with touch of wheat and Tettnang hops are fermented in wooden foeders formerly used for wine with three different strains of Brettanomyces yeast and Pediococcus The end result is funky and fruity with bright tart finish This beer is one of three that make up our Jazz Series The French term for drummer Le Batteur takes its name from component of classic jazz trio

Local name Ambrée EsquelbecqUS Import Thiriez AmberDescription on US bottle label Daniel Thiriez painstakingly crafts his rustic farmhouse ales in rustic farmhouse brewery in the beautiful countryside of French Flanders This brisk Amber Ale is really luminous golden red It is perfectly balanced with soft fresh hop bitterness playing off hearty whole grain maltiness and accented by an entrancing nose of earth and spice that is typical of French farm country brewing
IBU
Hazy gold in color this beer is bursting with aromas of fresh wildflowers lemons pineapple Oats give rich creamy mouthfeel over bright sweet sour character ABV IBU Total Acidity
This is Bière de Mars

This Ancient Ale is modern take on th century Finnish beer The wort for Sah tea is caramelized over white hot river rocks and the beer is fermented with German weizen yeast In addition to juniper berries foraged from the Finnish countryside Sah tea is flavored with black tea cardamom cinnamon ginger cloves and black pepper The spicing is subtle and balanced and Sah tea is highly quaffable truly unique brew with full mouthfeel IBU

A long time ago in Finland bunch of Finnish dudes built sauna It was nicer in there than it was outside so they stayed in there until they ran out of beer When they ran out of beer they still didn want to go outside so they decided it would be better if they just started brewing their beer in the sauna And so began the tradition of brewing this traditional Finnish beer in saunas Chock full of rye and juniper and spicy yeast esters our sahti might inspire you to build your own sauna to ride out this winter IBU

SAHATI is our interpretation of traditional Finnish sahti Starting with year old Engelmann spruce tree felled on brewery property we created our own kuurna an ancient Scandinavian lauter tun to separate the wort from the grain during brewing The bottom of the kuurna is layered with spruce branches the needles act as natural filter and impart resinous oils into the wort The hollowed out trunk of the tree also contributes spruce essence and structure from the raw wood The beer is made of barley rye malts along with sparing addition of Goschie Farms Cascade hops and is brewed just few times per year SAHATI is in many ways the very definition of The Ale Apothecary where complex flavors arrive from the very methods used for production the result is the process impacts the flavor profile at least as much as the ingredients themselves
OG IBUS

Juniper bready full bodied Venn modern spin on historical style from Finland Traditionally brewed with multigrain malt bill juniper branches and berries and fermented with baker yeast we kept the core elements of the diverse malt bill and juniper berries but updated the yeast to modern lager fermentation resulting in cleaner finish Malts Two Row Dark Munich Rye Golden Naked Oats Torrified Wheat CaraMunich Hops Chinook Yeast American Lager Other Juniper Berries
Finnish style ale brewed with spruce and juniper aged in barrels for months with brettanomyces bruxellensis yielding malty sweet flavors layered with pine and tart funk

Brewed for Ibis Bakery and celebrating their first anniversary at Grand KCMO Mareritt is brewed with local raw Darby white wheat sourced from Ibis Showcasing the breadth of flavors found in simple ingredients we fermented this Grisette inspired beer using Kveik strain of yeast During fermentation this yeast produces radical aromas of bright citrus orange and tangerine to compliment the earthy wheaty components of the base beer

This is our take on an ancient version of Finnish farm style ale Brewed with juniper berries rye and Citra hops and fermented with Belgian yeast Notes include slight hints of juniper clove pepper banana and citrus
Collaboration with Eik Tid
Plato IBU
Hoppy farmhouse saison with champagne like effervescence flavors include ginger spice orange and toasted grain

Most breweries have at least one piece of equipment that just bit persnickity Here at Boulevard we have fermenter number seven the black sheep of our cellar family Ironically when our brewers were experimenting with variations on traditional Belgian style farmhouse ale the perfect combination of elements came together in that very vessel You could call it fate but they called it Tank and so it is Beginning with big surge of fruity aromatics and grapefruit hoppy notes the flavor of this complex straw colored ale tapers off to peppery dry finish IBU
Belgian Style Ale Belgian Style Ale aged in wine barrels with citrus peel Champagne color white pepper aroma citrus vanilla flavor sparkling body

The Saison Dupont is top fermentation beer with refermentation in the bottle Since this beer has been brewed in our farm brewery during the winter time Then this beer became second refermentation in the barrel During the next summer this very thirst quenching beer was served to the saisoniers which were working on the fields Surely therefore our Saison Dupont is considered as the classic among the Belgian season beers Coppery blond the finest aromas and strong bitterness transform this beer into thirst quenchener with no equal just the way it was created Our selection of yeasts is the perfect base for these typical aromas and ditto taste real refermentation in the bottle which will continue for long time in your cellar result into this complex and particular aromatic beer

Saison Brett based on our very popular Tank is assertively dry hopped then bottle conditioned with various yeasts including Brettanomyces wild strain that imparts distinctive earthy quality Though this farmhouse ale was given three months of bottle age prior to release further cellaring will continue to enhance the Brett character if that what you re after IBU
This is saison featuring the rare Japanese developed hop Sorachi Ace The Sorachi Ace hop varietal is noted for its unique lemon zest lemongrass aroma

Arthur was our grandfather youngest brother Hill Farmstead Brewery rests upon the land that was once home to him and his siblings In his honor this Saison is crafted from American malted barley American and European hops our distinctive farmhouse yeast and water from our well Unfiltered and naturally carbonated this is the ale that dream to have shared with Arthur

Saison Rue is an unfiltered bottle conditioned Belgian French style farmhouse ale This is beer of subtlety and complexity with malted rye spicy fruity yeast notes biscuit like malt backbone and slight citrus hop character With age this beer will dry out and will become more complex with rustic notes of leather and earth from the contribution of wild yeast strain Being saison Saison Rue is ambiguous unto itself as it is different beer when fresh and when aged
Belgian style Farmhouse Ale brewed with peppercorns Mahogany color black pepper aroma roasted malt and spice flavor creamy body

Colette is our homage to the saisons that Belgian farm workers have enjoyed for centuries Brewed with barley wheat and rice and fermented at high temperatures with special blend of four different yeast strains Colette is fruity and slightly tart with dry finish that makes it that rarest of treats beer as refreshing as it is complex Great American Beer Festival Silver Medal French Belgian Style Saison Silver Australian International Beer Awards Australian International Beer Awards Bronze Medal Belgian and French Style Ale
Anna is Bière de Miel brewed with raw wildflower Vermont honey and our house saison yeast
Plans call for Saison du BUFF to be alc vol Saison brewed with parsley sage rosemary and thyme This beer will be brewed three times once at each brewery using the same recipe
Special Brettanomyces yeast provides added dryness and crisp complexity to the Seizoen Bretta Bottle conditioned with pear juice for natural carbonation

Les Bons Voeux means best wishes which is what Brasserie Dupont sends with this very special saison ale brewed for the holidays Redolently aromatic rich and velvety Rich gold color fragrant lemony with hints of pepper banana and clove as all the beers of Dupont are with full deep malt richness that lingers on your tongue for what seems the whole holiday season Considered by some the finest offering from this unparalleled Brewery The best Belgian beer if ever there could be such an award sumptuous seductive beer Because of it intensity would recommend the novice graduate to this beer However if saison that is starting to lean towards being triple appeals to you and if its in season don hesitate
Our Seizoen Bretta oak aged and loaded with tons of local organic peaches pound and half per gallon First released in ml bottles May Second release in January Third Release February
Prairie Standard is our everyday beer Its light crisp saison with hoppy finish This beer is dry hopped lb per bbl with Motueka hops lovely New Zealand hop with spicy lime like flavor and aroma

Bringing down the Farmhouse Our interpretation of the rustic Wallonian Saison style is harmonious blend of rustic grains spicy yeast and unique sauvignon blanc tones Inviting lemon grass and gooseberry meet peppery spice and fresh grain aromas Spicy Belgian yeast create complex yet dry and refreshing canvas with splashes of citrus and stone fruit with bright tropical white wine finish Hop bitterness is assertive yet harmonious rounding out slightly tart and refreshing

This delicious farmhouse ale is named for our Jack Russell who struck by car bounced back in fine tenacious Jack Russell fashion and is brewed for those of us who knocked down have picked up dusted off and carried on undaunted Golden naturally cloudy bottle conditioned and dry hopped for perfectly refreshing balance of spicy malts hops and yeast Please enjoy our beers in good health And look both ways when crossing the street

Two yeast strains were used to create this unique Belgian style ale The first Saison yeast establishes the flavor foundations of classic Belgian style ale The second our house strain of Brettanomyces yeast contributes myriad flavors including pear apricot graham cracker and bread crust portion of Interlude is aged in red wine barrels which imparts distinctive vinous plum character and dry almost tannic finish
Artisan ale aged in oak barrels
A tart refreshing saison brewed with our dear friend Luc Bim Lafontaine formerly of Dieu du Ciel Lime hibiscus and blood orange in mixed fermentation

A modern take on Belgian classicFirst Release April In spring Stone bought the farm literally taking over acres of fertile Southern California soil where we now grow pristine fruits vegetables herbs and more for our Stone Brewing World Bistro Gardens restaurants taste of our homespun farm to tableism is provided in this farmhouse ale Lemon zest grains of paradise lemon thyme and lavender harvested in Southern California fields including our own at Stone Farms provide citrus and floral character along with subtle tantalizing spice Thanks to the infusion of fresh West Coast ingredients this isn your everyday saison It our saison Stone

Over the ages the term cellar door has numerously been referred to as the most beautiful term in the English language Upon setting out to create the first summer addition to the Stateside line up of ales the feeling that almost instantly came to me was that of beauty cleansing Many summer offerings tend to lack the complexity of their bigger colder season counterparts so my goal was to craft an ale of extreme balance with delicate complexity that allows for contemplation while also providing quaffable refreshment Starting with base of German wheat pale malts this crisp slightly hazy foundation was then accented with blend of Sterling Citra hops providing intricate blend of herbal grass tangerine citrus flavors and aroma To pull this all together and to complete the cleansing aspect of my vision gently finished the ale off with touch of white sage lending mild earthy spice character to the blend Of course let not forget our house saison yeast that brought all the elements together leaving dry yet intricate finish

Allagash Saison is our interpretation of classic Belgian farmhouse style It is golden hued beer brewed with Row blend malted rye oats and dark Belgian candi sugar Saison is hopped with Tettnang Bravo and Cascade hops Fermented with traditional saison yeast strain Saison exhibits notes of spice and tropical fruit in the aroma Citrus and peppery spice dominate the flavor and make way for pleasant malt character Saison is full bodied with remarkably dry finish

Prairie Hop is our hop driven saison This beer is packed with Simcoe and Citra hops Notes of peach mango and tangerine can be found in the flavor and aroma of this beer The beer finishes dry which helps the hops jump out of the glass flavor wise

ABV IBUs This Franco Belgian style Farmhouse Ale has an effervescent body and light straw color Rabbid Rabbit with it light malt body augmented by spices is complex and frothy beverage with deceptively high alcohol content March release

Florence was our grandfather sister and Hill Farmstead Brewery rests upon the land that was once home to her and her siblings In her honor this Belgian inspired Wheat ale is crafted from American malted barley Organic Vermont wheat European and American hops our distinctive farmhouse yeast and water from our well It is unfiltered and naturally carbonated Soft cloudy and fresh this is the ale that dream to have shared with Florence Pale Malt Vermont Organic Wheat American and European Hops Ale Yeast and our Well Water
Repackaging of Saison

When you brew as much as we do sometimes we get tired of telling the yeast what to do For Apex Predator Farmhouse Ale we pitch the yeast cold turn off the temperature control and let the yeast do it thing To our delight it spat out the sweet scent of juicy fruit wafting from frothy white mane Brewed only with grain and sugar unencumbered by the heat of the kiln we create hazy golden body Apex Predator gets its teeth from generous Crystal dry hopping that completes the dry finish with fruity bite Pounce on the opportunity to let it part your lips and you may find yourself at the top of the food chain IBU

Saison Bernice is an exquisitely fermented farmhouse ale Dry and refreshing Bernice is made of the freshest on hand and locally available ingredients She saw multiple yeast additions including Brettanomyces and further bottle aging Drink now or cellar properly Saison Bernice will endure The beer in this bottle is alive So is the yeast Grow it keep it use it We encourage you to brew your own

Brewed with the Saison and farmhouse ales of Belgium in mind we added fresh Georgia peaches and Brettanomyces claussenii to fresh white wine barrel and aged the Saison base for months Stretching the boundaries of the traditional style we decided to put our own little spin on it Formerly known as Mae

This Farmhouse Ale traces its roots to the small rustic breweries of Southern Belgium The word Saison comes to us from the French language and it means Season Lightly spiced with Organic Ginger Orange Peels Black Pepper and Grains of Paradise this brew promises to quench your thirst on the hottest Southern California days or wherever your travels may take you

Prairie Ale is our classic saison We brew this beer with pilsner malt wheat malt flaked wheat and cane sugar healthy dose of saaz hops are used to add spicy element to the beer Prairie Ale is fermented with mix of ale yeast wine yeast and brettanomyces Notes of black pepper and pineapple can be found in this beer

Artisan ale aged in oak barrelsTranslated from French as old tradition Vieille is our barrel aged classical saison Using time honored techniques our saisons employ traditional methods to restore complexity and the rustic character lost in modern day saison Saisons were the original wild ales brewed for the farmhands to be refreshing and sustaining beverage Each batch of Vieille takes on soft Brettanomyces character and complex acidity while conditioning in our large oak foeders After conditioning in oak we lightly dry hop the beer to finish it lending subtle citrusy hop aroma Leading with lemon and lime citrusy hop notes subtle herbal spice and crisp tart finish Vieille character epitomizes artisan saison

Stateside Saison pays homage to old world tradition while celebrating new world innovation Naturally brewed with the finest European malts fresh aromatic hops from the United States New Zealand It then fermented using classic farmhouse ale yeast and bottle conditioned to enhance stability The outcome is beer of unique design and exquisite taste showcasing some of the best attributes of modern day craft brewing
Birra is light sessionable farmhouse ale It is crisp with notes of black pepper and orange and goes perfectly with food

Farmhouse style Saison with Brettanomyces Amarillo and Simcoe Hops Brewed in celebration of Lent and Easter season Carnevale is light bodied Saison using Brettanomyces along with Amarillo and Simcoe hops to generate flavor and depth Carnevale complexity grows with time The citrus notes tend to wane and the wild yeast rears its wonderfully tasting head first release did not have brettanomyces

Merica is single malt single hop farmhouse ale It brewed with floor malted pilsner and lbs per bbl Nelson Sauvin hops The beer is conditioned with brett strains and wine yeast The Nelson hops provide white wine flavors while Brettanomyces add juicy quality to the beer

Collaboration with Hill Farmstead BreweryRegional beer based on malt spelt hops US It was developed and manufactured jointly with our American friend Shaun Hill Hill Farmstead Brewery Greensboro Vermont USA It continues to be brewed at our facilities in Braugies We exchanged our know how to create this blond with pronounced bitterness with slight lemon aftertaste

Chardonnay barrel fermented Saison that uses our house blend of Brett and bacteria Batch spent months in oak and then months bottle conditioning Bright citrus billowy mouthfeel classic funk round out the flavor profile of this rustic Saison
Ale brewed with Hobbs Family rose hips peppercorns and fresh orange peels Dry hopped in the barrel with Citra hops Second fermentation in Pinot Noir barrels

This ale embodies the spirit of perpetual creative collaboration in conjunction with disciplined brewing endeavor We trekked to Alaska and helped craft this rustic Saison bringing with us the essence and imagination of our Vermont Farmstead family Brewed and Bottled by Anchorage Brewing Company Anchorage Alaska

Mature beer refermented in oak barrels with wild yeast and souring bacteria is blended with fresh dry hopped beer prior to bottle conditioning Dry and lightly tart with notes of citrus barnyard and tropical fruit

Clara was our grandfather sister Hill Farmstead Brewery rests upon the land that was once home to her and her siblings In her honor this Grisette is crafted from American malted barley Vermont Organic Wheat European and American hops our distinctive farmhouse yeast and water from our well Unfiltered and naturally carbonated this is the ale that dream to have shared with Clara Pale Malt Organic Vermont Wheat American and European Hops Ale Yeast and our Well Water

Formerly ScullyWhite Pepper Strawberry SaisonAfter free rise fermentation with our Saison yeast strain we add crushed white pepper mashed fresh Michigan strawberries and Local Farmer market honey to create dry drinkable yet complex Saison variation Named in honor of Gillian Anderson who worked at Goose Island Brewpub in Chicago IL while student at DePaul University IBU

A beer cloaked in secrecy An ale whose mysterious and unusual palate will swirl across your tongue and ask more questions than it answers sort of dry crisp refreshing not quite pale ale is really impossible to describe because there never been anything else quite like it IBU

Treat yourself to rare delight The voluminous raspberry bouquet will greet you long before your lips touch your glass Serve this Wisconsin framboise very cold in champagne flute Then hold your glass to light and enjoy the jewel like sparkle of very special ale Oregon proudly shares their harvest of mouth watering berries which we ferment spontaneously in large oak vats Then we employ Wisconsin farmed wheat and year old Hallertau hops to round out this extravaganza of flavor
This brew achieves its unique raspberry taste by the addition of only fresh raspberries at five seperate stages in the brewing process

You hold the marriage of wine and beer Belgian Red is tapestry of flavor This beer is brewed with whole Montmorency Cherries Wisconsin Farmed Wheat and Belgian Roasted Barleys lagered in oak tanks and balanced by Hallertau hops we aged in our brewery one full year Over pound of Door County Cherries in every bottle makes this beer uniquely Wisconsin So unique in fact that we applied for patent Expect this beer to be ruby red with medium body that is highly carbonated and intense with cherry flavor and bouquet Serve your friends Belgian Red in brandy snifter or champagne flute and toast life with beer from the land of Wisconsin

Experience the magic of Purple Haze Clouds of real raspberries swirl in this tart and tantalizing lager inspired by the good spirits and dark mysteries of New Orleans Brewed with pilsner and wheat malts along with Vanguard hops let the scent of berries in the hazy purple brew put spell on you

Long ago ale was known as liquid bread We ve used our long history of creating the finest malt blends added fair trade bananas to awaken the senses with seriously fruity rich yet surprisingly versatile banana bread beer An inspired brew made with our own natural mineral water fairtrade bananas Tempting Banoffee aromas flavors are balanced by the silky richness of masterful malt blend the peppery spice of the freshest ripest hops

Severe Drought we shared the farmer horror as Wisconsin cherry crop failed Dan bought what cherries he could The Apple crop fared better Then joy grand Wisconsin cranberry harvest What will Dan brew with Apples Cranberries and Cherries Oh my You hold the happy accident of Wisconsin favorite fruit aged in oak with an almost magical wild fermentation Serendipity is wondrous celebration that sparkles your senses and dances across your palate kaleidoscope of flavor discovered by accident in sour ale Cheers to the unexpected

Like Lady Liberty we stand for independence and perseverance In the pursuit of innovative beer there is no obstacle too great No journey too long No fruit too gigantic This American wheat beer is brewed with real watermelon for flavor that surprisingly crisp dry and refreshing summer in can IBU

When our love of fruit and our love of beer come together Blushing Monk happens Brewed with ridiculous amount of raspberries for tart yet luscious raspberry jam character and fermented with Belgian yeast for subtle fruit and spice esters Think of Blushing Monk as Rubaeus older sibling more intense slightly larger and just little bit more mature

As its name suggests Éphémère is an ephemeral ale that comes and goes with the seasons It was developed as series to feature seasonal fruit in refreshing lightly spiced white ale The label depicts fairy an ephemeral spirit associated with fruits picked at the peak of ripeness during each harvest season She first appeared in the spring of and has since been celebrated on variety of seasonal fruit ales such as apple brewed all year long cranberry blackcurrant peach raspberry and blueberry The most beloved and well known of the Éphémère beer series Its amazing popularity across North America has made it year round favourite instead of only seasonal brew

Brewed with lbs of yams per barrel in other words lot of yams this autumn seasonal is different take on the pumpkin beer style Brewed with cinnamon nutmeg allspice vanilla molasses and maple syrup and fermented with our traditional Belgian yeast strain this bold and spicy beer is perfect on cold autumn evening ABV IBU SRM Release Fall

Black Blue is Belgian style golden ale fermented with blackberries and blueberries Because we dose Black Blue with real berries rather than artificial flavoring the fruit comes through in the flavor not just the aroma The pureed berries are added as the beer leaves the brewhouse In fermentation the yeast the same one we use in Red White and Pangaea feeds on sugars from the barley and the berries giving Black Blue unique complexity and high ABV IBU
Diploma Master Brewer Dan employed juicy sweet Strawberries to tame the barbaric wild tart fermentation of rhubarb Bright sour and effervescent

Mango Magnifico is high gravity fruit beer brewed with mango and touch of habaneros to add just the right amount of heat The delicate flavors imparted by the sweet richness of the mango are punctuated perfectly by the subtle heat of the habaneros proving that fruit beers do not have to be one note

You ll have soft spot for this one Using only fresh Michigan tart cherries this beauty tantalizes with intense flavors combined with no hesitation malt bill Adding fresh cherries at five separate stages of fermentation achieves the ultimate balance between tartness and sweetness

Strawberry Harvest Lager is wheat beer made with real Louisiana strawberries picked late in the season when they re at their sweetest This brew has earned quite reputation in short time causing the brewery to up their production year after year When this brew is found emails and phone calls fly to friends informing them of the store location Strawberry Harvest is crisp light lager with just hint of strawberry sweetness IBU

This refreshing brew is made with juice from freshly picked Texas Ruby Red grapefruits the prize of the Rio Grande Valley bold kick of ginger flavor combines with the tartness of the citrus for tasty brew that perfect anytime of year Pure two row and Munich malts along with Mt Hood Citra and Willamette hops give it nicely balanced lip smacking finish We like to think popping open this bottle is like slicing into ripe Texas grapefruit So pucker up and enjoy

For our first new ounce packs in nearly half decade we replaced the classic barley foundation of beer with mild sorghum base The hints of molasses and pit fruit are balanced by vibrant strawberry notes and unique complexity that comes with the addition of malty buckwheat honey We believe health conscious beer drinkers and the millions of Americans who suffer from Celiac disease can cut back on gluten while relishing the distinction and drinkability of this very special brew

An ale brewed with ridiculous amount of pureed raspberries over ton of em Fort has Belgian style base then we follow similar fermentation process to the one we use on our other super high ABV beers Minute IPA and World Wide Stout IBUABV varies from

Soft Parade is Fruit Rye Ale brewed with rye flakes and loaded with pureed strawberries blueberries raspberries and blackberries The rose colored ale has aromas of ripe strawberries and grain With flavors of fresh berries and rye Soft Parade finishes dry and eminently drinkable Soft Parade was originally developed because Joe Short wanted to create beer that incorporated medley of berries had great color and appealed to wine drinkers The name Soft Parade stemmed from two moments in Joe Short life First because Joe worked as brewer at the Traverse Brewing Company and The Doors album The Soft Parade played every day at the end of the brew shift The second moment occurred when Joe was driving by himself flipping through CD in his car and came across The Soft Parade album again At the time The Soft Parade beer had not been named and it dawned on Joe that the medley of fruit infusing into the golden beer reminded him of soft parade That day the beer was named
Originally named Apricot Weizen
Our unique contribution to the fruit ale category features the nutty quench of wheat ale combined with the delightful aromatics and subtle fruit flavor contributed by Maine wild blueberries

Real grapefruit juice gives this deliciously refreshing Radler mixed beer drink its amber natural cloudiness and pleasant tangy taste The refreshingly fruity taste makes Stiegl Radler Grapefruit wonderful thirst quencher

We employ the humble cucumber in low gravity Saison to create vibrant ale with notes of melon tropical fruit lemongrass and of course cucumber Put some cucumber wheels on your eyes relax and enjoy Ahhhh
Although this is pumpkin beer it is lager and therefore doesn belong in the pumpkin ale category Originally Side Project now Fall seasonal in six packs

Our smooth wheat beer is light in color and body perfect for those looking for lighter taste The combination of wheat and barley gives Apricot Wheat different malt character than our other ales The hint of apricot gives this beer pleasant nose and fruity finish

We have added natural raspberry flavor to our UFO Hefeweizen to create this beer Consistent with the hefeweizen style this beer is unfiltered and cloudy with solid foamy head UFO Raspberry has distinctive hazy rose color The scent of fresh raspberries hits the nose immediately along with subtle bready aroma from the wheat and yeast The body is light and the unfiltered yeast provides soft mouthfeel The taste of the fruit compliments the beer nicely neither overwhelms the other There is faint sweetness on the palate which finishes cleanly in semi dry tart finish IBU

Doubly good in triple digits our unique summer seasonal is made with the fruit of the prickly pear cactus native to Shiner Texas With tart citrusy flavor and crisp finish it the best use of cactus yet
An unfiltered American wheat ale made with real mean peaches The only thing missing is the fuzz Savor the anger Available during the late Spring and Summer months

Our Lemon Shandy is unique take on the classic Shandy that is distinctly Shock Top Brewed with two row and six row malted barley and five different types of hops this Belgian Style Wheat Ale is then combined with citrus peels coriander natural lemonade flavor and hint of sugar for subtle sweetness The end result is an incredibly refreshing crisp and smooth beer that hits the spot
Brewed with fresh harvested spring honey and infused with fresh blueberries light refreshing ale with nice blueberry aroma crackery malt flavors hint of sweetness and refreshing blueberry finish

This brew combines Row Pilsen malt hint of Crystal malt and of course plenty of malted wheat hint of blackberry at the finish makes this beer real thirst quencher For the health conscious Blackbeary Wheat has less than grams of carbs and only calories per bottle IBU

This beer is light bodied easy drinking ale We use real raspberries late in fermentation giving this beer mild fruit flavor while keeping very balanced malt profile This may not be what some would expect from fruit beer but our brewers make good beer not fruity carbonated malt beverages Our motto is beer first fruit second
Beer Brewed with Pumpkin and Spices
Also known as La Bouffonne Rouge
A light ale with hints of fresh orange Brewed with sweet orange peel orange blossom extract and honey

Curious Traveler is our take on classic European Shandy that has been brewed for generations We started with an American craft wheat ale which delivers crisp light body We then added fresh lemon and just touch of lime to bring out bright juicy citrus aroma and flavor Simply the Curious Traveler is Quite Refresher

Brewed in Scotland since C heather ale is probably the oldest style of ale still produced in the world From an ancient Gaelic recipe for leann fraoich heather ale it has been revived and reintroduced to the Scottish culture Into the boiling bree of malted barley sweet gale and flowering heather are added then after cooling slightly the hot ale is poured into vat of fresh heather flowers where it infuses for an hour before being fermented

Introduced by the Vikings spruce and pine ales were very popular in the Scottish Highlands until the end of the th century Many early explorers including Captain Cook used spruce ale during long sea voyages since it prevented scurvy and ill health Shetland spruce ale was said to stimulate animal instincts and give you twins Alba is triple style ale brewed to traditional Highland recipe from Scots pine and spruce shoots pickled during early spring Pure malted barley is boiled with the young sprigs of pine for several hours then the fresh shoots of the spruce are added for short infusion before fermentation

With the help of biomolecular archaeologist Dr Patrick McGovern we ve re created another Ancient Ale this time from the Nordic climes of Scandinavia The recipe for Kvasir was developed with the help of chemical botanical and pollen evidence taken from year old Danish drinking vessel The vessel made of birch bark was found in the tomb of leather clad woman Dr Pat says was probably an upper class dancer or priestess The analysis pointed to the ingredients used in this unique brew wheat lingonberries cranberries myrica gale yarrow honey and birch syrup The base of Kvasir is toasty red winter wheat and the bog grown berries deliver pungent tartness While handful of hops is used the earthy bitter counterpunch to the sweet honey and birch syrup comes from the herbs

Introduced to Scotland by Welsh druids in the th Century elderberry black ale was part of the Celtic Autumn festivals when the elders would make this strong ale and pass the drink round the people of the village The recipe was taken from th Century record of domestic drinking in the Scottish Highlands Elderberries were used for many natural remedies to cure sciatica other forms of neuralgia influenza and rhumatism as they contain tannins and fruit oils Ebulum is made from roasted oats barley and wheat boiled with herbs then fermented with ripe elderberries

From the Gaelic Groseid Since at least the th century Scots monks and alewives brewed indigenous drinks from cereals wild herbs and ripe fruits Tibbie Shiels green Grozet was immortalised by such Scots literati as Sir Walter Scott Jas Hogg The Ettrick shepherd and Robert Burns whoconsidered it most convivial drink Brewed with lager malt wheat bog myrtle hops and meadowsweet then secondary fermented with ripe Scottish gooseberries

At least four hundred years ago the coastal Island farmers of Scotland used seaweed beds to grow their cereal crops This barley produced very interesting flavors in the ale and whiskey they produced Including bladderwrack seaweed in the mash tun along with organic barley gives this wholesome dark ale distinctive flavor
Created by Dr Fritz Briem of Doemens Institute http www doemens org brewed by Weihenstephan Doemens

This version of Special Herbs is composed of Reggae Junkie Gruit aged in Old Tom Gin barrels and wine barrels that previously fermented Fantasia peach beer unique brew incorporating wine and gin barrel aging to farmhouse style gruit The recipe uses lemongrass sweet and bitter orange peels hyssop and Sichuan peppercorns bit of spelt in the grist helps maintain some body although the Special Herbs leans in bright and dry direction

Jopen Koyt is gruitbeer herb beer that is brewed according to the bierkeur city recipe from The beer is brewed with malted barley malted wheat and oats and has malty taste with smooth herbal finish The aroma has hint of herbs and spices mixed with dark malt Jopen Koyt is the only gruitbeer from the Netherlands Gold medal winner at the European Beerstar competition in and silver medal at the European Beerstar Competition in
Malty with plum like fruitiness that is offset by spicy earthy bitterness

A raiding party to your senses this Viking beer is meant to be enjoyed unapologetically Sweet floral and exploding with sour flavor this ancient ale was created by the Vikings claimed by the Scott lost to time and given rebirth by our brewers to share amongst the enlightened
A pale ale brewed with yarrow myrtle and rosemary This comes from the label and is very helpful and informative when looking at the description of the beer

Spring Tonic was brewed with plants that were coming up in our garden during mid spring this year dandelion carrot tops and clover with ginger from All Seasons Farm in Cobden It is fermented with our wild house culture Spring Tonic has lemonade like tartness with light ginger finish
Lavender Rosemary and Thyme Used For Bittering

Discovery your inner Viking with our ever changing unhopped fruit ale Combining gentian and angelica root cherry bark yarrow elderberries and dandelion greens it is distinctly unique beer from an ancient brewing tradition

Beau is proud to present the most recent evolution of new style of beer we call the Eastern Ontario Gruit Prepare yourself for full out assault on your palate Intense flavours and aromatics of raisin hazelnut herbal bitters burnt toast pisang goreng cola and bubblegum are achieved through the alchemy of double mash of dark malts Belgian trappist ale yeasts and bogmyrtle hand picked in the Eastern Ontario wilderness
Bourbon Barrel Aged Gruit Brewed with Yarrow and Rosemary collab with Short Brewing

Buenos Dias is gruit ale brewed with organic lime juice organic orange and lime peel and sea salt The zippy lime flavour is accented with lick of salt Kick back and enjoy the zest of classic Margarita in each refreshing sip Buenos Dias pours light yellow with slight haze and white foam The aroma offers pronounced citrus notes with subtle coriander undercurrents Zippy lime flavour is accented with wicking salt edge in the mouthfeel The finish is quick clean and dry

A Salt Spring Style Heather beer Heatherdale Ale was created for the world famous Butchart Gardens in Victoria Heather ale is Scottish actually Pictish style that dates back thousands of years BC Our Heatherdale ale is dark gold lightly hopped with East Kent Goldings then infused with the aroma of Heather flowers from the Butchart Gardens Mild with floral aroma
Scottish gruit with juniper berries and heather stab at the vaunted Heather Ale of Pictish lore
Bottle conditioned sour ale brewed without hops Bittered and flavored with sage basil lemon thyme rosemary and lavender from our garden and fermented with our wild house mixed culture
Truly unique reddish brown ale that is primarily bittered with Blessed Thistle The late addition of Goldings hops and ginger add to the flavours of this most complex of beers

This ale is brewed at Klackabacken in Önnestad from water pilsner and carapils malt and then boiled with cascade hops and spruce shoots before it fermented with Saison yeast Because the Ale is unfiltered it might be bit turbid but it will get clear if kept upright in the fridge for couple of days Keep dark and cool

Made with Connecticut grown ingredients including sweet gale from our land spruce tips from Tiny Acre Farm Woodstock CT Thrall Family Malt Windsor CT Fox Hollow Hops Colchester CT and our own well water Fermented and foeder aged with combination of our own house culture and Voss kveik unique Norwegian farmhouse yeast strain
Unhopped wild sour ale with foraged herbs and flowers refermented with chardonnay grapes and aged year in white wine barrels
Barrel aged old ale style gruit with chaga mushrooms and maple syrup

Dragonmead uses heather tips imported from Scotland to create this unusual brew Its malty sweet aroma does not disappoint Chocolate Malt imparts great deal of the flavor of this beer but does not over power the finish which is defined by the powdery dryness of the heather All in all malty brew with very clean finish
A ribald Imperial Pale Gruit with his and hers aphrodisiacs Yohimbe bark from Africa Muira Puama from South America and domestic Damiana for everyone else

Brewed with roasted Kintoki Sweet Potatoes from Saitama Japan This imperial Amber is rich and smooth bodied in style perfectly balanced with earthy hop bitterness With the aroma of caramel sweet potato and hops Beniaka delivers on all senses Because of the use of sweet potato as secondary ingredient Japanese laws classify Coedo Beniaka as Happoshu malt beverage
Our innovative brew is produced with higher alcohol content sharp dry accent and rich malt flavor With newly matured taste this is the SPECIAL
Blueberry and cherries from Yoichi Hokkaido are used in this fine ale The tart cherry notes work in perfect harmony with the refreshing blueberry sweetness Malt PaleHops Fuggle Kent Golding
European Pears grown in Yoichi Hokkaido are used to compliment the clear lineage of lager beer with sweet fragrance that lingers Better than any cider Malt PilsnerHops Perle Hersbrucker
The Yamanashi peaches brewed into this delicious award winning wheat beer are so sweet and juicy you won be able to put this one down Malt PaleHops Fuggle Kent Golding
The specialty local fruit of Hokkaido red meat Dream Melons are used to produce this exotic fruit beer characterized by sweet overtones of honeydew and cantaloupe Malt PaleHops Fuggle Kent Golding

Dry tart and decisively unique Shokunin koji ale is delicate ale of mixed fermentation Using koji special rice mould and traditional sake yeast with no bittering hops added boasts aromatic notes of stone fruit and citrus This sake beer hybrid features koji rice and sake yeast The result is dry slightly tart easy drinking koji ale

Refreshingly cool taste produced with freshly squeezed lemon juice from Japanese Hiroshima Lemons fermented and bottled as the perfect thirst quencher no matter what season Malt PaleHops Fuggle Kent Golding
Brewed using honey and apples from Yoichi Hokkaido this cider like beer has an incredibly crisp taste that sure to leave you wanting more Malt PaleHops Fuggle Kent Golding
Our unique Yuzu Lager is brewed with Yuzu from the village of Umaji in Kochi Japan village famous for popularizing this tantalizing fruit Malt PilsnerHops Fuggle Kent Golding

This sweet yet dry beer is made with ingredients found in year old drinking vessels from the tomb of King Midas Somewhere between wine and mead Midas will please the chardonnay and beer drinker alike IBU

Swedish flags are fairly common sight in our part of the country Holiday parties often have warm concoctions of spices and booze at the ready to knock the ice off of toes while raising spirits We were inspired by Glögg party deciding on the spot to brew beer that pays tribute to this Nordic tradition XMAS ale combines traditional brewing ingredients with figs orange peels cardamom cinnamon clove and ginger root It a holiday addition to the X line and another reason to toast to the season but unlike Glögg we recommend serving this one chilled

Let travel back in time again for another Dogfish Head Ancient Ale Midas Touch was our first foray and Theobroma our most recent Our destination is years ago in Northern China Preserved pottery jars found in the Neolithic villiage of Jiahu in Henan province have revealed that mixed fermented beverage of rice honey and fruit was being produced that long ago right around the same time that barley beer and grape wine were beginning to be made in the Middle East Fast forward to Molecular archaeologist Dr Patrick McGovern of the University of Pennsylvania Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology calls on Dogfish Head to re create another ancient beverage and Chateau Jiahu is born In keeping with historic evidence Dogfish brewers use brown rice syrup orange blossom honey muscat grape barley malt and hawthorn berry The wort is fermented for about month with sake yeast until the beer is ready for packaging IBU

Ingredients Malts Northwest Harrington Crystal Triumph Maier Munich Hops Styrian Golding Amarillo Specialty Juniper berries Rogue Yeast Water Rogue Pacman Yeast Free Range Coastal Water º PLATO IBU AAº Lovibond
Agave complements the refreshingly light quality of our wheat and adds subtle note of flavor that expands this beer uplifting taste profile It is familiar yet creative

This beer is based on beverage that may have been enjoyed by the Etruscans of Ancient Italy around BC strong ale containing an Italian heirloom grain called Cappelli Senatore along with pomegranate juice raisins and hazelnut flour together with types of honey chestnut wildflower and clover Spiced with several hop flowers Gentian root and tree resin think Myrrh in the kettle

Rosée Hibiscus is delicate wheat beer with floral and lightly acidic character Its beautiful pink colour comes from the hibiscus flowers used in the brewing process perfumed aroma invokes fresh pink grapefruit and the pleasing texture persists nicely refreshing quenching ale perfect for hot summer days nights

Skillful in shallow waters yet adept when it becomes deep and rough Dead Rise boats were specifically crafted to navigate the unique waters of the Chesapeake Our Dead Rise summer ale brewed with OLD BAY was brewed to support True Blue groundbreaking initiative to support the Maryland Blue Crab industry Malt ProprietaryHop ProprietaryYeast ProprietaryBrewed with Old Bay Seasoning and Lemon IBU

For this ambitious liquid time capsule we used ingredients and traditions plucked from Egyptian hieroglyphics Ta Henket is brewed with an ancient form of wheat and loaves of hearth baked bread and it flavored with chamomile dom palm fruit and Middle Eastern herbs To ferment this earthy ancient ale Sam and friends traveled to Cairo set out baited petri dishes and captured native Egyptian saccharomyces yeast strain IBU
Formerly Rosie and Hibiscus Wheat Tart summer ale infused with lbs of Hibiscus flowers and touch of orange peel Her sexy pink hue leaves her to be desired

Based on Franklin original recipe which called for barley molasses and essence of spruce our Tavern Spruce is as approachable and engaging as was the man himself We source blue spruce clippings from local organic farmer steeping them in the kettle to create this one of kind deep amber ale
Marketed as Real Ginger Brew in the USA Ginger Ale is brewed using fresh fragrant raw ginger Malts Marris Otter Munich Crystal ChocolateHops Chinook Perle Styrian GoldingAdjuncts raw ginger

This spiced amber wheat ale is our celebration of the arrival of Autumn Using the finest malted barley and small amount of wheat for mouthfeel Jaw Jacker displays brilliant orange amber color despite the absence of pumpkin in the recipe The addition of cinnamon all spice and nutmeg in the exact proportions of family pumpkin pie recipe creates refreshingly spicy season brew
Coney Island Hard Root Beer is new twist on an old favorite With hints of vanilla licorice and birch this root beer will bring you back to the boardwalk

We honor our Pops with this beer His vision built the Leisure Time ice brand decades ago and inspired us to build Jack Abby as family business Leisure Time Lager is brewed with wheat and blend of spices including lemongrass coriander orange peel and chamomile subtle spiciness balances the citrusy and floral hops added to the whirl and hopback Relax and enjoy Leisure Time Lager uses locally grown wheat from MA IBU
Fresh organic orange zest and cracked coriander complement the orange blossom honey used in this ale Like mountain breeze through the citrus trees OG IBU
Our exploration into the flavors of mole the legendary sauce of central Mexico Malty aroma and rich cocoa laden body laced with an invigorating tinge of dries chilies and coffee
Applehead is crisp refreshing wheat ale with delightful apple aroma and subtle cinnamon flavor

This amber ale is crafted with ginger and molasses to capture the familiar taste of gingerbread on cold winter night Created in collaboration with our fans Gingerbread Spiced Ale combines ginger molasses and winter spices for slight caramel sweetness
This Egyptian inspired brew is spiced with ginger myrrh and orange peel very complex
IBU

Gold Medal Winner at Great American Beer Fest Herb and Spice Category rich black ale with roasted malt flavors blended with bittersweet chocolate our own blend of three Mexican chili peppers and cinnamon

The scent of our brewery on brew days is irresistible Akin to the morning first brewed batch of perfectly roasted coffee the aromas envelope you and cause the corners of your lips to curl into the slightest unconscious smile In this brew lightly toasted malts with subtly spicy hops blend into cinnamon flavors and creamy lactose sugar Their coalescence is so uncannily close to fresh baked cinnamon rolls that it was impossible to name this beer anything other than Cinnamon Roll Imperial Ale Pairs perfectly with eggs benedict at brunch after dinner or next to the fire for an unforgettable nightcap

It took while for us to come up with UFO beer that could withstand the darkest days of the year but the warmth of ginger combined with the seasonal spice of cinnamon and clove form perfect companion for visit to Gingerland Brewed not Baked Poured not sliced Inspired by classic tale Deliciously spiced Welcome to Gingerland
This is fermented malt beverage meaning it is pretty much beer but it tastes just like root beer The ABV brew has tinge on malt flavor on the finish other than that it tastes just like soda

Our first unfiltered offering Summer Swelter Ale is the perfect warm weather beer Summer Swelter Ale is light and refreshing while still keeping your taste buds interested The malt base features hefty dose of wheat for big fluffy head and soft round body yet keeps the beer drinkable even during the dog days The light malt character is more than balanced by blend of citrusy American hops giving Swelter crisp bitterness without being overpowering The hoppy citrus aroma complements the ingredients that make this beer so unique lemon and lime peel Kaffir lime leaves and lemongrass provide an subtle yet unmistakeable floral nose and just touch of bracing tartness taking the refreshment of Swelter to the next level
Ale brewed with spices almond milk cocoa chili black beans avocado leaves

A refreshing wheat beer spiced with fresh ginger root The process of making this wheat beer has been nicknamed special ginger tea due to the fact that we add over lbs of fresh ground ginger root into the boil We use pale malt and wheat as well as Target and Whitbread Goldings Variation hops to flavor this light summer ale Island Ginger is particularly popular during the warmer summer months though thanks to the ginger kick it has it would also be warming in the cold winter months
Shipyard GingerBreadHead Ale is like spicy rich gingerbread cookie you can drink The warm flavors of molasses and brown sugar are accented with ginger cloves and cinnamon
This Bison classic brew is infused with honey for hint of sweetness and aroma Fresh organic basil lends slight herbal note and hint of basil perfectly refreshing brew
IBU Also sold as Peculiar Yule Ingredients Maris Otter Munich caramel and chocolate malt Columbus and Cascade hops different spices English ale yeast and our local Grimstad water

The beer formerly known as LSD kaleidoscopic combination of Lavender Sunflower honey and Dates set the stage for mind bending beer experience as delicate floral aromas dance atop rich notes of fruit and honey

Our delicious easy drinking Best Damn Root Beer is aged on real vanilla beans during the brewing process for full flavored well balanced take on one of our favorite classic tastes We hope you love it as much as we do Cheers

This beer pours deep dark brown with snow white head Aroma notes of Vanilla Cinnamon and sweet milk hit the nose bringing up images of the delicious Mexican drink this beer is styled after The beer hits the palate with Vanilla sweet chocolate malts and hint of cinnamon all with medium body and balancing hop bitterness Enjoy this beer next to roaring fire with your amigos in cozy cabin after long day of skiing the deep powder of the Rocky Mountains This beer fits better into the Herb Spiced Beer Category as it is spiced with ton of Cinnamon and Vanilla and also uses milk sugar It recently took home medal in this category and we believe it is more accurate description then an Imperial porter Thanks and Cheers The Elevation Team
Sunset coloured orangey amber slightly sweet malty palate with dry lemon tea finish Beer made with addition of Black tea leaves and lemon in aging tank Very smooth and quenching unfiltered
John likes gin but John makes beer To reconcile these two things John made Bee Knees cocktail inspired honey saison made with gin spices and lemon juice IBU
A combination between British Red Ale and Belgian Wit Bier
La Meule blond ale with sage frankly bitter with subtle bouquet
This beer biscuity malt flavor and hint of citrusy hops are the backdrop for the bold zest of ginger which adds warming spicy character that just right for cool night IBU
Brewed to celebrate winter in New England Nor Easter Lager possesses hearty malt flavor delicately accented by mild winter spices IBU
An artisanal style IPA combining mildly bitter hops garden fresh jalapeño peppers and cilantro It an easy drinking IPA without the burn or bittering one might expect

Brewed with Centennial hops from the Pacific Northwest and named after the Two Hearted River in Michigan Upper Peninsula this IPA is bursting with hop aromas ranging from pine to grapefruit from massive hop additions in both the kettle and the fermenter Perfectly balanced with malt backbone and combined with the signature fruity aromas of Bell house yeast this beer is remarkably drinkable and well suited for adventures everywhere
Originally named Northstar IPA Debuted in

Minute IPA is continuously hopped more than hop additions over minute boil Getting vibe of where the name came from Minute is brewed with slew of great Northwest hops powerful but balanced East Coast IPA with lot of citrusy hop character it the session beer for hardcore enthusiasts IBU

One of the most well respected and best selling IPAs in the country this golden beauty explodes with citrusy flavor and hop aromas all perfectly balanced by subtle malt character The IPA That Launched Generations of Hop FanaticsFirst Release August By definition an India pale ale is hoppier and higher in alcohol than its little brother pale ale and we deliver in spades Now one of the most well respected and best selling IPAs in the country this golden beauty explodes with citrusy piney hop flavors and aromas all perfectly balanced by subtle malt character This crisp extra hoppy brew is hugely refreshing on hot day but will always deliver no matter when you choose to drink it
From the brewery Sierra Nevada Torpedo Ale is big American IPA bold assertive and full of flavor and aromas highlighting the complex citrus pine and herbal character of whole cone American hops

Fresh Hop Ale no spices We first brewed Celebration IPA in the winter of Each year we use only the first fresh hops of the growing season to create this complex and robust ale Layered pine and citrus hop aromas balance delicately against rich malt sweetness to shape this bold wintertime classic

Thanks for choosing to spend the next few minutes with this special homicidally hoppy ale Savor the moment as the raging hop character engages the Imperial Qualities of the Malt Foundation in mortal combat on the battlefield of your palate This is our unique version of an ancient style style as old as the ocean trade routes of the last centuries of Great Ships Not as old as the equator they had to cross twice en route nor as old as the miles or so of Di Hydrogen Oxide and Sodium upon which they sailed but older than the Circulithium Lentoid that binds the Lupulin Quartnate onto your taste buds Weird Think about it Now stop OK go again Now stop Think again And stop But we digress Made with different hops and various malts this redolent ale will likely float your boat whatever planet you re on IBU

Brewed with wheat malt Willamette Santiam Amarillo Cascade Centennial Chinook and Columbus hops This special ale is something fairly new under the sun It got lot of wheat it rich with hops it finishes dry We ve watched with some amusement as the internet beer rating sites argues over how to classify it We re in the camp with Japhy Ryder when he declares to Ray Smith that Comparisons are odious You ever notice how everything has to be today version of yesterday whatever Well whatEver Sometimes we wonder what the world would be like if everything was perceived for what it is and not what it reminds you of The sun would rise everyday as if for the first time you wake as if newly born you see your lover next to you anew the air would smell like flowers work would be like the first day back in school beer would make your eyes roll back in your head in ecstasy well maybe not but you get the idea Way smooth and silky with nice wheatly esque ish ness truly unique style featuring strong hop finish on silky body hoppy pale wheat ale that is great for IPA fans but so smooth that the hefeweizen fans dig it too IBU

Jai Alai game native to the Basque region of Spain is played on court called fronton Jai Alai players attempt to catch ball using curved mitt whilst the ball travels at speeds up to mph Proving they have sense of humor the Spanish dubbed this game with its ball traveling at race car speeds the merry game Tampa was once home to bustling Jai Alai fronton but sadly all that remains of Jai Alai in the Tampa Bay area is this India Pale Ale that we brew in tribute to the merry game The India Pale Ale style of beer has its roots in the ales sent from England to thirsty British troops in India during the th century Pair Jai Alai India Pale Ale with beef empanadas deviled crabs and other spicy dishes IBU

Get ready to bask in the glory of the frothy head floral bouquet Relish the citrus accents from the abundance of dry hopping This one sweet yet balanced Malty undertones shake hands with the hop character for finish that never turns too bitter IBU

This hoppy American IPA is full bodied beer brewed with American pale and crystal malts and heavily hopped with Chinook Cascade Columbus and Centennial There a trophy in every glass Great American Beer Festival American Style Strong Pale Ale GOLD Colorado State Fair Best of Show Great American Beer Festival American Style Strong Pale Ale SILVER Great American Beer Festival American Style Strong Pale Ale SILVER Great American Beer Festival India Pale Ale GOLD

The beer you ve been waiting for Keeps your taste satisfied while keeping your senses sharp An all day IPA naturally brewed with complex array of malts grains and hops Balanced for optimal aromatics and clean finish The perfect reward for an honest day work and the ultimate companion to celebrate life simple pleasures Formerly Endurance All Day IPA
Bold spicy and menacingly delicious this American hopped IPA offers an aromatic punch and follows through with lasting full bodied finish

This aggressively hopped West Coast IPA showcases stunning pineapple citrus and piney aromas along with exceptional dry hop flavors of grapefruit and tangerine This intense brew finds its balance in honey like pale malt sweetness The name Union Jack is nod to the colonial origins of the IPA style and to the British expatriate who co founded our brewery

Our Award winning IPA with citrus twist Our Grapefruit Sculpin is the latest take on our signature IPA Some may say there are few ways to improve Sculpin unique flavor but the tart freshness of grapefruit perfectly complements our IPA citrusy hop character Grapefruit a winter fruit but this easy drinking ale tastes like summer The Sculpin IPA is testament to our humble beginnings as Home Brew Mart It showcases bright flavors and aromas of apricot peach mango lemon The lighter body also brings out the crispness of the hops The Sculpin fish has poisonous spikes on its fins that can give strong sting Ironically the meat from Sculpin fish is considered some of the tastiest Something that has sting but tastes great sounds like Ballast Point India Pale Ale This version of our Sculpin IPA has grapefruit added the grapefruit flavor really enhances the citrus aroma of the hops
Full bodied very hoppy with citrus pine fruity notes and nice dry bitter finish Original Gravity Color CopperBitterness Medium

A tempest on the tongue or moment of pure hop bliss Brewed with dazzling blend of American hops and Scottish malt this crimson hued ale delivers waves of citrus pine and caramel toffee For those who favor flavor Furious has the hop fire your taste buds have been screaming for

Our East Coast version of West Coast style IPA Intense hop flavors and aromas of tropical and citrus fruits and pine dominate subtle malt sweetness brings the beer into balance Lunch is special whale that has been spotted off the Maine coast since She has what looks like bite taken out of her fin which adds to her unique character We dedicate this beer to her determination and persistence Keep on swimming
This mouthwateringly delicious IPA gets its flavor from heavy helping of Citra and Mosaic hops Don worry no fruit was harmed in the making of this beer IBU

Enjoy the clover honey hue and tropical nose Simultaneously punchy and soothing with big body and finish that boasts pineapple and grapefruit Flower Power is hopped and dry hopped five different times throughout the brewing and fermentation process

You could say then that Smuttynose IPA is physical salute to the glory of the American hop grower The citrusy hop flavor coming from mixture of Simcoe and Santiams is pleasantly balanced by smooth bitterness from the Amarillo hops The beer itself is light bodied and crisp with golden color that will throw slight haze as we bottle it unfiltered At IBU this is definitely not training wheels IPA but is meant for hop lovers looking to satisfy their craving in way that not easy to find We think they ll be quite pleased IBU

Aprihop is an American IPA brewed with Pilsner and Crystal malts It massively hopped in the continuous fashion of course and the flavor is complemented by the addition of apricots After fermentation the beer is dry hopped with irresponsible amounts of Amarillo hops The beer has hoppy aroma with the apricots playing supporting role The flavor is rich with late hop flavors and its bitterness is tempered by just the right amount of malt sweetness and fruity undertones from the apricots IBU

Each fall our brewhouse looks more like greenhouse as thousands of pounds of wet hop cones arrive within hours of being picked by some of our favorite local hop growers Acting quickly we then load up these wet hops into what will become Harvest Ale an impossibly aromatic and bright IPA bursting with fresh pine melon and citrus notes Our ode to the beauty that is the wet American hop IBU
A soon to be favorite if it already not This single IPA boasts pine citrus and cedar notes from Simcoe and Amarillo hops

Head Hunter is an aggressively dry hopped West Coast style IPA with huge hop display of pine grapefruit citrus and pineapple punch you in the mouth brew for those who truly love their hops Uncivilized Aggressive Award Winning
