Brooklyn Insulated Dark Lager is your protection against biting wind and soggy weather German Munich roasted Carafa and Pilsner malts create nimble racy body while helping of American black barley adds just hint of roast coffee light dry hopping of American and German hops pitter patters across the nose and dives into the dry warming finish Try it with dark breads hearty meats and sturdy cheddars If you still feel the chill just add another layer and enjoy your insulation

Dark Helmet is German style black lager or Schwarzbier brewed with malted rye Chocolate and Carafa malts give this beer its dark color and ludicrously smooth roasty flavor May the Schwarz be with you IBU

We craft our SNISTR Black Ale using special German dehusked black malt that is free of astringency giving the beer rich black color without the traditional dark beer characteristics You will notice subtle hints of chocolate with an easy drinking balance on the back end In the glass the dark color may look intimidating to some but don let this beer fool you Our unique combination of malts creates very light body and smooth finish IBU
IBU

Combining jet black color with incredibly smooth texture and decadent coffee flavor BREWTALITY breaks the expectations of both rich espresso and dark beer to create whole nuther beast While brutal in alcoholic strength this biggie beautifully showcases its roasted malt and coffee flavors without bringing on bitterness and bite This is the first of two lagers in the series IBU
Sustenance Black Beer aged it in bourbon barrels for months

A black lager with dark and roasty malt sweetness Don let the darkness fool you this is sweeter fuller bodied version of the premium lager you know and love It has smooth crisp finish with depth of color and taste ABV IBU TYPE Year AroundMalts Premium Pilsen Chocolate Caramel MunichHops Fuggles HallertauerYeast House German Pairs well with BBQ smoked Gouda and chocolate
A true TBK original we kick this German style black lager up couple notches Big clean malty flavor with just hint of roasted malt May the Schwartz be with you

A Champion of FlavorThis crisp clean dark lager begins with hints of roasted coffee beans and rich chocolate but showcases surprisingly light body and mouthfeel This Schwarzbier German for Black Beer is moderately hopped with Noble German hops that complement the delicate malt backbone Not to be underestimated this light lager is true champion of flavor Caw BITTERNESS IBU COLOR Dark brownMALT Pilsner Munich Carared Carafa Caramunich Type HOPS PerleYEAST German Lager

Ever seen unicorn How about baby German one that not white but black Well now is your chance to let one merrily prance across your pallet This black German style session lager is refreshing crisp and mystically intriguing with its maltiness IBU
We use specially roasted German malts and select American hops which provide our LA Bière Noire small bite of noble bitterness and dry French roasted coffee flavor

Clock Shadow Double Black Lager is brewed in the German Schwarzbier black beer tradition Schwarzbier is to lager what stout or porter is to ale Like those dark British beers Schwarzbier has long been considered nourishing and even curative German doctors often recommend Schwarzbier for nursing mothers Our Brewmaster born in Munich was the beneficiary of just such advice We have taken the traditional Schwarzbier intended to be session beer with typically moderate alcohol and almost doubled its strength to alcohol by volume We brewed our version with fine balance of crystal and roasted malts and spiced it with noble hops We fermented Clock Shadow at cold temperatures with select German lager yeast and cold conditioned it for over four months to create velvety smooth easy drinking springtime brew This German lager pours deep brown almost black color with ruby highlights It has soft dark chocolate notes with hints of caramel and light roasty finish IBU
IBU

Sessions Black Lager is traditional German Schwarzbier with refreshingly light body The dark chocolate malts contribute color and hints of roasted coffee balanced by the delicate aroma of German Noble hops Translated from German Schwarzbier means black beer Schwarzbier originated in the th Century in southeastern Germany where it is still brewed today The style enjoyed heyday in St Louis in the late s but large scale production of dark lagers failed to resurface after Prohibition In the beer community of St Louis honored St Louis Dark Lager as the official beer of the inaugural St Louis Brewers Heritage Festival an annual tasting event that celebrates the many breweries thriving in St Louis today IBU

Considered to be the th Deadly Sin fastidious person is overly meticulous has high standards and is excessively sensitive to taste You couldn sum up our brewers better th Sin is our killer new black lager brewed with different types of malt yeah that is black in colour with hints of espresso and chocolate in the aroma medium body and smooth sweet taste in the finish IBU

We took the recipe for our Black Lager and doubled the ingredients put it in stainless for two weeks and laid it down in bourbon Barrels Six months later the magic happened and the goat was birthed Black Goat is Double Black Lager sure to please the harshest of critics Caution this billy kicks

Brooklyn Winter Lager is our answer to the heavy ales and stouts that emerge in wintertime Though dark in color with sturdy presence our Schwarzbier inspired lager layers notes of chocolate roasted barley and dark bread into ABV frame that finishes surprisingly light and pleasantly dry Winter means different things depending where you live but Brooklyn Winter Lager is ready for any chill

Four Ingredients Painstakingly Chosen Every year we travel to Bavaria to hand select Hallertau Mittelfrüh hops and the high American plains for the finest two row summer barley We cultivate our own lager yeast and personally sample every batch All our hard work goes into brewing this distinctly flavorful and complex beer for you Cheers
An amber lager with rich fragrant malt flavors balanced by crisp noble hops

Dos Equis Ambar Amber is vienna style lager that was originally brewed by the German born Mexican brewer Wilhelm Hasse in The brand was named Siglo XX th century to commemorate the arrival of the new century and the bottles were marked with the Roman numerals XX or Dos Equis two

Vienna Style Lager This is our Ol Faithful No it not geothermal phenomenon It the beer everybody including professional beer judges just seems to dig Maybe they like how it smooth medium bodied and semi sweet while not too heavy or bitter Maybe it the amber color or the blend of four imported malts balanced by two Germanic hops or the fact that it takes five weeks to get right Or maybe it all the above Malts Vienna Pilsner Dark Munich CaraAmberHops Northern Brewer SaazIBU COLOR Amber

Vienna style beers are among the world first light colored lagers and were on the brink of extinction until American craft brewers helped revive the style it a good thing they did These delicate and extremely balanced amber beers rely on semi sweet and bready malt flavors but walk fine line with both malt and hop character shouldering equal weight Our take on the style features whole cone European hops which add to the dry finish

FireBrick was introduced in and is named after the bricks that line Schell old boilers It is the culmination of an effort to bridge the gap between the popular tasting beers and the heartier hand crafted ones FireBrick is refreshing all malt lager with an amber red hue that reflects the feeling of the brewery itself It has been described by Ted Marti as having subtle maltiness combined with hint of hoppy taste that creates mild pleasantly drinkable beer It is made with four specialty malts along with Vanguard Chinook and Hallertau hops

Our flagship brand An amber Vienna style lager beer that is smooth mellow and full bodied with delicate hop aroma Uses two row barley malt and caramel roasted malt Based on founder Tom Pastorius favorite German bier

Formerly Cyclhops BeeritoBeerito ABV IBUs is light bodied amber Mexican lager brewed with premium German and coloRADo sourced craft malts and featuring crisp accent from noble hops The mouth feel is incredibly smooth with flavors of walnut toasted bread plum honey and cocoa ABV doesn always come with this kind of character

A delicate balance of toasted malt and fresh hops give this medium bodied German style lager an intriguing complex malt flavor creamy head deep golden color and an impressive hop bouquet make this very special beer

Named for the city that created the style our amber lager is maltforward with grassy crackery hop aroma classic blend of German malts and hops gives this complex lager notes of biscuit and caramel in its finish

The name Schild Brau means essentially Schild Beer in German This is our flagship brew microbrew done in the style of the special beers of Munich This beer is brewed in the style of Vienna Lager Our beer uses these same malts to attain perfect balance between malty sweetness and firm bitterness IBU

Formerly Cutlass Amber Lager This malty lager is our most award winning beer it took gold silver and bronze medals at the Great American Beer Festival from to Cutlass Amber has toasted biscuity character The slight sweetness comes from Crystal malt Vienna malt contributes remarkable smoothness and Munich malt gives an amber color and delicate aroma Tettnang hops infuse the beer with slight earthiness Formerly named Heavy Seas Märzen Cutlass Amber is our second best selling beer In Cutlass Amber won silver medal at the World Beer Cup in the Vienna Lager category

If malt and hops are the two poles of brewing this beer is the gently spinning sweet spot between them First you ll notice the spicy aromas of Vanguard and Liberty hops Then wipe the foam off the tip of your nose dive into the toasty flavor of Vienna malt Dynamo starts strong and finishes crisp and smooth The balanced flavors aromas and even the coppery red tones of this beer go great with everything Fear no pairing The best time to enjoy Dynamo is when you re thirsty IBU

The best selling local craft beer in Buffalo Medium bodied Vienna style amber beer with soft nutty malt flavors and just enough German hops for balance Chain goes great with chicken pizza grilled vegetables pretty much everything now that we think about it Available year round on draft in bottles and cans all across WNY MALTS Pilsner Vienna CaramelHOPS Magnum Tettnang IBU

The Raven Special Lager is perfect balanced lager beer that goes well with any kind of food but particularly with spicy food or when you just want to sit down and enjoy beer with friends With shot of Woodford Reserve chased with chilled Raven is near perfect combination The rich golden colored beer is an exceptionally smooth Southern German lager somewhat malty but well balanced between the hops and malt Experiencing the clean finish and pleasant lingering aftertaste of The Raven Special Lager one can truly say that The Taste Is Poetic IBU

Formerly Snake River LagerSnake River Lager is our most popular beer This is an amber colored Vienna style lager The rich caramel flavor is balanced with the use of several hop varieties for subtle hop note An authentic German lager yeast strain adds to the true flavor of this beer The malt forward profile of Snake River Lager makes it fine complement to pizzas and red meat

Pennsylvania breweries are known for world class lagers and this Great American Beer Fest Gold Medal winning Vienna style no fuss amber lager is clean crisp and brewed with Munich and Vienna malts that give it touch of malt backbone and toast like character Hopped exclusively with German Tettnanger hops it got enough hop bitterness to counter that malt backbone as well Lagered for six weeks Churchville Lager comes in at ABV and is the perfect beer for night out with friends and family or the holiday BBQ Don be afraid to order the new Lager in town

Elegant bright amber beer Aromas of roasted malt with soft notes of caramel and coffee Water from the city of Coruña two stroke malts Pilsen and toast corn and hops Perle Hallertau Selected yeast from Hijos of Rivera Hops with slight floral and herbal nuances on the nose Roasted taste predominates on the palate with the hint of pleasant well integrated warmth with each drink Made from specific wort in the exclusive production centre Hijos de Rivera in Coruña It has one of the longest ageing periods among national lagers

Pietra the chestnut beerBeer of the land and naturePIETRA is specialty beer of low fermentation Using traditional methods it is brewed from selected malts and chestnut flour The chestnuts used come from the most beautiful and highest chestnut grove in Europe located in the Castagniccia at an altitude of over meters Every autumn the fruit is hand picked transported down the hill on donkeys and sorted by hand This guarantees flour of very high quality from totally natural environment Highly fermentable chestnut flour has an excellent impact on the quality of the head and gives beer its beautiful coloring Mixed into the malt during the mashing process the chestnut flour is prime ingredient and not just flavoring This recipe unique in the world gives PIETRA its conflicting taste accentuating lingering subtle bitterness Powerful and delicate robust and smooth Pietra has alcohol content It displays beautiful amber color an intense chestnut head dense and creamy making the pleasure of tasting it all the more enjoyable
Note New recipe from gravity went down from to alcohol from to

Lakewood is more than place It a state of mind Old blends with new Traditions hook up with fresh ideas It the same with our Lakewood Lager We ve taken old world Vienna Style lager and reintroduced it to beer lovers Subtle caramel aromas coppery pour and light malty sweetness paired with noble hop bitterness set this beer apart In with the old in with the new

Joe our Brew Master went to Munich for few days of inspiration for this Vienna style beer He came back weeks later little cloudy but focused on nailing this now popular brew MALT Vienna Row Carafoam Dark Wheat MelanoidinHOPS Hallertau IBU
Also known as Menabrea Anniversario Amber
Bohemia Oscura is Vienna type beer It offers the perfect balance of caramel and toasted malts that give off notes from walnut and coffee

Formerly Sublime Mexican Lager oz To Freedom The band members are all big fans of this style of beer We wanted to create our thirst quenching version of traditional Vienna style lager famously brewed by the Mexican breweries that showcases grainy malt forward sweetness and easy drinkability Clean and crisp with subdued hop bitterness to balance makes Sublime Mexican Lager the go to beer for hot summer days or pre concert tailgating AleSmith owner CEO Peter Zien

Danish Style Red Lager Dansk Red is inspired by the red lagers of Denmark and the signature red color in the Danish flag This quality beer is crafted with blend of European base and sweet caramel malt creating beautiful red hue

Also known as Shiner Bavarian Style Amber Shiner Brew Pride Selection Limited Edition Craft Brew and Brewer Pride Craft Brew No This Bavarian style Amber combines roasted Munich malts and rich German hops IBU
A European amber lager medium bodied with delicate malt aroma slight sweetness and clean crisp finish IBU
A mainstream lager with moderate hop character and slightly sweet fruity refreshing aroma and taste

Brisk flavor rich ruby color and extra crisp finish create sensation that will ripple the taste buds of the most discerning palate This medium bodied lager is brewed with blend of the finest hops and gently roasted malts
A malty aromatic and hoppy mixture Copper colored this beer is medium bodied and full of flavor Vienna Style

Westfalia packs rich caramel flavors into rounded mahogany body through colorful blend of creamy malts Traditionally fermented at cooler temperatures Westfalia rotbier style showcases layered malt profile that creates smooth satisfying mouthfeel perfect for any meal or enjoyed on its own Inspired by trip to Nuremberg Germany Westfalia imports an exemplary red ale to audiences closer to home

When summer days have got you beat reach for Rally Can of Indians Lager Brewed in the Vienna Style Indians Lager features balanced malt flavor that finishes crisp thanks to the addition of German Noble hops
Trailhead is Vienna style lager which is characterized by careful balance of malt sweetness and clean crisp hop bitterness

ABV varies slightlyLambic is one of the world oldest beers According to some it is also the best even if its characteristic acidity does not please all palates To offset this acidity some decided to add sugar to it Thus faro was born Adding sugar syrup to lambic was revelation at the time of Bruegel Some even argue that without faro Bruegel would have been deprived of inspiration and would have remained an ordinary amateur painter whose canvases couldn even have been sold at flea market Until the th century faro was very prevalent in the Brussels region Folklore there was frequently associated with it and the divine liquid flowed like water Then faro fell into oblivion It was not until that our family brought it back to centre stage Or centre Senne as you prefer Particularly appreciated after physical exertion faro is not only easy to drink it is joy to do so

Formerly Tradition Faro Lambic Timmermans Tradition Faro is beer made by adding candy sugar and water to lambic to mellow its acidity In the th century Faro was very popular in the Brussels area Various folk traditions were associated with it and this ambrosial drink flowed abundantly thanks to its relatively neutral but extremely pleasant flavour Today Timmermans Faro is still brewed using the methods and recipes of days gone by and meets with unanimous approval

Our take on Faro is primarily inspired by the older methodology and brings together Meerts and and year old Méthode Traditionnelle T barrels in proportion Although the selected T barrels exhibit sweet oak and apple cider characteristics there is no added artificial sweetener or unfermented sugar in this beer As nod to contemporary Faro production we used amber Belgian candi syrup to bottle condition but this sugar has been allowed to fully referment in the bottle to produce carbonation hint of color and subtle dried fruit and caramelized flavors
Apricot LambicBlend of lambics aged to months and of Bergeron apricots Very fragrant gourmet beer which perfectly brings across the flavours of Bergeron apricots Color copperServing Temperature

ABVThe appearance of this exceptional beer is matched only by its taste To make our Framboise we add raspberry juice to our lambic That gives it delicate fruity aroma and beautiful dark pink colour just like the dress wore to our cousin Willy wedding But that of no interest to you since you undoubtedly don know Willy Framboise is served as an aperitif but also use it in cooking And when don finish the bottle in my preparations finish it in my glass

It has the colour of onion skin said voice behind me It was Raymond Coumans He was admiring the colour of the raspberry lambic reflecting in the red copper of the buckets used to empty the barrels At that time Raspberry Lambic already was synonymous with sweet artificially flavoured beer This is why we decided to distinguish our beer from the other raspberry beers Raymond proposed to call it rosé dedicated not to Bacchus but to Gambrinus The process to make this beer is identical to the one to make Kriek When young the Rosé de Gambrinus will still present its full fruity taste Later on the lambic taste will become dominant at the expense of the fruit taste

Everyone knows some of our best friends are wine growers from the Libourne region in France more specifically those who make Saint Emillion and Pomerol They respect the tradition and let their wine ferment in natural way Fermentation origin and vintage are still kept up Our collaboration resulted in product uniting the best of their wine and of our beer the Saint Lamvinus The grapes of the merlot and cabernet franc varieties are soaked in Bordeaux barrels containing two to three years old lambic The beer is not blended before the bottling The foam is caused by the addition of liquor which starts the fermentation

The name Vigneronne Cantillon was given in This name reminds us that while it belongs to the beer patrimony the spontaneous fermentation the ageing in the barrels for several years and the addition of grapes make it distant cousin of certain white wines In spite of its success the Vigneronne represents less than of the total production of the Cantillon brewery In order to obtain grapes which are as mature as possible we buy them at the end of the season Every year kilos of white italian grapes are delivered at the Cantillon brewery in the beginning of October

Blend of raspberries with two year old lambic per litre Beer with very intense fruitiness The natural tartness of the raspberries nicely complements the lambic slight acidity This beer will keep for long time in good cellar but we recommend to drink it within the year to enjoy the intensity of the fruit Color rubyServing Temperature

Also known as Kriek FoudroyanteWe ve already told you that our family never does anything the way other people do Kriek Lindemans is good example of that In order to obtain beer like no other we have been adding whole sour cherries to our lambic for generations Our meeting with American importer Charles Finkel in the s revolutionized the fruit beer segment Charles convinced us to export our old kriek to the United States by boat What we had not thought of is that the movement of the waves would reactivate the fermentation process and cause the corks to pop during the trip It was like something out of The Adventures of Tintin To prevent that from happening we therefore developed an alternative production method for our kriek We use fresh not from concentrate unsweetened cherry filtrate which we blend with lambic that is at least one year old before fermenting macerating for up to days and pasteurizing the whole batch So the corks don pop Due to the use of filtrate and pasteurization this kriek is sweeter and fruitier than Old Kriek Cuvée René which undergoes second fermentation process in the bottle Thanks to its innovative flavour it was resounding success both here in Belgium as well as around the world Nowadays it is undoubtedly the reference kriek for consumers IBU

Fonteinen Oude Kriek is the result of macerating hand picked whole sour cherries on young lambic for at least four months in proportion of one kilogram of fruit per litre of lambic The kriek lambic is then blended again with more young lambic to obtain minimum intensity of fruit and is bottled immediately afterwards These bottles are then stored in our cellars for at least five months so that the kriek lambic can develop into beautiful traditional and refined Oude Kriek With pleasant tartness and organic notes of almond and cinnamon as it warms in the glass Fonteinen Oude Kriek will age perfectly but may lose some of the vibrant red colours and forest fruit aromas This unfiltered and unpasteurised lambic is all natural with no artificial juices syrups or sugars added Traditional Lambic is living cultural heritage rooted in the Zenne valley

A few times year we cut Dan loose to brew whatever he chooses Always handcrafted the bottle you hold is brewed for the adventurous soul This is very limited edition and we make no promises to ever brew this style again Sparkling and bright this is Wisconsin original created for you in the traditional method employed by the Lambic Brewers of Belgium including five months of outdoor resting in oak barrels Indigenous yeast and cranberries from the wilds of Wisconsin flawlessly pair to dance on your palette You have discovered rare and delightful treasure to be served cold in fluted glass

Lindemans Pêche is young lambic enriched with peach juice And this fruit beer is real peach It is nice to drink at any time of day Or on sunny patio Personally enjoy it with my girlfriends And what we talk about is of no concern to you

A blend of lambic beers brewed at Fonteinen with an addition of whole fresh raspberries from the fabled Payottenland and sour cherries This unfiltered beer will enjoy spontaneous refermentation in the bottle No artificial colors or flavor enhancers are added Lambic is brewed only from barley malt unmalted wheat hops and water In commemoration of the late Gaston Debelder founder of the Fonteinen blendingsBatch Batch Batch Batch ABV

Beer of spontaneous fermentation the Old Quetsche Tilquin is made from the fermentation of minimum of gr of purple plums by liter of lambic Unfiltered and unpasteurized this beer is refermented in the bottle

Fonteinen Schaarbeekse Kriek is the result of macerating local hand picked Schaarbeekse cherries on young traditional lambic for at least one year in proportion of one kilo of sour cherries per liter of lambic The cherry lambic is then blended with young lambic and bottles after which our famous Schaarbeekse Kriek matures for another year at least in the bottle Refined and with evolution in the glass Natural fruit no juice syrup or sugars added Unfiltered and unpasteurised
Cantillon Zwanze Elder flowers In Cantillon re released this beer as Mamouche same beer which will be brewed on regular basis

Made in cooperation with Jeppe from Olbuttikken in Copenhagen Jeppe provides the blueberries for the beer and it is brewed at Cantillon and then shipped back to Copenhagen and only sold at Olbutikken Since Ölbutikken closed this is exclusive to Himmeriget in Copenhagen Vintage batch cl bottles released Gold foil Vintage batch cl and cl bottles Black foil Vintage batch cl bottles Gold foil Vintage batch cl and cl bottles No foil Label reads Vintage batch cl and cl bottles No foil Label reads II Vintage batch cl and cl bottles Label reads Vintage batch cl and cl bottles No foil Label reads first year with the year printed on the label and not handwritten

Making apple beer goes back to ancestral tradition The Celts drank it in abundance during their harvest festivals All we have done is extend the pleasure to the present day by adding the juice of several varieties of apples to our delicious lambic The tasting experience which is quite exceptional combines the sweetness of cider with the sourness characteristic of lambic The Americans are crazy about it which is why they say An apple day keeps the doctor away IBU
Recent bottling dates
Spontaneous beer aged with raspberries

Is it sparkling wine or beer That is the question amateurs of exceptional products ask when they discover our Cassis for the first time Cassis Lindemans is fruity beer made from lambic base which thanks to its shades of dark purple and its aromas is spontaneously reminiscent of wine The taste of Cassis Lindemans on the palate is inimitable intense and sparkling with sour sweet finish IBU
Made from cherries

Again the basic old and young lambic are matured in oak casks But here we add to one year old lambic about grams of real cherries per litre This creates second fermentation in the casks Oude Kriek Boon then undergoes further fermentation in the bottle and has an alcohol volume of After several months the flavour has matured to the desired taste Oude Kriek Boon is test of your patience It should lie about years in the bottle At first it tastes of fruit especially sour cherries Oude Kriek Boon eventually evolves into deep taste reminiscent of Port or Madeira wine This is kriek at its best

Based on an extinct yet favorite tipple of the De Ranke owners Nino Bacelle and Guido Devos De Ranke Kriek emulates the famed Oud Kriekenbier from the defunct Crombé brewery in Zottegem De Ranke Kriek is mixture of two blended soured pale ales and Girardin lambic all steeped in whole fresh cherries from Poland and then aged for six months unique and much sought after Kriekenbier
Formerly Peach Lambic
Blackberry is fermented by wild yeast and aged in oak casks for nearly year We then add whole blackberries grown in Indiana The beer is bottle conditioned Style is Sour Ale ABV

Formerly known as Lindemans Kriek Cuvée René ABVThis is the masterpiece of which am most proud as is one of my sons after whom it is named What makes this traditional kriek special is that it is brewed with whole cherries Since real Schaerbeek cherries are scarce Lindemans Brewery has found their perfect equivalence elsewhere in Europe It is deep red in colour and its foam head is slightly pink Very refreshing this beverage is perfect thirst quencher which thanks to its fizzy and tangy flavour is ideal as an aperitif In order to produce the Oude Kriek Cuvée René the cherries ferment in lambic that is at least six months old in huge litre oak barrels called foudres After six months this traditional kriek is bottled in corked cl bottles The beer will then undergo spontaneous second fermentation process which after few months will produce the carbon dioxide CO to which this authentic beer owes its carbonation and distinctive foam head

A blended work of art This barrel aged sour ale combines traditional Belgian style sour with whole Montmorency Cherries from Michigan We ferment our base blonde ale over many months in oak tanks to produce tart flavors fruity notes and funky character Then we select individual batches for fruiting with whole cherries that add intense cherry aromas and dark fruit flavors to the beer The final blend is bottle conditioned resulting in fine carbonation and spritzy mouthfeel
Coolship Cerise is our spontaneous beer aged with blend of Maine grown cherries including Balaton and Montmorency Using local cherries makes our Cerise uniquely Maine just like us
Ale fermented with raspberries and matured in oak barrels

Beer of spontaneous fermentation the Oude Mûre Tilquin à Ancienne is made from the fermentation of gr of blackberries by liter of lambic Unfiltered and unpasteurized this beer is refermented in the bottle
Ale brewed with black currants and matured in oak barrels

Formerly Strawberry For anyone who finds strawberries irresistible Timmermans Strawberry evokes the fragrance of long sunny days Its strawberry flavour will have you wrinkling your nose in delight with each sip Its luminous colour and its fruity freshness are treat for taste buds and eyes alike totally mouth watering experience

Formerly Framboise Lambic Timmermans Framboise is made by adding natural raspberry aromas to lambic After maturation in oak barrels the beer turns delicate shade of pink that is sure to delight you Timmermans Framboise is beer to be savoured with finesse and elegance
Lambic brewed with wild Belgian Schaerbeek sour cherries
This listing is for all vintages Gueuze Oude Gueuze etc
This listing is for all vintages of the Oude Geuze but not for bottles specifically labelled Oude Geuze Vintage

Gueuze Cuvée René is one of the jewels of our brewery With its golden colour its sparkle and its beautiful sherry aromas this is the queen of gueuzes This old gueuze is blend of old and young lambic matured in large oak barrels called foudres It is then bottled in beautiful champagne bottle where second fermentation takes place After months the gueuze obtains golden colour and is slightly carbonated and tart But kept in cellar for few years it becomes truly exceptional The use of champagne bottle dates back to an uncertain time period when lambic brewers specialized in recovering empty bottles from great restaurants and other establishments where lot of champagne was consumed That is why we chose the most noble of bottles to hold our noblest beer

Oude Gueuze Tilquin à Ancienne alc vol is spontaneous fermentation beer produced from the blending of and years old lambics It is unfiltered and unpasteurized and refermented in the bottle for at least months The lambics used were fermented and oak aged in our installations These lambics are coming from worts brewed by Boon Lindemans Girardin and Cantillon breweries

In Belgian brewing there are fantastic wild ales brewed with naturally occurring yeast These beers develop over time and are ready on their own terms Duck Duck Gooze is our homage to these effervescent and wonderfully complex sparkling beers blend of young and old barrel aged beers this has been one of our most sought after beers year after year since it original release in Alas it is released in very small quantities only once every three years so it extremely difficult to come by beyond the day we release it It does however turn up on our Tasting Room Vintage List from time to time so don despair
Our take on gueuze style ale this intensely tart and funky beer combines three different vintages of our barrel aged sour blonde ale

This is the result of blending different lambics of different ages The second fermentation takes place inside the bottles and therefore they are stored for minimum six months in constant temperature kept cellars
Unfiltered version

The Golden Blend is made with year old Lambic that accounts for of it contents the rest of the blend is made up by secret combination of and year old Lambic The exact mixture is only known by the master blender Armand himself The name Golden Blend is not far away from the truth in fact the years of maturation in oak wooden barrels is making this particular Lambic very expensive Due to the evaporation through the barrels only small percentage of the lambic is left over after years of maturing

St Louis Gueuze Fond Tradition is pure traditional gueuze aimed at connoisseurs It has the pure taste of true gueuze based on blend of young and old lambics Fruity apple aromas stand out When tasting the slightly sour touches characteristic of lambic beers make their presence felt It is very dry in the finish

Coolship Resurgam is brewed with Pilsner malt raw wheat and aged hops The beer is cooled overnight using outside air temperature in traditional large shallow pan known as coolship During the cooling process naturally occurring microflora from the air inoculates the beer and in the morning it is transferred into French oak wine barrels where the entire fermentation and aging takes place Coolship Resurgam is blend of this one two and three year old spontaneously fermented beer The finished beer has aromas of apricot lemon zest and candied fruit Notes of tropical fruit and flavors of funk lead to clean tart and dry finish Coolship Resurgam is blend of both old and young unfruited spontaneous beer The name comes from the motto of our fair city Portland Me It means shall rise again Coolship Resurgam won Silver medal at the GABF blend of this one two and three year old spontaneously fermented beer The finished beer has aromas of apricot lemon zest and candied fruit Notes of tropical fruit and flavors of funk lead to clean tart and dry finish
Brewed with unmalted wheat of barleymalt aged hops and wild yeasts collected from coolship and is aged for up to years in oak casks

This listing refers ONLY to beers that explicitly say Vintage on the label These currently date from onwards and feature either the red label Nightlights by Felix de Boeck or the word Vintage printed directly below the words Oude Gueuze as in the profile picture This is NOT for old vintages of the standard Oude Geuze

Fonteinen Oude Geuze Cuvée Armand Gaston is blend of one two and three year old traditional lambics all brewed at Brouwerij Fonteinen Spontaneous fermentation patient maturation in oak barrels and continued evolution in the bottle result in distinctively complex beer No two bottlings are alike as there are multiple variables in the blending process variety of barrel sizes and shapes differences in aged lambic proportions etc This cuvée like all of our lambic is natural authentic spontaneously fermented and crafted with steadfast adherence to tradition like Armand and Gaston Debelder have always done it This geuze has fermented in the bottle and will continue to develop its tastes and aromas over its long life when properly cellared Traditional Lambic is living cultural heritage rooted in the Zenne valley Taste savour enjoy and experience this unfiltered unpasteurised and unadulterated beer with friends new and old

The Gueuze Tilquin draught version alc vol is spontaneous fermented beer produced by blending low alcohol lambic called Meerts and and years old lambics all fermented and aged in oak barrels It is unfiltered and unpasteurized and it is refermented in the keg The lambics used were fermented and oak aged in our installations These lambics are coming from worts brewed by Boon Lindemans Girardin and Cantillon breweries

BLEND Batch Years Blended our original batch of lambics BLEND Batch Years Blended All Sour Reserve is tart dry and refreshing blond sour ale with multiple layers of flavor by selecting premium barrels of aged Basis Expect flavors of peach cherry wine cider with rich aromas of lactic sourness and multiple fruity notes Effervescent carbonation creates an inviting and experiential sour beer session

This is higher abv version of the Oude Gueuze Tilquin containing the blend of and year old lambics in oak barrels Due to over carbonation the beer underwent second barrel aging process before being bottled second time

From the brewery There are several stories to explain the origin of the term gueuze This name dates back to the Rue de Gueuze in Brussels where for the first time producer offered his delicious lambic in champagne bottles Word about the lambick on Rue de Gueuze quickly got around According to other sources gueuze has its roots in gazeux the French word for carbonated since traditional gueuze is carbonated blend of different lambics After the Second World War some lambic brewers devised new production method They filtered the beer added sugar saturated it with carbon dioxide and pasteurised it This new gueuze closed with bottle cap and available in cl bottles was called capped gueuze Developed according to this production method Gueuze Lindemans is slightly sweeter version of Old Gueuze Cuvée René
Issued in Limited Edition Second Edition and Edition No
A blend of Rivertown one and three year old wine barrel aged lambics allowed to further age in the bottle for up to six months The result is dry cedary musty vinuous and sour IBU

To create Geuze on draft Brewery Boon had to take the innovative steps to alter the formula creating new lambic blend They defined the characteristics of the lambic needed for the kegged Geuze targeting lambic from specific foeders which were best suited to the new specifications This solution provides way to keep keg pressure down and still produce keg conditioned Geuze with full bodied taste and signature Geuze Boon sour fruitiness This new formula presents taste different to that of the bottled Geuze with less carbonation and different mouth feel experience
Gueuze with maple syrup

It is completely original beer which contrary to the other products of the Brewery is not brewed with of wheat The Iris which is only made with malt of the pale ale type giving more amber colour to the beer conserves the typical flavour of the spontaneous fermentation the complex aromas and the vinous taste The hopping is different too Lambic is made with dried hops for the Iris we use of dried hops and of fresh hops The latter cause superb acidity the former due to their tannins enable to conserve the beer while preserving all its qualities After two years in the barrel the Iris undergoes second fresh hopping two weeks before the bottling linen bag filled with hops is soaked in the beer for two weeks This technique called cold hopping gives the beer more intense savour and makes the smell and the taste more bitter Iris is brewed only once every season and all the beers come from the same brewing This is why the beer is dated The second fermentation is obtained by adding liquor Although it is spontaneous fermentation beer the Iris is very different from the Lambic The amber colour and the bitter and slightly caramelized taste make it complex beer
Also known as Cantillon Cuvée Des Champions Two year old lambic dry hopped in the cask for three weeks
Aged in cognac barrels for two years

Fonteinen Zenne Frontera is the latest creation of Armand Debelder together with sommelier Andy De Brouwer of Les Eleveurs The lambic was aged in year old casks for months prior to bottling According to the brewery this collaboration seeks to bridge the beer and wine worlds and is also aimed at drawing in the culinary sector
Fermented by exposing the beer to untamed yeasts and bacteria native to Rivertown Brewery known as House Funk This blend fermented for over year in wine barrels
Brewed with first and second slims process malt bill built with over raw wheat aged hops Lactobacillus and Brettanomyces Both kettle and FV fermented this beer never touches oak barrels ABV pH

A blend of New Morning and month aged Fonteinen Lambic refined for at least months in bottle It has surprisingly citrus nose of leather cellar and animal with hints of dried flowers and honey Lasting and sapid in the mouth with sour finish that always makes the lovers of this blend smile This beer could very well make you develop an addiction for spontaneous fermentation and turn your entire world upside down After mechanical breakdown Fonteinen Brewery of Beersel possibly the best Lambic blender in the world had economic damage in the summer of The news caused such stir in the International beer movement that called Armand to know how things were As he needed to sell his Lambic immediately got inspired to blend our New Morning with his beer We selected three month old Lambic barrels that we siphoned in small tank on our truck The journey back was long and hard myself and Manuel took turns driving through Belgium France and Italy only stopping for gas After days hand bottling and months of maturation the outcome has gone over and beyond our expectations and we can say with pride that it was worth it
Brouwerij Fonteinen Café Brouwerij Loterbol Tuverbol is blend of Fonteinen Lambik with Loterbol Blond

Spontaneous beer brewed in the traditional Methode van Lembeek Our spontaneous fermented beer is brewed with pilsner malt raw wheat and aged hops in the traditional farmhouse method wort set overnight in the koelschip loft this beer embraces the raw natural flavors of the Hood River Valley flora cave aged in oak for years to develop rich complexity with balanced acidity

The original batch of Reine des Prés bottled in has not been released for sale publicly due in part to the meadowsweet being extremely strong This batch was bottled for restaurant in Brussels called Bouchéry as food pairing lambic second batch was bottled in June and was released as one part of an exlusive six pack of beers for the BXLBeerFest in August Meadowsweet Filipendula ulmaria has been traditionally used in various stews wines beers meads vinegars and other beverages due to its pleasant somewhat sweet taste

O Doul and Doul Amber are non alcohol malt beverages Doul has mild sweet taste with slightly dry finish Doul Amber has rich slightly sweet taste with flavorful hop finish Doul and Doul Amber are brewed as traditional premium beers fermented and aged to full maturity The alcohol is then removed through the use of low temperature low pressure distillation This extremely gentle process allows the alcohol to be removed without heating or cooking the beer which retains the full rich and delicate flavor and balance of our non alcohol brews

O Doul and Doul Amber are non alcohol malt beverages Doul has mild sweet taste with slightly dry finish Doul Amber has rich slightly sweet taste with flavorful hop finish Doul and Doul Amber are brewed as traditional premium beers fermented and aged to full maturity The alcohol is then removed through the use of low temperature low pressure distillation This extremely gentle process allows the alcohol to be removed without heating or cooking the beer which retains the full rich and delicate flavor and balance of our non alcohol brews

In movies special effects make you think you re seeing the unbelievable In Brooklyn Special Effects we re making you taste something incredible delicious alcohol free beer Brooklyn Special Effects is hoppy lager with an unexpected piney aroma and pleasantly bitter finish The beer gets its golden bready sweetness from dry hopping with Citra and Amarillo hops technique rarely used in alcohol free brewing We use specially developed fermentation method that limits the amount of alcohol that is created while allowing more traditional beer flavors to develop It tastes just like regular beer but therein lies the special effect it not
Fresh light and with the bitter taste of hops For the figure conscious sport active and alcohol abstainer Einbecker alcohol free is pure seduction

First released in Fuller Vintage Ale is brewed in limited batches with each bottle being numbered It can be enjoyed immediately or Fuller recommends laying the beer down to enjoy when it peaks in to years and consume at cellar temperature And though it released each year as separate vintage BA has been informed that the recipe is only slightly tweaked from year to year while the ABV remains at As the new Head Brewer this edition of Vintage Ale champions new American hop variety Denali used to give the beer citrusy pine like flavour and new British malt variety Laureate Combined with trusty British hops Target and Goldings our st Vintage Ale is well rounded and balanced beer wilh Fuller yeast adding the orange marmalade characters to it Vinlage ale is an exceptional beer only available from Fuller as limited release of individually packaged and numbered bottles and will improve for many years to come like fine wine or whisky As the beer is bottle conditioned it will form natural sediment so pour carefully sit back and enjoy the very finest of Fuller ales

Old Peculier is possibly one of the country most well known and loved ales This unique beautiful brew is often imitated but never matched and is sold literally all over the world With countless awards to its credit it is something of which every Briton can be very proud and is the epitome of the greatest of British brewing tradition In the early years of the modern brewing era about two hundred years ago many brewers produced dark strong stock beer in the winter months to provide base amount of fermented beer to add to beers brewed in the rather more volatile months of the summer Old Peculier probably owes its origins to this The name pays tribute to the unique ecclesiastical status of Masham as Court of the Peculier and is also reference to the strong characteristic of the beer For many years it was affectionately referred to as Yorkshire Lunatic Broth

Our Adam aged in American Oak barrels First released in and released again in November in oz bottles This beer has lots of the typical HOTD aromas Caramel brown sugar tons of raisin and tobacco Fig date and plum fruitiness in that order This has fairly strong earthy vinousness as well as oak vanilla

Olive iconic mascot spirit guide of our brewery first appeared on our Old Brown Dog label in returned thirteen years later to pose for our Really Old Brown Dog luscious malt rich full bodied old ale featuring deep notes of complex fruit Much like our beloved Olive this beer will mellow age gracefully Formerly part of the Big Beer Series IBU

Ola Dubh or Black Oil is so named because it is gloopy and viscous This limited release has been matured in casks from Orkney award winning Highland Park distillery to add complementary whisky notes to what is already an amazing brew It is chocolatey with roasty bittersweet aftertaste Highland Park Year Old Single Malt Scotch Whisky was awarded Double Gold medal at San Francisco World Spirits Competition it lends balance smoothness and subtle smoke
Cherry Adam from the Wood is aged with locally grown black cherries in Bourbon and Sherry casks for months First release November Second release November Third release March Fourth release November

English Olde Ale Traditionally malty with the warming sensation of alcohol Olde Ales are brewed in the fall as winter warmers Brewed in the style of an English Olde Ale this ale balances the sweet heady aroma of spruce tips with the clean crisp finish of noble hops Its malty richness is complemented by the warming sensation of alcohol Alaskan Winter is made from glacier fed water Sitka spruce tips and generous blend of the finest quality European and Pacific Northwest hop varieties and specialty malts Our water originates in the square mile Juneau Ice Field and from the more than inches of rainfall we receive each year IBU

A rich copper colored hearty ale perfect for the holiday season with malty sweetness and spicy hop character The generous use of five different malts is responsible for the full flavor and high alcohol level of this beer

Our fall seasonal combines the malty goodness of German lager with the clean crispness of an American ale Brewed with Munich malts and delicate blend of Bavarian hops it a full bodied treat with nutty sweet middle warming alcohol level and notes of toasted grains pre winter winner IBU

Every bottle of this extremely limited Ola Dubh th Anniversary Ale has been individually numbered Our ale has been aged for up to six months in first fill sherry butts formerly used to mature Highland Park award winning Year Old Single Malt Scotch Whisky These hand selected butts add subtle whisky notes to what is already complex ale with its chocolatey mouthfeel and distinctive bittersweet finish The high ABV has been deliberately created to stand up to and blend with the intensity of flavor created by the infused wood
Our classic Olde Ale delivers complex malt flavor and blend of British and American hops True to its name this beer finishes with nice warming alcohol flavor

Over months in whiskey barrels has completely transformed our prized winter seasonal producing Hibernation that starts with big whiskey flavors before mellowing out into luscious chocolate dark fruit and vanilla If you can only take one beer into your cave this winter we suggest this one

Unobtanium is barrel aged English style Old Ale that ages for six months in bourbon barrel soaking up all sorts of amazing whiskey character as well as hints of oak and vanilla The name was taken from an old aerospace engineering term for specific material or object often imaginary impossible or highly improbable to obtain needed to complete any given project And before you ask we did not take the name from the elusive metal in Avatar James Cameron reportedly named the substance as an inside joke to his fellow techie gear heads Our version is much tastier though

The first and only perennial offering in our Cooper Series of limited batch beers Mayflower Thanksgiving Ale is an inspired blend of two brewing styles American Strong Ale and English Old Ale Aged on American white oak this full bodied brew warms the soul with hints of caramel vanilla and spicy nuts The perfect beverage for our favorite holiday

Originally brewed in as the first in our annual Decadence series AleSmith Olde Ale follows the tradition of classic British style Old Ales This rich malt forward ale showcases soft notes of currants and dried fruit along with complex dark sugars all of which are balanced by subtle bitterness derived from the addition of traditional English hops AleSmith Olde Ale is ready to be enjoyed now or it can be aged upwards of twenty years to further enhance its amazing depth of flavor hearty ale designed to please Bacchus himself

Inspired by th century English Christmas cake our Figgy Pudding is brewed with English Pale Specialty malts molasses and fermented with London ale yeast After fermentation we matured Figgy Pudding in brandy barrels before conditioning with mission figs Ceylon cinnamon and nutmeg cases of ml bottles produced in November Re released in November

The bartender is always there for us our reliable companion who deliberately crafts the perfect cocktail with every dash of bitters and teaspoon of simple syrup It this spirit of precision and passion for the craft that has led to our Old Fashioned Ale This cocktail inspired beer is gently aged in fresh bourbon barrels with Montmorency and Black cherries and finished with fresh orange zest all painstakingly measured and mixed in the spirit of camaraderie Muddle your cherries but not your time

Our interpretation of an oak aged old ale Peleg Hill Jr was our great great great great grandfather and one of Greensboro original inhabitants In his honor we crafted this old ale and reserved it with our resident microflora in third fill bourbon barrels from some of our favorite distilleries For over months it was allowed to leisurely develop its complex unique flavors and express both the character of its environs and its history This inaugural batch of Peleg was brewed with our Danish friends Rune and Per Olaf from Bryggeriet Djævlebryg and Anders Kissmeyer of Kissmeyer Brewing

Devil Teeth is hybrid of an Old Ale and an Imperial Stout two English beer styles designed to withstand long voyages and dark winters It brings rich maltiness robust roastiness in thick tongue coating aggressively flavorful package To this chewy mix of old world beasts we brought massive dose of our house roasted Black House Blend coffee complimentary mix of blueberry forward Ethiopian and chocolate forward Sumatran coffees
Aged in casks that previously held year old Highland Park Whiskey wooden sweet flavour with bitter chocolate smoked peat moss and touch of vanilla

Fulsome high gravity stout aged in bourbon barrels for several months Then brewed take on barleywine style with plenty of hops and barrel aged it for few weeks to mellow it out This is blend of these two separate beers

Inspired by the great Prize Old Ale once brewed by Gales in England this beer is deeply malty and full of ripe fruit leather wine and oak flavors The Billy is partially barrel aged with brettanomyces yeast lending distinct twang and developing unique aromas over time Bottled still and best served at about F to be finished at room temperature Cellar for up to five years Billy the Mountain traditional English style Old Ale having undergone over five months of oak barrel aging and another several months in the bottle Malts organic pale ashburne mild caramelUnmalted black barleyAlso molassesYeasts London ESB and brettanomyces clausennii First Release January Second Release January Third Release December

It dessert in liquid form Complex flavors blend to create something that you have never experienced before Old Ales are copper red to very dark This brew was created from the base of our Unobtainium Old Ale but transformed into totally different devil with the addition of chocolate coffee and raspberries This brew is smooth as velvet and perfect for dessert
English style Old Ale aged in Cognac barrels

Grandis is our blended old ale It is blended from various ales matured in oak barrels from several months to three years This blend has touch of acidity and is very port like with hint of fine balsamic Blend

Barrel ageing blending and using different yeasts this embraces our love of the unpredictability of wild yeast with the subtlety and complexity of maturation in oak barrels study in patience it takes at least days for the wild yeast to work its magic Modus Operandi is the perfect accompaniment to red meat and game dishes such as duck or venison beer that could easily replace red wine on the dinner table transformation of an old English ale into beer that is Wildly different unique dark flavourful beer with smooth rich full body and complex fruit flavours of berries sweet cherries and tannins

Our most popular beer Sierra Nevada Pale Ale is delightful interpretation of classic style It has deep amber color and an exceptionally full bodied complex character Generous quantities of premium Cascade hops give the Pale Ale its fragrant bouquet and spicy flavor IBU

This single hop ale showcases the Citra hop Named for the largest rex fossil ever discovered she roars with ferocious aromas of grapefruit citrus mango and evergreen Delicate in body with mild bite in the finish IBU

Fire Rock Pale Ale is crisp refreshing Hawaiian style pale ale Its signature copper color results from the unique blend of specialty roasted malts The pronounced citrus floral hop aroma comes from the liberal amounts of Galena Cascade Mt Hood hops added to each brew IBU

Trends may come and go but classics transcend time and space And Doggie Style is certainly classic The standard in pale ales this beautiful amber liquid perfectly balances Northern Brewer Cascade Simcoe and Citra hops then melds them together with Carastan malts to create an incredibly satisfying beer flavored beer that tastes like beer Next time you re in the mood to get down and dirty with some sauce heavy Chinese or BBQ crack one open and make it Doggie Style kind of night Malts CaramelHops Northern Brewer Cascade Citra SimcoeYeast American AleIBU

Mosaic Promise showcases two unique ingredients Mosaic hops and Golden Promise malt The versatility of the hop pleasing aroma and flavor characteristics and the traditional barley depth of flavor comprise this clean rich golden beer We can brew complex beers with the best of them but we recognize that there is also beauty in simplicity

Our signature American pale ale balances light crisp malt character with an abundance of hop derived aromatics and flavors from the use of Citra and Columbus The fragrant nose is fresh citrus tropical fruit and peach Bold flavors of pineapple and mango mix with dank notes of zesty citrus and fresh pine needles With the smooth mouthfeel gentle bitterness and dry finish Fort Point is our standard daily drinker MALT American row Barley White Wheat DextrineHOPS Citra Columbus
A smooth medium bodied session beer with bright citrus hop aroma and finish Our interpretation of an American Mild Ale IBU

Pale is brewed to exemplify the classic California pale ale style hence the name honoring the Golden State as the st state to be admitted to the Union Beautiful ﬂoral and citrus hop aromas greet the nose with undertones of lightly toasted malt Crisp pale and crystal malts oﬀer hint of sweetness Subtle hop bitterness oﬀers refreshing ﬁnish Perfect for sunny day at the beach or barbecue with friends Pale represents the bold yet approachable spirit that embodies our state

Drawn from one of our oldest recipes Smitten Ale began as part of series of rye beers at our Eccentric Café The combination of sharp citrus resinous flavors from the hops with the earthy rustic overtones of the rye malt contribution yield an interesting take on the American Pale Ale

From the dawn of time humans have looked to the sky for answers Space Station Middle Finger replies to all from its eternal orbit Behold and enjoy Space Station Middle Finger bright golden American Pale Ale IBU

This version of our signature American pale ale is dry hopped with the pungent Galaxy variety Enticingly hazy and blonde in appearance with frothy carb the nose erupts with strong citrus passion fruit and pineapple aromatics Upfront and resinous hop derived flavors of grapefruit pith peach and mango are balanced with subtle bready malt character and mild subdued bitterness MALT American row Barley White Wheat DextrineHOPS Galaxy Columbus
Congratulations Welcome to flavor country This most recent FFF pale ale has just the malt backbone to support an explosive juicy hop profile derived from new blend of proprietary hops Cheers IBU

This double dry hopped pale ale contains the same base ingredients for both malt and hops as Fort Point Pale Ale but with an additional dry hop of Citra The added hops richly enhance the juicy tropical fruit flavors of pineapple mango create elevated green herbaceous aromatics and increase body MALT American row Barley White Wheat DextrineHOPS Citra Columbus

The people of Tampa Bay have fallen prey to Pirate invasion every year for well over years After more than century of failing to repel these seafaring raiders in their anachronistic wooden ships despite access to modern sea land and air arsenals that ostensibly should make short work of wind powered vessels equipped with naught but cast iron cannons and raging scurvy it occurred to the folks of Cigar City Brewing that if you can beat them start saying Arrrr Matey And so we have brewed Invasion Pale Ale With tropical notes of mango and tangerine imparted by Simcoe and Mosaic hops this crisp and sessionable Pale Ale is perfect companion for long days of marauding pillaging and pirating

We took some fresh Sanguinello blood oranges juiced em concentrated that juice without heat and threw it into wheatier version of our New Dogtown Pale Ale The end result refreshingly hopped pale ish ale with huge citrus burst The man bent over his guitar shearsman of sorts The day was green They said You have blue guitar you do not play things as they are The man replied Things as they are Are changed upon the blue guitar And they said then But play you must tune beyond us yet ourselves tune upon the blue guitar of things exactly as they are He sighs cannot bring world quite round although patch it as can sing hero head large eye and bearded bronze but not man although patch him as can and reach through him almost to man If to serenade almost to man is to miss by that things as they are say it is the serenade of man that plays blue guitar These the words of the Conjurer in Chief Wallace Stevens describe in perfect detail the work of brewer as he sits to write new recipe Perfection is the goal to fill desire for perfect beer Yet the instrument of his mind and that of the brewhouse and yeast are the fallible tools at hand And so he patches it as he can little hop here little citrus there yeast to marry the two the worty substrate of reality calling the key and time signature The beer that comes will be the beer we drink the beer whose story we will tell here The brewer does what he can and imagines world quite round Conjurer in Chief Stevens concludes Exceeding music must take the place of empty heaven and its hymns What does it all have to do with beer

Beer is made by creating liquid rich with fermentable material Yeast living organism is added to the liquid The yeast floats around the fermenter gobbling up soluble sugar converting that energy into alcohol It a volatile active environment During this time the beer is literally alive Citra Hopped Live is bright refreshing loud We cranked this pale ale up to by adding generous amount of Citra hops With that in mind we wanted the label to reflect the feeling of live music Live pairs great with toe tapping or head banging to your favorite band on stage IBU

Throughout the epic battle the Ninjas and the Unicorns have been waiting for something anything to tip the scale in their favor After all The Unicorns and The Ninjas have been fighting this epic battle for nearly and epoch In this age old battle will the Lizard King be the one to end the battle Will there finally be peace among the two warring parties Will this be the end of rhetorical questions
Pale Ale inspired by the Grateful Dead made with granola wildflower honey

Our Grunion Pale Ale wasn born on beach but in backyard Originating from an employee only home brew contest this award winning hoppy pale ale is named after the tiny local fish known for late night frolics on shore pair of new hop varieties lend strong yet balanced summer melon aromas and herbal flavors while soft caramel malt sweetness holds it all together
IBU

A tiny beautiful something showcases new hop variety El Dorado We started playing around with this hop last year We brewed pilot batch with this hop exclusively and one with it blended with some of our other favorite Northwest varieties In the end we decided that the El Dorado had such unique and interesting character on its own so we decided to brew it as single hop pale ale The aroma and flavor offer intense candied orange and citrus zest touch of flaked oats provide rounded silky mouthfeel And like our other hoppy offerings tiny was brewed to finish dry and clean

Officially American previously an English pale ale we ve converted this beer over to an American style Pale Ale We ve dialed UP the hop profile adding more focus to American style hops like Cascade Chinook Citra and Willamette Hop Infusion every drop of beer is exposed to our hop slurry as the beer passes from fermentation to aging resulting in more brilliant cleaner hop character Saranac Pale Ale foundation was built on the tried and true English varieties Golding and Fuggles We brighten Pale Ale with the three s strong focus on Citra complimented by Cascade and Chinook We then bridge the old world with the new with the two most distinctive hops Bramling Cross and Jester both descendants of English and North American varieties Malts Crystal Two RowHops Bramling Cross Jester Citra Cascade ChinookOriginal Gravity PlatoIBU

Boat Beer is designed to be complex enough to merit drinking few without being crippled by alcohol Kolsch yeast and German malts are combined to be crisp and refreshing while generous amount of American hops have been added to keep it remarkable Expect it to dance out of the glass with whack of grapefruit and open into crisp stony tangle of white and yellow fruit with pine and moss notes An IPA for everyday drinking drink boat beer when you are thirsty from softball fishing or explaining why your team is best Session AleABV IBU SRM http www youtube com watch NYLRXRjCqc

Introducing Lights On modern American Pale Ale brewed to celebrate new beginning here at Tree House Lights On pours gorgeous hazy orange in the glass releasing an aroma filled with bounty of sweet fresh fruit We taste papaya guava and mango fresh and distinctive flavor profile that wholly Tree House Buoyed by soft and fluffy mouthfeel Lights On is delight to drink We re excited to share it with you

Row Hill is pale ale brewed with Simcoe hops selected from the three original Simcoe growing families in Yakima WA referenced on the front of this label We have forged not only long lasting partnerships but friendships with these families and cherish our annual visits during the hop harvest each fall Row Hill has classic Simcoe aroma with notes of grapefruit and pine with lingering hoppy finish

With this distinctively dank Fort Point variant we feature Mosaic in the dry hop Pouring faintly cloudy canary gold Mosaic Fort Point emits fragrant nose of herbal woodsy hop passion fruit and zesty meyer lemon Thirst quenching flavors of juicy mango peppy citrus and earthy hop entwine on the palate with the familiar biscuity mouthfeel medium body and bone dry finish of our signature pale ale MALT American row Barley White Wheat DextrineHOPS Mosaic Columbus
Honey color bright American hop aroma citrus flavor light crisp body

A mystical legend echoes in our brew house that of St Lupulin loop you lin the archetypal hophead He devoted endless summers to endless rows of hops tending to the flowers and the beloved resin within lupulin Extraordinary oils in this yellow resin provide this dry hopped extra pale ale with an undeniably pleasing floral aroma and clean crisp finish One sip of this seasonal summer ale and you too will believe
New England pale ale citrus forward and refreshing

Orval beer is high fermentation beer The ageing process adds fruity note which strikes subtle balance between the beer full bodied yet complex flavour and bitterness The beer was first brewed in and owes its unparalleled taste to the quality of the water the hops and the yeast used The brewery has selected very aromatic and unique hop varieties which hark back to the first brewmaster of Orval who hailed from Bavaria The beer aromas are very pronounced while maintaining the right level of bitterness thanks to the English method of dry hopping The various stages of fermentation combined fermentation with the original yeast and with wild yeast followed by fermentation in the bottle mean the beer must age for some time and requires numerous quality controls

Rare Vos Amber Ale is styled after the smooth drinkable beers popular in Belgian cafés It pours light copper hue contrasting beautifully with big creamy white head The nose offers orange blossoms and slight spice On the palate the caramel maltiness shines strongly but with little sweetness The profile leans toward dry fruity yeast affiliated slightly fruity hoppy with beguiling spiciness This complex medium bodied beer has smooth mid palate and moderate dry finish Well balanced in all elements it a mild mellow brew

America first Trappist beer Our recipe was inspired by the traditional refectory ales known as patersbier fathers beer in Flemish These sessionable beers are brewed by the monks for their dinner table and are typically only available at the monastery Spencer is full bodied golden hued ale with fruity accents dry finish and light hop bitterness The beer is unfiltered and unpasteurized preserving live yeast that naturally carbonates the beer in the bottle and keg and contributes to the beer flavor and aroma

A citrusy and refreshing Belgian style pale ale hopped with Cascade Citra and whole Crystal hops for massive aromas and flavors Fermented with our Belgian Wit yeast for an extra dose of complexity this one is very drinkable and extremely aromatic
Unibroue introduced Raftman to the Quebec market in March This coral hued beer has unique taste that combines the smooth character of smoked malt whisky with the flavours of fine yeast IBU
Formerly Zotten but taken off the market in Feb in copyright infringement agreement between Weyerbacher and Bierbrouwerij De Halve Maan

Light golden in color but packed with flavor This Belgo American Ale is bursting with the spicy aromas and flavors created by the unique imported yeast strain Fermented at higher temperatures this beer throws off notes of clove banana and citrus fruit Light in color but big on flavor
Light blonde with alc generously hopped with the finest aromatic hops giving it very refreshing character and scent reminiscent of citrus

The Citizen Belgian Ale is inspired by the timeless Tripel style ales of Belgium Using traditional high gravity Abbey yeast strain that encourages the production of highly palatable ethanol notes supported by Aromatic and The Citizen also exhibits the noble hop spiciness that is common to most Belgian Ales Reigning in at ABV this is the Brau strongest offering in our flagship portfolio Become Citizen of the world one sip at time

Formerly known as Dark Horse Amber AleWhile the malt and hops give this beer an amazing copper color medium body and smooth mouth feel it the yeast that sets this one apart from other amber ales Inspired by Belgium beer women and mussels we thought it would be cool to give our Amber little Belgian touch We accomplish this by using an almost Belgian yeast strain producing similar esters and flavors commonly found in more traditional Belgian beers

Unfiltered unpasteurized and uninhibited Hardywood Singel is feat in balance Sunshine golden with fluffy head and veil of Belgian ale yeast Singel tropical fruit esters complement its spicy hop aromatics Delicate in body Singel mellow dry finish culminates truly ethereal experience Hardywood Singel stylistic inspiration originates with the Trappist brewers of western Europe who are often celebrated for their gloriously complex dubbels and tripels and whose devotion to crafting heavenly libations is second to none Unknown to many some of the Trappist brewers also brew milder ale for daily consumption within the walls of the monastery Hardywood Singel is our interpretation of this style IBU
A Brett finished version of our Devotion Ale Saint Devotion is bottle conditioned with brettanomyces to deepen the layers of flavor on our most hop forward beer from Lost Abbey lineup
A Belgian style Pale Ale that hoppy refreshing thirst quenching and below ABV Yes it is Bruery beer

he Cuvée des Trolls was created in in the tanks of microbrewery Le Brasse Temps which was established in Louvain la Neuve by Brasserie Dubuisson It is an unfiltered blonde beer with natural cloud The beer is produced using only yeast malt hops sugar and water and has an alcohol volume of Thanks to the addition of dried orange peel during the boiling process the beer has very pleasant fruity aromas that are in beautiful harmony with its delicate fully rounded taste

We named this beer to honor the rich tradition of farming in the sixteen counties of Maine We brew the beer with malted Maine grown barley unmalted Maine grown red wheat and Maine grown organic oats Sixteen Counties has bright copper hue with aromas of lemon rind flowers and candied grapefruit The first sip opens with herbal hop notes wheat cracker and citrus and ends with balanced dry finish

A dry hopped Belgian Pale Ale which defies tradition by combining Chinook and Columbus hops in the kettle dry hop addition of Simcoe Cascade and Mt Hood Hops American malts and Belgian yeast strain The result is beer with earthy and spicy tones from the yeast and slight orange note contributed by the hops

While Hoppy Table Beer was inspired by the Belgian tradition of low ABV easily drinkable beers it still occupies hop forward spot all its own Brewed with our row malt blend Maris Otter malt and oats the beer is then spiced with subtle addition of coriander We ferment it with our house yeast for classic Belgian citrus aromas Hoppy Table Beer is hopped with Chinook Cascade Comet and Azacca hops then dry hopped with more Comet and Azacca mildly hoppy aroma full of grapefruit springs from this straw colored light bodied ale Flavors of pine and stone fruit balance the beer clean slightly bitter finish

There is an old familiar saying in the wine business It takes lot of great beer to make great wine Winemakers cellar workers and grape pickers alike rarely if ever reach for nice big glass of red wine in the middle of harvest Wine is quite delicious but not very refreshing on hot summer day The beverage of choice during harvest is BEER Ice cold refreshing and thirst quenching BEER The beer in this bottle is toast to our winemaking friends who work around the clock during harvest to make world class wine right here in our own back yard Cheers Brewed with blend of California ale yeast and saison yeast

This straw colored beer greets with an aroma of noble hops pears and Belgian esters The flavor follows nicely with moderately spicy hop and Belgian yeast effect buoyed by soft malt body The finish is crisp and dry We enjoy this beer with spicy foods grilled steaks grilled chicken and mandarin salad Where you take it is only limited by your imagination For those interested in styles the name of this beer comes from the color over trying to meet any particular style

Our Belgian Style Golden Ale opens with fruity nose and rounded sweetness that compose pale and balanced beer Hallertau hops lend hint of spice that balances the aroma and flavor of orchard fruit Similar to our Belgian Tripel but with lighter body and crisper finish it is the perfect introduction to the family of Belgian beers renowned for their complexity and delicacy Beers from this region reflected the diversity of Belgium itself nation that has three official languages Dutch French and German Bordering Germany and France Belgian ales incorporate the complex flavors of French wine into the German brewing heritage In Post World War II Europe Belgian brewers developed golden strong ales to compete with the rising popularity of lighter Pilsner style beers IBU
Formerly LeonLeon is whole cone hopped and fermented dry using champagne yeast The yeast and the hops Amarillo Simcoe in combination with variety of malts

Monks Ale is distinctly fruity and spicy The yeast lends note of clove and in combination with the malt hints of plum and apricot The malt itself provides honeyish quality up front round fullness in the middle and the hops together with our pure brewing water lend clean dry finish IBU

Boddingtons Pub Ale is higher ABV version of Boddingtons Bitter brewed for Export Markets Boddingtons has been enjoyed by beer drinkers in England for more than years and is well known for its creamy head and smooth body Boddingtons is refreshing smooth beer renowned for its golden colour full bodied flavour and malty moreish taste with smooth tight creamy head

DBA k Double Barrel Ale is the trailblazing ﬂagship beer that started it all for us back in Partially fermented in our patented Firestone Union oak barrel brewing system DBA quickly took the Central Coast by storm and set the pace for future beers to come Today DBA is regarded as California classic and stands as an iconic tribute to traditional cask fermented English ales Pale malts create smooth middle with ribbons of caramel English toﬀee and toasted oak
A classic pale ale This version of Bass for the North American market at to comply with USA ale regulations

Old Speckled Hen is popular with ale drinkers up and down the country and renowned for its unique character and consistent quality The great British ale was first brewed to commemorate the th anniversary of the MG car factory in Abingdon Oxfordshire It was even named after the factory old run around car which was often parked outside the paint shop Spattered in paint the car became known as the Owld Speckl Un The eagle eyed might even see the resemblance between MG logo and the Old Speckled Hen label More than years on the great premium ale continues to be finely balanced beer with distinctive rich malty taste and fruity aroma

Summer in Brooklyn is all about following your impulses winging it from beaches and barbecues to stoops and rooftops Brooklyn Summer Ale is refreshing flavorful pale ale made to accompany you on all your warm weather adventures IBU
